original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo la yod par mi 'dzin pas na sgro btags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo la yod par mi 'dzin pas na sgro btags pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not an exaggeration, because it does not grasp what is imagined as existent.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mthar ma lhung bas na mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mthar ma lhung bas na mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: It is sameness, because it does not fall into the extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byed pa ni mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byed pa ni mnyam pa ste /
translated: It is sameness, because it distinguishes the various aspects of signs such as form and sound.

original: chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin du tshul bzhin gyis khong du chud pa la de lta bur 'byed pa med pas mi mnyam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin du tshul bzhin gyis khong du chud pa la de lta bur 'byed pa med pas mi mnyam pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not difference, because it is not distinguished in that way in the correct comprehension of the inexpressible nature of all things.

original: ji ltar bsgrubs pa bzhin du 'bras bu 'thob ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrubs pa bzhin du 'bras bu 'thob ste /
translated: It is the truth of words, because one obtains the result in accordance with how one has practiced.

original: mi slu bas na bden pa'i tshig go ;üîΩ/'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin pa'am /
analyzed: mi slu bas na bden pa'i tshig go ; /'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin pa'am /
translated: It is the truth of words, because it is not deceptive.üîΩIt is the words of reality, because it is the domain of the noble ones.

original: tshad ma gsum dang mi 'gal bas yang dag pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: tshad ma gsum dang mi 'gal bas yang dag pa'i tshig go //
translated: Or, it is the words of reality, because it is not contradicted by the three means of valid knowledge.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: It is the words of reality, because it is not changed by the eight worldly concerns.

original: yang na chos rnams kyi rang bzhin don dam pa skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba rtogs par byed pa'i tshul bzhin yang mi 'gyur ba'i tshig ces bya'o ;
analyzed: yang na chos rnams kyi rang bzhin don dam pa skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba rtogs par byed pa'i tshul bzhin yang mi 'gyur ba'i tshig ces bya'o ;
translated: Or else, it is the way to realize the ultimate nature of phenomena, which is free from arising and cessation.

original: / phyir bya ba ni gnyen po'i chos kyis sbyang zhing gtang dgos pa ste /
analyzed: / phyir bya ba ni gnyen po'i chos kyis sbyang zhing gtang dgos pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúunalterable‚Äù means that it is to be purified and relinquished by the practice of the antidotes.

original: tshul bzhin de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gzhan sbyong ba'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gzhan sbyong ba'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: It is the correct way to purify all other defiled phenomena, for it is the antidote.

original: de la gzhan gang gis kyang sbyang zhing gtang mi dgos pas na phyir bya ba med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de la gzhan gang gis kyang sbyang zhing gtang mi dgos pas na phyir bya ba med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Since it does not need to be purified or relinquished by anything else, it is the word ‚Äúunalterable.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / de gnyis ka'i gong ma theg pa chen po'i lam gyis spang par bya ba'i skyon spangs pas zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / de gnyis ka'i gong ma theg pa chen po'i lam gyis spang par bya ba'i skyon spangs pas zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúpeaceful‚Äù means that it is free from the faults that are to be eliminated by the mundane path, the supramundane path, and the Mahayana path, which is superior to both of those. It is also free from the faults that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs su rtog pa'i spros pa med pas spros pa med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs su rtog pa'i spros pa med pas spros pa med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúwithout conceptual elaboration‚Äù mean that there is no conceptual elaboration of various phenomena that are adverse or remedial.

original: ji ltar mi rtog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rtog ce na /
translated: How is it non-conceptual?

original: 'degs pa med pa dang / gzhag pa med pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'degs pa med pa dang / gzhag pa med pa zhes smos te /
translated: It is said to be ‚Äúwithout lifting up and without putting down.‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos glo bur ba gdegs shing bsal du yang med la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos glo bur ba gdegs shing bsal du yang med la /
translated: The phenomena of affliction are adventitious, and there is nothing to lift up and remove.

original: rnam par byad pa'i chos sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba gsar du bsnan cing gzhag tu yang med par tshul bzhin gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩphung po lnga dang / khams bco brgyad dang / skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa ji snyed yod pa dang / de dag nyid kyang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ma lus pa dang /üîΩphyin ci ma log par tshul bzhin gyis rtogs pas na ma tshad pa @101a * //
analyzed: rnam par byad pa'i chos sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba gsar du bsnan cing gzhag tu yang med par tshul bzhin gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro // phung po lnga dang / khams bco brgyad dang / skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa ji snyed yod pa dang / de dag nyid kyang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ma lus pa dang / phyin ci ma log par tshul bzhin gyis rtogs pas na ma tshad pa @101a * //
translated: The phenomena of purification, the luminous nature of mind, are not newly added and put down.üîΩIt is the words ‚Äúwithout excess‚Äù because it is the correct realization of the extent of all that exists, such as the five aggregates, eighteen elements, and twelve sense spheres, and of the way things are, such as their impermanence and suffering, without exception.

original: med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: med pa'i tshig go //
translated: It is the words ‚Äúwithout excess‚Äù because it is the correct realization of the extent of all that exists, such as the five aggregates, eighteen elements, and twelve sense spheres, and of the way things are, such as their impermanence and suffering, without exception.

original: bdag la sogs pa dngos po med pa'i rnams yod bar sgro btags nas shes pa'i yul du 'jal ba ni lhag pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa dngos po med pa'i rnams yod bar sgro btags nas shes pa'i yul du 'jal ba ni lhag pa ste /
translated: The excess is the superimposition of the existence of things such as a self, and the evaluation of them as objects of consciousness.

original: tshul bzhin de ltar mi 'jal bas lhag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin de ltar mi 'jal bas lhag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not an excess because it is not evaluated in that way.

original: bsal zhing bsnyigs pa ni phyir dbyung ba ste /
analyzed: bsal zhing bsnyigs pa ni phyir dbyung ba ste /
translated: The removal and the dregs are the expulsion.

original: tshul bzhin shes pa thams cad kyi snying po yin pas de ltar byar med pa'i phyir dbyung du med pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin shes pa thams cad kyi snying po yin pas de ltar byar med pa'i phyir dbyung du med pa'o //
translated: It is not to be expelled because it is the essence of all correct knowledge and cannot be done.

original: tshul bzhin dang mi mthun pa mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni gnyen po ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin dang mi mthun pa mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa la sogs pa ni gnyen po ste /
translated: The remedy is the impermanence of what is not correct, such as the apprehension of permanence.

original: de dag 'dis spangs pas na gnyen po med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'dis spangs pas na gnyen po med pa'o //
translated: It is without remedy because it abandons those.

original: theg pa mchog gi lam du zhugs pa'i tshul bzhin gyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa khong du chud de /
analyzed: theg pa mchog gi lam du zhugs pa'i tshul bzhin gyis gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa khong du chud de /
translated: The word holy refers to the correct engagement in the path of the supreme vehicle, which is the comprehension of the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa mchog rnams las kyang dam par gyur bas na dam pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa mchog rnams las kyang dam par gyur bas na dam pa'i tshig go //
translated: It is holy because it is superior to the supreme listeners, solitary realizers, and so on.

original: de kho na'i tshig ces bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i tshig ces bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The word reality refers to the teaching.

original: lhag ma bzhi ni bshad pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma bzhi ni bshad pa ste /
translated: The other four are explained as follows.

original: rtag tu de bzhin du gnas shing rnam par mi 'jig pas de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba dang phyin ci log tu gyur ba med pas ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: rtag tu de bzhin du gnas shing rnam par mi 'jig pas de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba dang phyin ci log tu gyur ba med pas ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: Since it always exists that way and does not perish, it is thusness. Since it is not mistaken and does not err, it is nonerroneous thusness. Since it does not change into something else, it is unchanging thusness.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yin pas ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yin pas ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is the nature of all phenomena, it is called the way things are.

original: chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de lta bur shes par byed pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de lta bur shes par byed pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The correct mental activity that causes one to understand the thusness of the nature of all phenomena is also called thusness.

original: yang na de kho na la sogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam grangs kyi tshig yin te /
analyzed: yang na de kho na la sogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam grangs kyi tshig yin te /
translated: Or, thusness and so on are terms that are synonyms for the dharmadhatu.

original: de bas na dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las /
analyzed: de bas na dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las /
translated: Therefore, in the Ratnamegha-sutra it says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bas gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bas gsol pa /
translated: The bodhisattva Sarva¬≠shvara said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de kho na zhes bgyi ba ci lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de kho na zhes bgyi ba ci lags /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavan, what is thusness?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, it is like this:

original: de kho na zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i don gyi tshig bla dgas so //
analyzed: de kho na zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i don gyi tshig bla dgas so //
translated: ‚ÄòThatness‚Äô is a term for the meaning of reality.

original: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa zhes bgyi ba ci lags /
analyzed: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa zhes bgyi ba ci lags /
translated: ‚Äù He asked, ‚ÄúBlessed One, what is ‚Äòreality‚Äô?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gang de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is suchness, unmistaken suchness, and unaltered suchness.‚Äù

original: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid ces bgyi ba ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: gsol ba / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid ces bgyi ba ji lta bu lags /
translated: He asked, ‚ÄúBlessed One, what is ‚Äòsuchness‚Äô?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rigs kyi bu chos 'di dag ni so so rang gis rig pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos 'di dag ni so so rang gis rig pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, these phenomena are to be known individually.

original: de dag la yi ges gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag la yi ges gdags par mi nus so //
translated: They cannot be designated by letters.

original: ci'i phyir @101b zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir @101b zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: chos de dag ni yi ge thams cad las shin tu 'das pa brjod pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: chos de dag ni yi ge thams cad las shin tu 'das pa brjod pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: Because these phenomena are beyond all letters, beyond all expressions,

original: tshig gi spyod yul thams cad las shin tu 'das pa tshig gi lam thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: tshig gi spyod yul thams cad las shin tu 'das pa tshig gi lam thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: It is beyond all objects of speech and beyond all verbal expressions.

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: phye ba dang btsums pa thams cad dang / rtog ge thams cad dang bral ba ;
analyzed: phye ba dang btsums pa thams cad dang / rtog ge thams cad dang bral ba ;
translated: It is beyond all opening and closing, and beyond all speculation.

original: rtog ge thams cad kyis brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: rtog ge thams cad kyis brtag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa /
translated: It is not an object that can be investigated by any kind of speculation.

original: mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma'i spyod yul thams cad las yongs su 'das pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma'i spyod yul thams cad las yongs su 'das pa /
translated: It is beyond all objects of signs, since it is signless.

original: byis pa'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa /üîΩbdud thams cad kyi spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: byis pa'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa / bdud thams cad kyi spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: It is beyond the domain of childish beings.üîΩIt is beyond the domain of all mƒÅras.

original: nyon mongs pa'i spyod yul thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i spyod yul thams cad las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: It is beyond the domain of all afflictions.

original: rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa /
translated: It is beyond the domain of consciousness.

original: mi gnas pa /
analyzed: mi gnas pa /
translated: It is not a place.

original: gnas ma yin pa /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa /
translated: It is not a location.

original: zhi ba 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul /
analyzed: zhi ba 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul /
translated: It is the domain of the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: de dag nyid kyis so sor rang gis rig par bya ba /üîΩdri ma med pa /üîΩdang ba / dag pa /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis so sor rang gis rig par bya ba / dri ma med pa / dang ba / dag pa /
translated: It is to be individually cognized by the noble ones themselves.üîΩIt is stainless.üîΩIt is pure.

original: gya nom pa /
analyzed: gya nom pa /
translated: It is immaculate.

original: rtag pa / brtan pa /
analyzed: rtag pa / brtan pa /
translated: It is permanent, stable,üîΩ

original: rgyun du gnas pa /
analyzed: rgyun du gnas pa /
translated: It is permanent, stable,üîΩand endures as long as eternity.

original: 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i chos de /
analyzed: 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i chos de /
translated: It is not subject to destruction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: Whether the Tathagatas arise or

original: ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: ma byung yang rung /
translated: do not arise,

original: chos kyi dbyings ni gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the Dharma-element abides.

original: byang chub nges par thob pa ni chud mi za ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub nges par thob pa ni chud mi za ba ste /
translated: The attainment of enlightenment is not wasted,

original: tshul bzhin gyis byang chub thob par byed pas chud mi za ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: tshul bzhin gyis byang chub thob par byed pas chud mi za ba'i tshig go //
translated: because it is the cause of the attainment of enlightenment.üîΩThe limit of reality is the ultimate,

original: yang dag pa nyid da kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i mthar thug pas yang dag pa'i mtha'i tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid da kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i mthar thug pas yang dag pa'i mtha'i tshig go //
translated: because it is the ultimate of non-erroneous reality.üîΩThe vision of the three times is the vision of the three times as they are,

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba dus gsum bdag nyid thams cad du mi dmigs pas dus gsum yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ni dus gsum mnyam pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba dus gsum bdag nyid thams cad du mi dmigs pas dus gsum yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ni dus gsum mnyam pa'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: because it is the non-apprehension of the three times in any of their aspects.

original: ji ltar mnyam zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mnyam zhe na /
translated: How are they the same?

original: dus yongs su ma chad pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: dus yongs su ma chad pa zhes smos te /
translated: They are said to be uninterrupted.

original: 'dus byad kyi chos kyi phung po la sogs pa skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i sgo nas dus gsum du gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dus byad kyi chos kyi phung po la sogs pa skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i sgo nas dus gsum du gdags par zad kyi /
translated: The three times are merely imputed in dependence on the aggregates of form and so on, which arise, endure, and cease.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la ni de lta bu dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la ni de lta bu dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consummate characteristic is not classified in that way.

original: gzugs la rnam par shes pa mi gnas pa la sogs pas dus gsum gyi chos 'dus byas rnams la ma chags pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs la rnam par shes pa mi gnas pa la sogs pas dus gsum gyi chos 'dus byas rnams la ma chags pa'am /
translated: The statement that consciousness does not dwell on form and so on indicates that the three times are not attached to conditioned phenomena orüîΩthat they are not fixated on them as entities of names and signs.

original: de dag la ming dang / mtshan ma'i bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa ni tshul bzhin yin par ston te /üîΩji ltar so so'i skye bo dag kun brtags pa'i gzugs la rnam par shes pas rnam pa @102a * //
analyzed: de dag la ming dang / mtshan ma'i bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa ni tshul bzhin yin par ston te / ji ltar so so'i skye bo dag kun brtags pa'i gzugs la rnam par shes pas rnam pa @102a * //
translated: This is taught in a way that accords with reality.üîΩOrdinary beings conceive of imagined form in various ways through consciousness and they are fixated on it as being its nature.

original: sna tshogs su rtog cing de'i bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa de ltar mi byed pas /
analyzed: sna tshogs su rtog cing de'i bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa de ltar mi byed pas /
translated: They do not do that,

original: gzugs la rnam par shes pa mi gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs la rnam par shes pa mi gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: so it is said that consciousness does not dwell on form.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang de dang 'dra bar bshad do //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang de dang 'dra bar bshad do //
translated: The same is explained for the remaining phenomena such as feeling.

original: de ni don la rton pa'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas tshul bzhin de tshig 'bru dang / gang zag dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bkri ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton gyi so sor rton pa bzhi la brten zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni don la rton pa'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas tshul bzhin de tshig 'bru dang / gang zag dang / rnam par shes pa dang / bkri ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton gyi so sor rton pa bzhi la brten zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase that is a statement that relies on the meaning and so on indicate that one should rely on the four kinds of proper reliance, not on the letter, the individual, the sutras of interpretable meaning, or consciousness.üîΩ In another way, the phrase that is a statement that relies on the meaning means that one should rely on the Dharma, not on the person.üîΩ The phrase that is a statement that relies on the teaching means that one should rely on the sutras of definitive meaning, not on those of interpretable meaning.

original: bsod nams ma yin bar nye par 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin bar nye par 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed do //
translated: formative forces leading to evil destinies, formative forces leading to good destinies, and formative forces leading to the immovable.

original: rnam par shes pa ni sa bon thams cad kyi rten rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni sa bon thams cad kyi rten rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the consciousness of the store of seeds, i.e. the consciousness that is the retribution of all the seeds.

original: ming ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: ming ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: Name is the aggregates of sensation, ideation, the formative forces and consciousness.

original: gzugs ni bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: gzugs ni bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa 'am /
translated: Form is that which is capable of action and is resistant, orüîΩthat which is not capable of action and is resistant, or

original: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa ste /
analyzed: bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa ste /
translated: that which is not capable of action and is not resistant.

original: de gnyis gcig tu bsdus na ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o//
analyzed: de gnyis gcig tu bsdus na ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o//
translated: When these two are combined, they are called name-and-form.

original: @104a * // skye mched drug ni mig gi skye mched nas yid kyi skye mched kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: @104a * // skye mched drug ni mig gi skye mched nas yid kyi skye mched kyi bar du'o //
translated: The six sense-fields are from the eye-sense-field up until the mind-sense-field.

original: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du dus mnyam du tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du dus mnyam du tshogs pa'o //
translated: Contact is the simultaneous coming together of the object, the sense-faculty and consciousness in the nature of cause and effect.

original: tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rnams so //
translated: Feeling is pleasant, unpleasant, and neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: sred pa ni yul dang longs spyod la rgyun du spyod kyang tshva chu 'thung ba dang 'dra bar ngoms pa dang tshim pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni yul dang longs spyod la rgyun du spyod kyang tshva chu 'thung ba dang 'dra bar ngoms pa dang tshim pa med pa'o //
translated: Craving is the insatiable desire for objects and enjoyments, like a thirsty person who drinks salt water.üîΩClinging is the clinging to desire, the clinging to morality and vows, the clinging to views, the clinging to the doctrine of self, and the clinging to rites and rituals.

original: len pa ni 'dod pa len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs len pa dang / lta ba len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba len pa dang / srid pa ni 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: len pa ni 'dod pa len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs len pa dang / lta ba len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba len pa dang / srid pa ni 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o //
translated: Existence is the existence of desire, the existence of form, and the existence of the formless.

original: skye ba ni las kyi bag chags rnam pa sna tshogs bsags pa'i khyad par las nying mtshams sbyor ba de dang de dag tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa mngon par grub pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni las kyi bag chags rnam pa sna tshogs bsags pa'i khyad par las nying mtshams sbyor ba de dang de dag tu phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa mngon par grub pa'o //
translated: Birth is the manifestation of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases in such and such rebirths due to the accumulation of various karmic tendencies.

original: dga' ba ni mer mer po dang / nur nur po dang / mkhrang gyur pa dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa nas gzhon nu dang / lang tsho dang / dar la bab pa'i stobs dang / mthu dang gzi brjid dang / mdangs la sogs pa rab tu gzhan du gyur te nyams pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni mer mer po dang / nur nur po dang / mkhrang gyur pa dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa nas gzhon nu dang / lang tsho dang / dar la bab pa'i stobs dang / mthu dang gzi brjid dang / mdangs la sogs pa rab tu gzhan du gyur te nyams pa'o //
translated: Joy is the transformation of the power, strength, splendor, luster, and so on of the embryo, the oval, the oblong, the limbs extending, youth, adulthood, and maturity into their opposite, which is their destruction.

original: shi ba ni tshe dang drod dang / rnam par shes pa med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shi ba ni tshe dang drod dang / rnam par shes pa med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Death is the absence of life, heat, and consciousness.

original: ma rig pa 'gog pa'i 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma rig pa 'gags pa la sogs pa 'khor pa las ldog pa'i rgyu rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang yang ma 'dres pa bstan te /üîΩma rig pa 'gags pa ni ma rig pa spang ba'am /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gog pa'i 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma rig pa 'gags pa la sogs pa 'khor pa las ldog pa'i rgyu rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang yang ma 'dres pa bstan te / ma rig pa 'gags pa ni ma rig pa spang ba'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cessation of ignorance does not coexist with the conditions for the arising of the twelve members‚Äù and so on shows that the cessation of ignorance and so on is not mixed with the dharmas of purification, which are the causes of the reversal of cyclic existence.üîΩThe cessation of ignorance is the abandonment of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa med par gyur nas de dang mi mthun pa'i rig pa skyes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa med par gyur nas de dang mi mthun pa'i rig pa skyes pa la bya'o //
translated: Or it is the arising of knowledge, which is incompatible with ignorance, after ignorance has been eliminated.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas log pa'i lta ba rnams dang ma 'dres pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas log pa'i lta ba rnams dang ma 'dres pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot dwelling together with the companion of the view of the transitory collection‚Äù and so on teaches that the view of the bodhisattva is not mixed with wrong views.

original: de la 'jig tshogs zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can rnams phung po dang tshogs su gyur pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can rnams phung po dang tshogs su gyur pa la bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äútransitory collection‚Äù refers to the five aggregates of form and so on, which are by nature subject to destruction, and which are a collection and a heap.

original: de la bdag yod par lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la bdag yod par lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The view that a self exists in relation to that is the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'jig @104b tshogs la lta ba de nyid rtsa ba yin pas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig @104b tshogs la lta ba de nyid rtsa ba yin pas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: Since that view of the transitory collection is the root, it is the root of the view of the transitory collection.

original: lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the cause of all the views.

original: lta ba de'i rtsa ba las byung ba ni lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis po'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: lta ba de'i rtsa ba las byung ba ni lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis po'i bar dag ste /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the root of the sixty-two views, which arise from that root.

original: lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis ni /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis ni /
translated: The sixty-two views are as follows:

original: rtag par lta ba dang / mtha' dang ; mtha' med par smra ba la sogs pa tshangs pa'i dra ba dang / lnga gsum pa la sogs pa las gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag par lta ba dang / mtha' dang ; mtha' med par smra ba la sogs pa tshangs pa'i dra ba dang / lnga gsum pa la sogs pa las gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand them as they are explained in the Brahmajala-sutra, the Panca-trimsa-pada-sastra, etc.

original: bar dag ces smos pas ni bdag tu lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu po gzugs la bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs bdag gi yin pa dang / gzugs la bdag gnas par lta ba dang / de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa phung po lhag ma bzhi la yang mthun mthun du sbyar te /
analyzed: bar dag ces smos pas ni bdag tu lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu po gzugs la bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs bdag gi yin pa dang / gzugs la bdag gnas par lta ba dang / de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa phung po lhag ma bzhi la yang mthun mthun du sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúbetween‚Äù indicates that the twenty peaks of the mountain of the view of a self are the view of form as a self, the view of a self as possessing form, the view of form as belonging to a self, the view of a self as dwelling in form, and similarly, the view of feeling, etc., as a self, the view of a self as possessing the remaining four aggregates, the view of the remaining four aggregates as belonging to a self, and the view of a self as dwelling in the remaining four aggregates.

original: de dag la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa thams cad dang lhan cig mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa lta bur gyur pa thams cad dang lhan cig mi gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot dwelling together with any of these views‚Äù means that one does not dwell with any of these views.

original: mthon dman ni 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: mthon dman ni 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The result is the high and low,

original: 'jig rten gyi chos ni rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos ni rgyu yin te /
translated: and the cause is the worldly dharmas.üîΩThus, one becomes conceited through gain, etc.,

original: 'di ltar rnyed pa la sogs pas ni mtho bar sems pa 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnyed pa la sogs pas ni mtho bar sems pa 'byung la /
translated: and one becomes depressed through loss, etc.

original: ma rnyed pa la sogs pa las mi dma' bar sems pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma rnyed pa la sogs pa las mi dma' bar sems pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the thought of not being inferior to those who have not obtained and so on arises.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po de dag gis sems khengs pa dang zhum par mi 'gyur bas na mthon dman gyi 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas pas na 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi bar gyi 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po de dag gis sems khengs pa dang zhum par mi 'gyur bas na mthon dman gyi 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas pas na 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi bar gyi 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since the mind does not swell or shrink due to those eight worldly dharmas, it does not coexist with the company of high and low. Therefore it is said that it does not coexist with the company of the eight worldly dharmas.

original: de la rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa ni chos gos dang ltung bzed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa ni chos gos dang ltung bzed la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, gain and loss are robes, alms bowls, and so on.

original: snyan pa dang mi snyan pa ni yon tan dang skyon rnams so //
analyzed: snyan pa dang mi snyan pa ni yon tan dang skyon rnams so //
translated: Fame and obscurity are qualities and faults.

original: smad pa dang bstod pa ni skyon smos pa dang / yon tan tshigs su bcad pas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: smad pa dang bstod pa ni skyon smos pa dang / yon tan tshigs su bcad pas brjod pa'o //
translated: Blame and praise are mentioning faults and expressing qualities in verse.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: Happiness and suffering are benefiting and harming body and mind.

original: khro ba dang khon du 'dzin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: khro ba dang khon du 'dzin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Anger and resentment...üîΩ...

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bar gyi 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas zhes bya ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres par bstan te /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bar gyi 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas zhes bya ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres par bstan te /
translated: He does not dwell together with any of the secondary defilements up to and including the subsidiary defilements.

original: nga rgyal yang sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i sgo nas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes gdags so //
analyzed: nga rgyal yang sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i sgo nas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes gdags so //
translated: Pride is also designated as a subsidiary defilement because it defiles the mind.

original: de la khro ba ni 'phral du gnod @105a * //üîΩpar byed pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de la khro ba ni 'phral du gnod @105a * // par byed pa la gnas te /
translated: Anger is the state of being ready to harm.

original: sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: It is the complete mental affliction.

original: khon du 'dzin pa ni khros pa'i 'og tu 'dis bdag la gnod pa 'di byas so zhes shar gnyer ba'i mdud par 'dzin pa mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa ni khros pa'i 'og tu 'dis bdag la gnod pa 'di byas so zhes shar gnyer ba'i mdud par 'dzin pa mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Bearing a grudge is the not letting go of the knot of resentment after anger, thinking, ‚ÄúThis person has harmed me.‚Äù

original: 'chab pa ni 'dun pa dang zhe sdang dang 'jigs pa la sogs pa bsal te /
analyzed: 'chab pa ni 'dun pa dang zhe sdang dang 'jigs pa la sogs pa bsal te /
translated: Concealment is the hiding of one‚Äôs own faults out of desire, hatred, fear, etc.

original: phan par 'dod pa'i gleng ba pos khyod 'di lta bu byed pa'o zhes bsnyad pa na kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o //
analyzed: phan par 'dod pa'i gleng ba pos khyod 'di lta bu byed pa'o zhes bsnyad pa na kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o //
translated: when one is being questioned by someone who wants to help, one conceals one‚Äôs offense.

original: yongs su gdung ba ni tshig brlang pos gzhan gyis sems gdung ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba ni tshig brlang pos gzhan gyis sems gdung ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Agitation is the mental distress of others caused by one's harsh words.

original: phrag dog ni pha rol po'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / rigs dang tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mthong nas zhe sdang gi char gtogs pa'i sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: phrag dog ni pha rol po'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / rigs dang tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mthong nas zhe sdang gi char gtogs pa'i sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
translated: Jealousy is the internal disturbance of mind belonging to the class of hatred, upon seeing the gain, honor, family, morality, learning, etc. of others.

original: ser sna ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen nas 'dod chags kyi sems kyis phyi dang nang gi dngos po mi gtong ba'o //üîΩrgyu ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas gzhan la bsams pas tshul khrims la sogs pa'i don gzhan du gnas la gzhan du ston pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen nas 'dod chags kyi sems kyis phyi dang nang gi dngos po mi gtong ba'o // rgyu ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas gzhan la bsams pas tshul khrims la sogs pa'i don gzhan du gnas la gzhan du ston pa'o //
translated: Stinginess is the non-giving of external and internal things due to a mind of attachment, out of greed for gain and honor.üîΩThe cause is the taking up of a method of concealing one's own faults, and the showing of oneself to others in a way different from the way one really is, through excessive attachment to gain and honor.üîΩ Slyness is the taking up of a method of concealing one's own faults, and the showing of oneself to others in a way different from the way one really is, through excessive attachment to gain and honor.

original: g-yo ni bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ste /
analyzed: g-yo ni bdag gi nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ste /
translated: Slyness is the taking up of a method of concealing one's own faults, and the showing of oneself to others in a way different from the way one really is, through excessive attachment to gain and honor.üîΩ Slyness is the taking up of a method of concealing one's own faults, and the showing of oneself to others in a way different from the way one really is, through excessive attachment to gain and honor.üîΩ Slyness is the taking up of a method of concealing one's own faults, and the showing of oneself to others in a way different from the way one really is, through excessive attachment to gain and honor.üîΩ Slyness is the taking up of a method of concealing one's own faults, and the showing of oneself to others in a way different from the way one really is, through excessive attachment to gain and honor.üîΩ Slyness is the taking up of a method of concealing one's own faults, and the showing of oneself to others in a way different from the way one really is, through excessive attachment to gain and honor.üîΩ Slyness is the taking up of a method of concealing one's own faults, and the showing of oneself to others in a way different from the way one really is, through excessive attachment to gain and honor.

original: gzhan nas gzhan du sgyur zhing gtam rlung la bskur ba dang gsal bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan nas gzhan du sgyur zhing gtam rlung la bskur ba dang gsal bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: Slyness is the taking up of a method of concealing one's own faults, and the showing of oneself to others in a way different from the way one really is, through excessive attachment to gain and honor.üîΩ Slyness

original: ngo tsha med pa ni las de dag gi cha ma yin par shes kyang kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzems pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa ni las de dag gi cha ma yin par shes kyang kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzems pa'o //
translated: Shamelessness is the lack of dread of the miserable states of existence and the lack of dread of sinful persons.

original: khrel med pa ni gzhan la kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzems pa'o //
analyzed: khrel med pa ni gzhan la kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzems pa'o //
translated: Lack of conscience is the lack of dread of sin.

original: khengs pa ni 'dod chags shas che ba'i dbang gis lus kyi 'gyur ba rkang lag brkyang ba dang / mgo 'phang bstod pa dang / smin ma bsdus pa dang / so gtsigs pa la sogs pa 'gying bar snang ba ste /
analyzed: khengs pa ni 'dod chags shas che ba'i dbang gis lus kyi 'gyur ba rkang lag brkyang ba dang / mgo 'phang bstod pa dang / smin ma bsdus pa dang / so gtsigs pa la sogs pa 'gying bar snang ba ste /
translated: Arrogance is the inflation of the mind due to attachment. It is the manifestation of the body and speech, such as stretching out the limbs, holding the head high, knitting the eyebrows, baring the teeth, etc.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bla ma la sogs pa la thal mo sbyar ba dang / 'dud pa la sogs pa'i las mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bla ma la sogs pa la thal mo sbyar ba dang / 'dud pa la sogs pa'i las mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is the lack of saluting, bowing down, etc. to preceptors, teachers, gurus, etc.

original: rtsod pa ni de dag gi rgyu las lus dang ngag gi las rdeg pa dang / 'ching ba dang / skyon smos pa dang mtshang 'dru ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa ni de dag gi rgyu las lus dang ngag gi las rdeg pa dang / 'ching ba dang / skyon smos pa dang mtshang 'dru ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: Quarrelsomeness is the cause of those, i.e., the bodily and vocal actions of beating, binding, accusing, and reviling, etc.

original: rgyags pa ni bdag gi rigs dang / nad med pa dang / gzugs dang lang tsho la sogs pa rang gi phun sum tshogs pa la dga' ba'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i srid pas sems rang dbang med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni bdag gi rigs dang / nad med pa dang / gzugs dang lang tsho la sogs pa rang gi phun sum tshogs pa la dga' ba'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i srid pas sems rang dbang med par byed pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is the inflation of the mind that occurs when one is attached to one's own good qualities of family, health, appearance, youth, etc., and one's mind becomes unbridled.

original: bag med pa ni @105b 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi dbang gis dge ba mi sgom zhing mi dge ba byed pa'o //üîΩnga rgyal ni rigs dang shes rgya dang nor la sogs pas dma' ba bas de dag gis bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa 'am /
analyzed: bag med pa ni @105b 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi dbang gis dge ba mi sgom zhing mi dge ba byed pa'o // nga rgyal ni rigs dang shes rgya dang nor la sogs pas dma' ba bas de dag gis bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa 'am /
translated: Negligence is the non-cultivation of the wholesome and the practice of the unwholesome due to the influence of attachment, hatred, and delusion.üîΩPride is the inflation of the mind that occurs when one thinks, I am superior to my inferiors in family, knowledge, wealth, etc.

original: rigs la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid la de dag dang bdag mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa mtshungs pa nyid la de dag dang bdag mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the inflation of the mind that occurs when one thinks, I am equal to my equals in family, etc.

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs dang shes rgya la sogs pas mtshungs pa bas gtong ba dang tshul khrims dang nyams rtsal la sogs pas bdag che'o snyam pa 'am rigs dang nor la sogs pas che ba la bdag dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs dang shes rgya la sogs pas mtshungs pa bas gtong ba dang tshul khrims dang nyams rtsal la sogs pas bdag che'o snyam pa 'am rigs dang nor la sogs pas che ba la bdag dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Arrogance of superiority is the inflation of the mind which thinks that one is superior to equals in terms of lineage, knowledge, and so on, or that one is their equal in terms of generosity, ethics, and so on.

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal ni rigs la sogs pa che ba bas kyang bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal ni rigs la sogs pa che ba bas kyang bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Arrogance of arrogance is the inflation of the mind which thinks that one is superior to those who are superior in terms of lineage and so on.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni nye bar len pa'i phung po la bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba de dag la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen nas sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni nye bar len pa'i phung po la bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba de dag la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen nas sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Arrogance of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is the inflation of the mind which conceives of the aggregates, which are devoid of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs dang shes rgya dang nor la sogs pas khyad ches 'phags pa la bdag cung zad cig gis chung ngo snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs dang shes rgya dang nor la sogs pas khyad ches 'phags pa la bdag cung zad cig gis chung ngo snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Arrogance of thinking ‚ÄúI am a little bit‚Äù is the inflation of the mind which thinks that one is a little bit inferior to those who are vastly superior in terms of lineage, knowledge, wealth, and so on.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan khyad par can 'bras bu dang bsam gtan la sogs pa ma thob pa thob po snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan khyad par can 'bras bu dang bsam gtan la sogs pa ma thob pa thob po snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Arrogance of conceit is the inflation of the mind which thinks, ‚ÄúI have attained the special qualities, the results, the meditative stabilizations, and so on.‚Äù

original: log pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Arrogance of misapprehension is the inflation of the mind which thinks, ‚ÄúI have the good qualities,‚Äù when one does not have the good qualities.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis zhes bya bas ni gong du ming gis smos pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang mi 'grogs par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis zhes bya bas ni gong du ming gis smos pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang mi 'grogs par ma zad kyi /
translated: ‚Äú By all the secondary afflictions‚Äù means not only that one does not associate with the secondary afflictions mentioned above by name,

original: gzhan yang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin med pa dang / 'gyod pa dang gnyid la sogs pa dang yang mi 'grogs so zhes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan yang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin med pa dang / 'gyod pa dang gnyid la sogs pa dang yang mi 'grogs so zhes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but also that one does not associate with other secondary afflictions, such as distraction, lack of vigilance, regret, and sleepiness.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas ldang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas par bstan te 'dod chags ni srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod la chags shing smon pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas ldang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas par bstan te 'dod chags ni srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod la chags shing smon pa'o //
translated: The phrase not dwelling together with the passions of desire, hatred, and ignorance and so on teaches that he does not dwell together with the passions.

original: zhe sdang ni sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang ni sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /
translated: Hatred is the malevolence toward sentient beings.

original: gang gi dbang gis @106a * //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis @106a * //
translated: By the power of which

original: sems can rnams la gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: one kills, binds, and so on, sentient beings.

original: gti mug gis ngan song rnams dang mtho ris dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / de dag thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang / de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa phyin ci ma log par mi shes pa'o ;
analyzed: gti mug gis ngan song rnams dang mtho ris dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / de dag thob par byed pa'i rgyu dang / de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa phyin ci ma log par mi shes pa'o ;
translated: Ignorance is the non-understanding of the lower realms, the higher realms, and nirvana, and the non-understanding of the causes that attain them, and the non-understanding of the unerring connection between their causes and effects.

original: / kun nas ldang ba ni de dag skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen phrad nas mngon du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: / kun nas ldang ba ni de dag skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen phrad nas mngon du 'byung ba ste /
translated: Arising is the actualization of those when the causes and conditions for their arising come together.

original: de yang yul nye bar gyur la /
analyzed: de yang yul nye bar gyur la /
translated: Moreover, when the object is present,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that they possess improper mental activity.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag kyang mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar dka' ba dang / sla ba'i bye brag gis phra mo dang sbom po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag kyang mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar dka' ba dang / sla ba'i bye brag gis phra mo dang sbom po zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those afflictions are called subtle and gross, respectively, due to the distinction of being difficult and easy to abandon by the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar sla ba dang / dka' ba dang / shin tu dka' ba'i bye brag gis chung du dang 'bring dang chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar sla ba dang / dka' ba dang / shin tu dka' ba'i bye brag gis chung du dang 'bring dang chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called small, medium, and great, respectively, due to the distinction of being easy, difficult, and very difficult to abandon by the path of meditation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam chen po'i chen po la sogs pa dgus spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams la bya'o //üîΩyang na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas te spang bar bya ba yin pas spang dka' ba'i phyir phra mo zhes bya la /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam chen po'i chen po la sogs pa dgus spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams la bya'o // yang na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas te spang bar bya ba yin pas spang dka' ba'i phyir phra mo zhes bya la /
translated: They are abandoned by the nine stages of the path of meditation, such as the great of the great and so on.üîΩOr they are called subtle and gross, respectively, because they are difficult and easy to abandon by the supramundane path, since they are abandoned together with their imprints.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba ni spang sla bas sbom po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba ni spang sla bas sbom po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called small, medium, and great, respectively, because they are easy, difficult, and very difficult to abandon by the mundane path.

original: yang na gang zag nyon mongs pa'i shas chung ba rnams kyis ni phra mo yin la /
analyzed: yang na gang zag nyon mongs pa'i shas chung ba rnams kyis ni phra mo yin la /
translated: Or else, they are subtle for persons whose defilements are weak,

original: gang zag nyon mongs pa shas che ba rnams kyis ni sbom po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag nyon mongs pa shas che ba rnams kyis ni sbom po zhes bya'o //
translated: and gross for persons whose defilements are strong.

original: yang na gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni kha nang du bltas pa yin pas phra mo zhes bya la /
analyzed: yang na gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni kha nang du bltas pa yin pas phra mo zhes bya la /
translated: Or else, the defilements of the realms of form and of the formless are called subtle because they are turned inward;

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags te kha phyir bltas pa yin pas sbom po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags te kha phyir bltas pa yin pas sbom po zhes bya'o //
translated: the defilements of the realm of desire are called gross because they are attached to the five objects of enjoyment and are turned outward.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas ldang ba thams cad kyi bar zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa de dag gsum dang yang mi 'grogs par yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas ldang ba thams cad kyi bar zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa de dag gsum dang yang mi 'grogs par yang ma zad kyi /
translated: All the other defilements means that not only are they not associated with these three defilements,

original: gzhan yang the tshom dang mdud ba dang 'ching ba la sogs pa dang mi 'grogs par ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang the tshom dang mdud ba dang 'ching ba la sogs pa dang mi 'grogs par ston to //
translated: but also they are not associated with doubt, the fetters, the bonds, etc.

original: gti mug gi mun pa dang rab rib kyi ling tog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyams par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas par bstan te /
analyzed: gti mug gi mun pa dang rab rib kyi ling tog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyams par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas par bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe darkness of delusion, the cataracts of delusion‚Äù and so on indicates that the bodhisattva does not abide with those phenomena that cause degeneration.

original: gong du nyon mongs pa'i nang du yang gti mug smos mod kyi /
analyzed: gong du nyon mongs pa'i nang du yang gti mug smos mod kyi /
translated: Delusion is mentioned among the afflictions above,

original: mdo las @106b rmongs pa med pa la gzhan mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las @106b rmongs pa med pa la gzhan mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs te /
translated: but the sutra states that when there is no delusion, the others do not occur.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i gzhi gti mug yin pas 'dir logs shig tu yang smos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i gzhi gti mug yin pas 'dir logs shig tu yang smos so //
translated: Since delusion is the basis for the occurrence of all the afflictions, it is mentioned separately here.

original: gti mug nyid mun pa yin pas na gti mug gi mun pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug nyid mun pa yin pas na gti mug gi mun pa ste /
translated: Delusion itself is darkness, so it is the darkness of delusion.

original: dper na mun pas dngos po rnams mi mthong zhing log par mthong ba de bzhin du gti mug gis kyang sdug bsngal la bde bar mthong bas na gti mug gi mun pa zhes bya'o //üîΩrab rib nyid ling tog yin pas na /
analyzed: dper na mun pas dngos po rnams mi mthong zhing log par mthong ba de bzhin du gti mug gis kyang sdug bsngal la bde bar mthong bas na gti mug gi mun pa zhes bya'o // rab rib nyid ling tog yin pas na /
translated: Just as darkness causes one to not see things as they are and to see things wrongly, so too delusion causes one to see suffering as happiness.

original: rab rib kyi ling tog ste /
analyzed: rab rib kyi ling tog ste /
translated: Cataracts themselves are the cataracts of delusion.

original: ling tog dang 'dra bar tshe rabs gzhan gyi nyes dmigs yod /
analyzed: ling tog dang 'dra bar tshe rabs gzhan gyi nyes dmigs yod /
translated: Cataracts are like the faults of other lives.

original: yang dag pa yang mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa yang mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not see reality.

original: gang gi phyir sgrib par gyur pa de'i phyir chod pa zhes bya ste /üîΩrtsig pas chod pa'i pha rol na dngos po yod pa ma mthong ba bzhin du tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs yod /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgrib par gyur pa de'i phyir chod pa zhes bya ste / rtsig pas chod pa'i pha rol na dngos po yod pa ma mthong ba bzhin du tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs yod /
translated: Because it is obscured, therefore it is called ‚Äúcovered over,‚ÄùüîΩjust as one does not see an object that exists on the other side of a wall.

original: yang dag pa yang shin tu mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa yang shin tu mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not see the faults of this life and also does not see reality.

original: yang na tshe rabs gzhan gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa ni gti mug pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshe rabs gzhan gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid mi shes pa ni gti mug pa'o //
translated: Or, ignorance is the lack of knowledge of the characteristics of karma and the afflictions in other lives.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid gnod pa du ma'i rang bzhin can gyi mtshan nyid mi shes pa ni mun pa'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid gnod pa du ma'i rang bzhin can gyi mtshan nyid mi shes pa ni mun pa'o //
translated: Darkness is the lack of knowledge of the characteristics of the result of karma and the afflictions, which is suffering, the nature of which is many harms.

original: tshe 'di'i las dang nyon mongs pa rnams mi shes pa ni rab rib po //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i las dang nyon mongs pa rnams mi shes pa ni rab rib po //
translated: Blurred vision is the lack of knowledge of the karma and afflictions of this life.

original: nyon mongs pa de'i rgyus tshe 'di la gnod pa sna tshogs 'byung ba dang / phung po nyid kyang sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin can du mi shes pa ni ling tog go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de'i rgyus tshe 'di la gnod pa sna tshogs 'byung ba dang / phung po nyid kyang sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin can du mi shes pa ni ling tog go //
translated: The obscuration is the failure to understand that the afflictions cause various harms in this life and that the aggregates themselves are the nature of various sufferings.

original: las gang byas pas tshe rabs gzhan du 'bras bu gang thob par mi shes pa ni sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: las gang byas pas tshe rabs gzhan du 'bras bu gang thob par mi shes pa ni sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obstruction is the failure to understand that the result of any karma is obtained in another life.

original: 'bras bu de dag kyang tshe 'di nas ma 'phos pa dang / rang bzhin med par mi shes pa ni chod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de dag kyang tshe 'di nas ma 'phos pa dang / rang bzhin med par mi shes pa ni chod pa'o //
translated: The impediment is the failure to understand that those results are not transferred from this life and that they are essenceless.

original: nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos kun nas ldang ba thams cad kyi bar gyi 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas zhes bya ba ni nyams par 'gyur ba'i chos de rnams dang / lhan cig mi gnas par yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i chos kun nas ldang ba thams cad kyi bar gyi 'grogs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas zhes bya ba ni nyams par 'gyur ba'i chos de rnams dang / lhan cig mi gnas par yang ma zad kyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe does not dwell together with any of the motivations that are conducive to the aspect of decline‚Äù means that not only does he not dwell together with those phenomena that are conducive to decline,

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos yon tan dang sa rim pa gong ma la sogs pa 'thob pa las kyang nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos yon tan dang sa rim pa gong ma la sogs pa 'thob pa las kyang nyams par 'gyur /
translated: he also does not dwell together with any phenomena that are conducive to the afflictions. He also does not dwell together with any phenomena that are conducive to the loss of the qualities and the stages of the grounds and so on that have been obtained.

original: ma thob pa yang thob par mi 'gyur ba rnams dang lhan cig mi 'grogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma thob pa yang thob par mi 'gyur ba rnams dang lhan cig mi 'grogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not associated with those who do not obtain what has not been obtained.

original: @107a * // 'dod pa dang 'thab mo'i rnyog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdud kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i skyon rnams dang / bdud dang bdud kyi las rnams spangs pa bstan te /
analyzed: @107a * // 'dod pa dang 'thab mo'i rnyog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdud kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i skyon rnams dang / bdud dang bdud kyi las rnams spangs pa bstan te /
translated: The faults belonging to the side of Mara are taught, and the abandonment of Mara and the works of Mara, by desire, strife, and disturbance, etc.

original: 'dod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la bya'o //
translated: Desire is the five sense objects, such as form, etc.

original: 'thab mo'i don ni sngar smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'thab mo'i don ni sngar smras pa bzhin te /
translated: The meaning of strife is as previously stated.

original: 'dod pa dang 'thab mo de dag nyid rnyog pa dang 'dra bas na rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang 'thab mo de dag nyid rnyog pa dang 'dra bas na rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those desires and strifes themselves are like disturbances, and so are called disturbances.

original: bdud bzhi la gzugs la sogs pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni phung po'i bdud do //
analyzed: bdud bzhi la gzugs la sogs pas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni phung po'i bdud do //
translated: The four Maras are: the skandhas of grasping the five, such as form, etc., are the skandha-Mara;

original: khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud do //
analyzed: khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud do //
translated: all the defilements that occur in the three realms are the defilement-Mara;

original: sems can de dang de dag sems can gyi ris mthun pa de dang de dag nas shi 'phos pa ni 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
analyzed: sems can de dang de dag sems can gyi ris mthun pa de dang de dag nas shi 'phos pa ni 'chi bdag gi bdud do //
translated: The death of sentient beings from this or that class of sentient beings is the demon of the Lord of Death.

original: gang dag dge ba'i phyogs la rab tu zhugs nas phung po dang / nyon mongs dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud las 'da' bar 'dod pa na 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po rnyed pa bar chad bya ba'i phyir nye bar lhags pa rnams ni lha'i bu'i bdud do //
analyzed: gang dag dge ba'i phyogs la rab tu zhugs nas phung po dang / nyon mongs dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud las 'da' bar 'dod pa na 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po rnyed pa bar chad bya ba'i phyir nye bar lhags pa rnams ni lha'i bu'i bdud do //
translated: When those who have entered the virtuous side desire to transcend the demon of the aggregates, the demon of afflictions, and the demon of the Lord of Death, the sons of gods who have been born in the desire realm, such as Mahe≈õvara, approach in order to create obstacles. They are the demon of the sons of gods.

original: bdud kyi las thams cad kyi bar dang lhan cig mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la chags pa dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnams dang / gzhan yang de kho na rtogs pa'i bar du gcod pa rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i las thams cad ni bdud kyi las su shes par bya'o //üîΩde yang mdor bstan na gang zag la la zhig thar par 'gyur bas mngon par bsdus pa mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun ba'i dge ba'i chos la dad pa yang dag par skyes pa na 'dod pa la chags pa'i dbang du gyur nas ldog pa
analyzed: bdud kyi las thams cad kyi bar dang lhan cig mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la chags pa dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i las rnams dang / gzhan yang de kho na rtogs pa'i bar du gcod pa rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i las thams cad ni bdud kyi las su shes par bya'o // de yang mdor bstan na gang zag la la zhig thar par 'gyur bas mngon par bsdus pa mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun ba'i dge ba'i chos la dad pa yang dag par skyes pa na 'dod pa la chags pa'i dbang du gyur nas ldog pa
translated: The works of Mara should be understood as all the works that are obstacles to the realization of reality, such as attachment to the qualities of the five sense pleasures, sinful and nonvirtuous works such as killing, and also such things as discursive thought and conceptualization.

original: ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: In brief, it is a work of Mara when someone who has generated faith in the virtuous qualities that are conducive to nirvana, which is the goal of liberation, turns away from it due to the power of attachment to sense pleasures.

original: dbang po'i sgo bsdams te gnas pa na gang chags par 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon rtags su 'dzin pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo bsdams te gnas pa na gang chags par 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon rtags su 'dzin pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: When one is restrained and settled, to grasp at the signs and the characteristics of forms, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and mental objects that one is attached to is the work of MƒÅra.

original: de bzhin du zas kyi tshod rig par gnas pa na ro'i khyad par la sems chags pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar @107b rjes su sbyor ba na gnyid kyi bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du zas kyi tshod rig par gnas pa na ro'i khyad par la sems chags pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar @107b rjes su sbyor ba na gnyid kyi bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba dang /
translated: Similarly, when one is settled in moderation with regard to food, to be attached to the particular tastes and to be attached to the pleasure of sleep, the pleasure of lying down,

original: glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba la chags shing sems 'jug pa ni bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba la chags shing sems 'jug pa ni bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o //
