original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa mdo de dang de dag gi nang nas gsungs pa'i bdud kyi las rnams la yang bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa mdo de dang de dag gi nang nas gsungs pa'i bdud kyi las rnams la yang bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the activities of Mara are taught in the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines and so forth, in this and that sutra.

original: bdag dang sems can dang srog dang gso ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pa dang ma 'dres pa bstan te bdag la sogs pa thams cad kyang bdag tu 'dod pa'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dang srog dang gso ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pa dang ma 'dres pa bstan te bdag la sogs pa thams cad kyang bdag tu 'dod pa'i rnam grangs te /
translated: The phrase attachment to the belief in a self is taught in order to show that one should not be attached to the belief in a self, a sentient being, a life-force, or a person. All of these are synonyms for the belief in a self.

original: de dag kyang bdag can rtag par smra ba dang / gzhung gcig mod kyi grub pa'i mtha' tha dad pa las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa tsam gyis phye ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag can rtag par smra ba dang / gzhung gcig mod kyi grub pa'i mtha' tha dad pa las mtshan nyid mi mthun pa tsam gyis phye ste /
translated: Although they are the same in terms of their scriptural basis, they are distinguished by their different tenets and their slightly different characteristics.

original: ming so sor btags nas gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ming so sor btags nas gzhag pa'o //
translated: They are established by being given their own individual names.

original: 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen zhes bya ba'i sgra bdag dang sems can la sogs pa'i tshig re re dang yang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen zhes bya ba'i sgra bdag dang sems can la sogs pa'i tshig re re dang yang sbyar te /
translated: The word attachment should be applied to each of the words for the self, sentient being, and so forth.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen zhes bya ba @109b dang ; sems can du 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen zhes bya ba @109b dang ; sems can du 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase they do not remain together with the grasping of a self, etc. should be applied to the grasping of a sentient being, etc.

original: bdag la sogs pa 'di dag gi khyad par ni sngar bshad par zad do //üîΩ'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa thams cad kyi bar dang lhan cig mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa gong du smos pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas par yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa 'di dag gi khyad par ni sngar bshad par zad do // 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa thams cad kyi bar dang lhan cig mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa gong du smos pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas par yang ma zad kyi /
translated: The differences among the self, etc. have already been explained above.

original: gzhan yang bdag tu 'dzin pa dbang phyug dang / gtso bo dang / dus la sogs pa yod par sems pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag tu 'dzin pa dbang phyug dang / gtso bo dang / dus la sogs pa yod par sems pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase they do not remain together with all the forms of grasping should be understood to mean that not only do they not remain together with the forms of grasping that were mentioned above, but also that they do not remain together with the grasping of a self that is conceived to be a powerful creator, a primal substance, or time, etc.

original: las kyi sgrib pa dang chos kyi sgrib pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba sgrib pa rnams dang ma 'dres pa bstan te /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa dang chos kyi sgrib pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba sgrib pa rnams dang ma 'dres pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase they are unadulterated with the obscurations that consist of the latencies of the mental afflictions and the obscurations to the known indicates that they are unadulterated with the obscurations that consist of the latencies.

original: las kyi sgrab pa ni tshe 'di nyid la mtshams med pa lnga'i las byas pas las des tshe de la bden pa mthong ba la bar du gcod pa ni las kyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi sgrab pa ni tshe 'di nyid la mtshams med pa lnga'i las byas pas las des tshe de la bden pa mthong ba la bar du gcod pa ni las kyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: Action obscuration is the obscuration of action that interrupts the seeing of the truth in this very life by the five actions of immediate retribution.üîΩThe obscuration of Dharma is the obscuration of action that interrupts the hearing of Dharma, such as being stingy with the Dharma, turning away those who are interested, and so on.

original: chos la ser sna byed cing mos pa bzlog pa la sogs pa chos thos pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las rnams byas pas tshe rabs de dang de dag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang mi ldan zhing chos thos par mi 'gyur ba ni chos kyiüîΩsgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos la ser sna byed cing mos pa bzlog pa la sogs pa chos thos pa'i bar du gcod pa'i las rnams byas pas tshe rabs de dang de dag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang mi ldan zhing chos thos par mi 'gyur ba ni chos kyi sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of that, one is not endowed with a spiritual friend and so on in this and that life and does not hear the Dharma.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa shas che bas 'phags pa'i lam bsgrub par mi nus pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa shas che bas 'phags pa'i lam bsgrub par mi nus pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Afflictive obscuration is the inability to accomplish the ƒÅrya path due to the predominance of the afflictions such as attachment.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga rnams ni lta ba'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga rnams ni lta ba'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The five views such as the view of the transitory collection and extreme views are called the obscuration of view.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas la sogs pa ngan song gsum gyi 'gro ba dag tu skyes nas bden pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ba ni 'gro ba'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas la sogs pa ngan song gsum gyi 'gro ba dag tu skyes nas bden pa mthong bar mi 'gyur ba ni 'gro ba'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The obscuration of destiny is the destiny of the three lower realms, such as the animal realm, etc., where one is born and does not see the truth.

original: tshe snga ma la sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i rnam par smin pas lha dang mir skyas kyang rnam par smin pa des bsgribs pas bden pa mi mthong ba ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe snga ma la sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i rnam par smin pas lha dang mir skyas kyang rnam par smin pa des bsgribs pas bden pa mi mthong ba ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The obscuration of the result of action is the result of actions that are sinful and nonvirtuous in previous lives. Even if one is born as a god or human, one does not see the truth because of being obscured by that result.

original: ji tsam du shes par bya ba bar du gcod pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa'i bag chags nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i shes pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du shes par bya ba bar du gcod pa phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa'i bag chags nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i shes pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obscuration of the knowable is the obscuration of the knowledge of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc., which are the obstacles to knowing, and is the instinct of nonafflicted nescience.

original: bag chags de dag gis mtshams sbyor bas na /
analyzed: bag chags de dag gis mtshams sbyor bas na /
translated: Since one is connected with those instincts,

original: bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba ste /
translated: there is the connection with the instincts.

original: @110a * // de'i dbang gis gcig nas gcig tu tshe len par byed pas so //
analyzed: @110a * // de'i dbang gis gcig nas gcig tu tshe len par byed pas so //
translated: Because of their power, one takes on one life after another.

original: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdud pa dang sgro btags pa rnams dang ma 'dres pa bstan te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdud pa dang sgro btags pa rnams dang ma 'dres pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase unmixed with speculation, discursive thought, and thorough conceptualization, and so on, indicates that it is unmixed with knots and bonds.

original: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa gsum ni mdud pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa gsum ni mdud pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The three, speculation, discursive thought, and thorough conceptualization, are called knots.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'ching ba ni rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtshan ma dang dmigs pa la sogs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'ching ba ni rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro // mtshan ma dang dmigs pa la sogs te /
translated: Because the bodhisattva's bondage is the various discursive thoughts.üîΩThe remaining ones, such as signs and objective supports,

original: lhag ma rnams ni sgro btags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sgro btags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: are called bonds.

original: mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rnam par chos rnams bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rnam par chos rnams bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they generate the various dharmas in the aspect of signs, and so on.

original: de la mig dang rna pa la sogs pa nang gi dngos po rnams la yod pa'am med par 'dzin pa ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig dang rna pa la sogs pa nang gi dngos po rnams la yod pa'am med par 'dzin pa ni rtog pa'o //
translated: Among them, speculation is the apprehension of internal things, such as the eyes and ears, as existent or nonexistent.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa phyi'i yul rnams la yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa phyi'i yul rnams la yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Discursive thought is the apprehension of external objects, such as forms and sounds, as existent or nonexistent.

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po gnyi ga la yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa ni yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po gnyi ga la yod pa dang med par 'dzin pa ni yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of both internal and external things as existent or nonexistent is thorough conception.

original: yang na nyan thos kyi theg pa la mngon par chags shing rtog pa ni rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nyan thos kyi theg pa la mngon par chags shing rtog pa ni rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, attachment to and conceptualization of the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle is called conception.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mngon par chags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mngon par chags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Attachment to the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle is conceptualization.

original: theg pa bla na med pa la mngon par chags pa ni yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa bla na med pa la mngon par chags pa ni yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: Attachment to the unsurpassed vehicle is thorough conception.

original: yang na rtog ge ba rnams ni dngos po la tshad ma rnam pa gsum gyis 'jal te /
analyzed: yang na rtog ge ba rnams ni dngos po la tshad ma rnam pa gsum gyis 'jal te /
translated: Or, logicians measure things with three kinds of valid cognition:

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi tshad ma'o //
translated: direct perception, inference, and scriptural testimony.

original: de la mngon sum gyi tshad mas dngos po la 'jal ba ni rtog pa'o //üîΩrjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas dngos po 'jal ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyi tshad mas dngos po la 'jal ba ni rtog pa'o // rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas dngos po 'jal ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Measuring things with the valid cognition of direct perception is conception.üîΩMeasuring things with the valid cognition of inference is conceptualization.

original: lung gi tshad mas dngos po 'jal ba ni yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lung gi tshad mas dngos po 'jal ba ni yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: Measuring things with the valid cognition of scriptural testimony is thorough conception.

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba zhes bya ba dag ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'khor ba zhes bya ba dag ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: Blue, yellow, nirvana, and cyclic existence are signs.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / rol sogs pa yul rnams ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / rol sogs pa yul rnams ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: Form, sound, smell, taste, and so on, are objects.

original: mthong ba ni mig gis so ;
analyzed: mthong ba ni mig gis so ;
translated: Seeing is by the eye.

original: / thos pa ni rna bas so //
analyzed: / thos pa ni rna bas so //
translated: Hearing is by the ear.

original: bye brag phyed pa na yid kyis so //
analyzed: bye brag phyed pa na yid kyis so //
translated: Discerning is by the mind.

original: rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa lhag ma rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa lhag ma rnams kyis so //
translated: Cognizing is by the remaining consciousnesses.

original: yang na mthong ba la sogs pas ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //üîΩmdud pa dang sgro btags pa thams cad kyi bar dang lhan cig mi gnas zhes bya ba @110b ni mdud pa dang sgro btags pa gong ma rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas par yang ma zad kyi gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'ching bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: yang na mthong ba la sogs pas ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no // mdud pa dang sgro btags pa thams cad kyi bar dang lhan cig mi gnas zhes bya ba @110b ni mdud pa dang sgro btags pa gong ma rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas par yang ma zad kyi gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'ching bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Seeing and so on are as explained above.

original: dngos po la sgro 'dogs pa gzhan dag dang yang lhan cig mi gnas par ston to //
analyzed: dngos po la sgro 'dogs pa gzhan dag dang yang lhan cig mi gnas par ston to //
translated: Not dwelling together with all knots and superimpositions means not only not dwelling together with the knots and superimpositions mentioned above, but also not dwelling together with other bonds and superimpositions of entities of the bodhisattva.

original: bdag dang rtag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni phyin ci log dang ma 'dres par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag dang rtag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni phyin ci log dang ma 'dres par bstan to //
translated: The words ‚Äúself‚Äù and ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù and so on show that it is not mixed with error.

original: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong dang lhan cig mi gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dang ma 'dres pa bstan te /
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong dang lhan cig mi gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dang ma 'dres pa bstan te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not coexist with the eighty-four thousand kinds of mental activity of sentient beings‚Äù and so on shows that it is not mixed with the opposites and their remedies.

original: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The eighty-four thousand kinds of mental activity of sentient beings are the opposites.

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ni gnyen po'i phyogs te /
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ni gnyen po'i phyogs te /
translated: The eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma are the remedies.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same method applies to the rest.

original: de la sems can 'dod chags la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong dang / zhe sdang la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong dang / gti mug la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong dang / cha mnyam pa la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong ste /
analyzed: de la sems can 'dod chags la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong dang / zhe sdang la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong dang / gti mug la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong dang / cha mnyam pa la spyod pa nyi khri chig stong ste /
translated: Among sentient beings, there are twenty-one thousand who are dominated by desire, twenty-one thousand who are dominated by hatred, twenty-one thousand who are dominated by delusion, and twenty-one thousand who are dominated by a mixture of these three.

original: de ltar brgyad khri bzhi stong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar brgyad khri bzhi stong ngo //
translated: Thus there are eighty-four thousand.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi gnyen po chos kyi phung po nyi khri chig stong /üîΩzhe sdang gi gnyen po chos kyi phung po nyi khri chig stong /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi gnyen po chos kyi phung po nyi khri chig stong / zhe sdang gi gnyen po chos kyi phung po nyi khri chig stong /
translated: The antidote to attachment is the twenty-one thousand aggregates of Dharma.üîΩThe antidote to hatred is the twenty-one thousand aggregates of Dharma.

original: gti mug gi gnyen po chos kyi phung po nyi khri chig stong /
analyzed: gti mug gi gnyen po chos kyi phung po nyi khri chig stong /
translated: The antidote to delusion is the twenty-one thousand aggregates of Dharma.

original: cha mnyam pa'i gnyen po chos kyi phung po nyi khri chig stong ste /
analyzed: cha mnyam pa'i gnyen po chos kyi phung po nyi khri chig stong ste /
translated: The antidote to the equal combination of the three is the twenty-one thousand aggregates of Dharma.üîΩThus, there are eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma.

original: de ltar na chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong dang // de la nye bar blangs pa'i dngos po gter dang / 'bru la sogs pa mi gtong ba ni ser sna'o //
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong dang // de la nye bar blangs pa'i dngos po gter dang / 'bru la sogs pa mi gtong ba ni ser sna'o //
translated: Stinginess is the non-giving of things that have been acquired, such as treasure, grain, etc.

original: de las bzlog na gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog na gtong ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is giving.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang ; 'dod pa log par g-yem pa la sogs pa ni mi dge ba'i las la zhugs pa ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims can yin la /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang ; 'dod pa log par g-yem pa la sogs pa ni mi dge ba'i las la zhugs pa ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims can yin la /
translated: Immorality is the engagement in non-virtuous actions, such as killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, etc.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa las phyir log pa ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa las phyir log pa ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the turning away from killing, etc.

original: sems can rnams la rdeg pa dang / 'ching ba la sogs pas 'tshe bar sems pa ni gnod sems so //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rdeg pa dang / 'ching ba la sogs pas 'tshe bar sems pa ni gnod sems so //
translated: Malice is the intention to harm sentient beings by beating, binding, and so on.

original: rdeg pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pas sems can la mi 'tshe zhing gnod par byas kyang slar gnod par mi byed pa ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: rdeg pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pas sems can la mi 'tshe zhing gnod par byas kyang slar gnod par mi byed pa ni bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the absence of malice toward sentient beings, even when harmed by beating, binding, and so on, and the absence of a desire to harm in return.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la sems mi spro zhing mi 'jug pa ni le lo ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la sems mi spro zhing mi 'jug pa ni le lo ste /
translated: Laziness is the lack of enthusiasm and the lack of engagement in virtue.

original: de las bzlog na brtson 'grus so //üîΩphyi'i yul rnams la @111a * //
analyzed: de las bzlog na brtson 'grus so // phyi'i yul rnams la @111a * //
translated: Diligence is the opposite of that.

original: sems 'phros pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: sems 'phros pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: Distraction is the scattering of the mind to external objects.

original: dmigs pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan no //
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind on the object of meditation.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la phyin ci log tu chags shing 'dzin pa ni 'chal pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la phyin ci log tu chags shing 'dzin pa ni 'chal pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: Erroneous understanding is the attachment to and grasping of the characteristics of phenomena in a distorted way.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log par 'byed par byed pa ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log par 'byed par byed pa ni shes rab bo //
translated: Wisdom is the undistorted discernment of the characteristics of phenomena.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rigs rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rigs rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five types of potential are the definite, the indefinite, the mixed, the suppressed, and the naturally feeble.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs can dang / rigs ma nges pa dang / rigs med pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs can dang / rigs ma nges pa dang / rigs med pa'o //
translated: those of no potential.

original: de la rigs med pa'i gang zag rnams ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: de la rigs med pa'i gang zag rnams ni nges pa ste /
translated: Those of no potential are definitely not destined for final nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de dag tu thams cad du 'khor bar gnas par gdon mi za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tu thams cad du 'khor bar gnas par gdon mi za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they will certainly remain in cyclic existence in all its aspects.

original: theg pa gsum du nges pa'i rigs can ni ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum du nges pa'i rigs can ni ma nges pa ste /
translated: Those of the three destined potentials are not destined,

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dge 'dun tha dad pa'o //

original: mi shes pa dang shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan ma yid la byed pa rnams dang ma 'dres pa bstan te /
analyzed: mi shes pa dang shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan ma yid la byed pa rnams dang ma 'dres pa bstan te /

original: de la mi shes pa ni ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi shes pa ni ma rig pa ste /

original: rtag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag dang / bde bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bdag dang / bde bar 'dzin pa'o //

original: shes pa ni rig pa ste ;
analyzed: shes pa ni rig pa ste ;

analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / sdug bsngal bar 'dzin pa'o //

original: rnam pa sna tshogs su shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs su shes pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /

analyzed: gzugs su shes pa dang / sgrar shes pa nas chos su shes pa'i bar du yin pas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa @113a * //

analyzed: rnams so // brjod du yod cing bsam du yod pa rnams ni kun rdzob bo //

original: de las bzlog pa ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni don dam pa ste /

original: brjod pa dang bsam pas thog tu mi phebs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang bsam pas thog tu mi phebs pa'o //

original: mtshan ma yid la byed pa thams cad kyi bar dang lhan cig tu mi gnas zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma yid la byed pa gong du bshad pa de rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas par ma zad kyi /

original: shes rab ni rgyu ba med pa lus med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gong du smos pa lta bu'i tshul gyis mtshan ma thams cad spangs pa'i rang bzhin cis kyang ma gos par rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid bstan te /

analyzed: gong du smos pa'i shes rab ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: gang rgyu ba med pa'i zhes bya ba la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan mar 'du shes pa ni rgyu ba'o //

original: shes rab des gzung ba dang 'dzin par 'du shes pa thams cad spangs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan mar 'du shes pa'i rgyu med pas na rgyu ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab des gzung ba dang 'dzin par 'du shes pa thams cad spangs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan mar 'du shes pa'i rgyu med pas na rgyu ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúwithout movement‚Äù because it is free from the movement of the discriminations of object and subject.

original: chos gzhan gyi gzhi dang rten kyang ma yin la ;
analyzed: chos gzhan gyi gzhi dang rten kyang ma yin la ;

analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i sgra thams cad dang yang sbyar te /

analyzed: dbang bo de rnams la mi rten pas na gnas dang lhan cig mi gnas so //

analyzed: de dag dang ma 'bags pas na ming dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'o //

translated: The meaning of the non-existence of a permanent self, the meaning of the non-existence of a self and purity, the meaning of the mantra practitioner, the meaning of the non-existence of a self and the insignificant, the meaning of the lack of essence, the meaning of the impermanent, the meaning of the worthless, and the meaning of the useless.

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa rnams yul la 'jug par mi nus te /

analyzed: / dper na rmi lam bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa nas gang zag gi bar gyi rang bzhin ma yin te /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: phung bo rnams ni gzugs brnyan lta bu ste zhes bya ba la phung bo rnams ni gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /

translated: For example, it is like the moon in water and a clear mirror.üîΩ

analyzed: dngos po med mod kyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang skye ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung zhing skye bar snang ngo // gang 'di la mkhas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' phung po la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la gong du phung po dpe bstan pa'i tshul du phung po'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni phung po la mkhas pa yin no
translated: Nevertheless, various kinds of birth occur and appear.üîΩThe bodhisattva who is skilled in this is called a bodhisattva skilled in the aggregates.

analyzed: de'ang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de bas na yongs su rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang tsam ni yod kyang /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhi ba ste zhes bya ba la gang zag dang chos su rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i don tam /

analyzed: de dag spangs pa'i don ni rang bzhin gyis zhi ba zhes bya ste //
translated: or the meaning is that they are abandoned. This is called ‚Äúnaturally peaceful.‚Äù

analyzed: de yang dngos su na yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'o //

analyzed: de la phyin ci log tu snang ba'i sems ni gnyen pos zhi bar byas pa med kyi /
translated: In this regard, the mind that appears as erroneous is not pacified by an antidote.

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de rtogs pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i ye shes zhes bya ste /

analyzed: mig la sogs pa khams so so'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa dang rten lta bus khong du chud pa ni khams la mkhas par mi 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa dang / ji ltar na chos kyi dbyings la 'jug par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach what the dharmadhatu is and how one enters the dharmadhatu,üîΩthe root text says:

analyzed: chos kyi dbyings sra ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /

original: ci'i phyir de mtshungs she na zhes bya ba ni bdag gi khams nas chos thams cad kyi khams kyi bar rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas na ci'i phyir de dag mtshungs she na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de mtshungs she na zhes bya ba ni bdag gi khams nas chos thams cad kyi khams kyi bar rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas na ci'i phyir de dag mtshungs she na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: Since there are no signs, the three realms do not appear as the three realms, and nirvƒÅ·πáa does not appear as nirvƒÅ·πáa.

analyzed: de dag gnyi ga la yang cung zad kyang 'dod pa med pa ni smon pa med pa'o // las dge ba dang mi dge bas ma bskyed cing /

analyzed: mig gis gzugs mthong nas gzugs la 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar @121a * //

original: 'dod chags kyi rgyu nang gi dngos po dang / phyi'i dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid kyis med pas gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral du zin kyang /

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos zhi ba phyogs gcig pa yang mngon du mi len la gzugs la sogs pa 'khor ba'i chos kyang mi spong ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i skye mched la mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba'i don te /

original: sgra la sogs pa la yang ci rigs bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa la yang ci rigs bar sbyar ro //

original: skye mched kyi don rgyas par bshad pa bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i skye mched dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye mched do zhes bya ba smos te /

translated: In order to concisely teach the meaning of the bases, it says the bases of the ƒÅryas and the bases of non-ƒÅryas.

analyzed: mdor na skye mchod ni rnam pa gnyis te 'phags pa'i skye mched dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye mched do //
translated: In brief, the sense-spheres are of two kinds: the noble sense-spheres and the ignoble sense-spheres.

original: de la nyon mongs pa rnams las ring du song zhing nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa rnams las ring du song zhing nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni 'phags pa ste /
translated: The noble ones are those who have gone far from the defilements and have abandoned the defilements.

original: de rnams skye zhing 'byung ba'i sgo la 'phags pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams skye zhing 'byung ba'i sgo la 'phags pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: The door of their birth and origination is called the noble sense-spheres.

original: de bas na mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, it is said in the sutra:

original: 'phags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a noble one?

original: gang 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa dang / zhe sdang ma lus par spangs pa dang / gti mug ma lus par spangs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa dang / zhe sdang ma lus par spangs pa dang / gti mug ma lus par spangs pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is one who has completely abandoned attachment, completely abandoned aversion, and completely abandoned delusion.

original: gang nyon mongs pa rnams ma spangs pa ni 'phags pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa rnams ma spangs pa ni 'phags pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Those who have not abandoned the defilements are not noble ones.

original: de dag skye zhing 'byung ba'i sgo ni 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag skye zhing 'byung ba'i sgo ni 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: The door of their birth and origination is called the ignoble sense-spheres.

original: de bas na mdo las /
analyzed: de bas na mdo las /
translated: Therefore, it is said in the sutra:

original: so so'i skye bo gang zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo gang zhe na /
translated: What is an ordinary person?

original: gang 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma thob pa ste /
translated: It is one who has not attained the noble dharmas.

original: nye bar bsams pas sems pa dang / nyes par bya ba'i las byed pa dang / nyes par smra ba brjod pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nye bar bsams pas sems pa dang / nyes par bya ba'i las byed pa dang / nyes par smra ba brjod pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is thinking that is well considered, it is the performance of a well done action, it is the utterance of a well spoken word.

original: de la 'phags pa rnams skye zhing 'byung ba'i sgo gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa rnams skye zhing 'byung ba'i sgo gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to indicate the door of birth and origin of the noble ones, he says:

original: 'phags pa'i skye mched ni gang lam yang dag par bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye mched ni gang lam yang dag par bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The noble ones' station is the correct practice of the path.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / mnyan pa rnams gtan la 'bebs shing sems pa dang / bsams pa rnams zhi gnas lhag mthong gi sgo nas brten te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / mnyan pa rnams gtan la 'bebs shing sems pa dang / bsams pa rnams zhi gnas lhag mthong gi sgo nas brten te /
translated: It is the listening to the holy Dharma in dependence on a spiritual friend, it is the reflection on the meaning of what was heard, it is the meditation on the meaning that was reflected on.

original: dang po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa dang / de nas dro bar gyur pa'i dus na yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi sgom pa dang / de nas spyi bo'i tshe rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi sgom pa dang / de nas bzod pa'i dus na dbang po lnga sgom pa dang /
analyzed: dang po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa dang / de nas dro bar gyur pa'i dus na yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi sgom pa dang / de nas spyi bo'i tshe rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi sgom pa dang / de nas bzod pa'i dus na dbang po lnga sgom pa dang /
translated: First, one meditates on the four foundations of mindfulness, then at the time of heat one meditates on the four correct abandonings, then at the time of the peak one meditates on the four legs of manifestation, then at the time of acceptance one meditates on the five faculties, then at the time of the supreme mundane quality one meditates on the five powers, then at the time of the path of seeing one meditates on the seven aspects of enlightenment, and then at the time of the path of cultivation one meditates on the eightfold noble path.

original: 'di nas @121b 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi dus na stobs lnga sgom pa dang / de nas mthong ba'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun sgom pa dang / de nas bsgom pa'i lam na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bsgom pa ni lam sgrub pa zhes bya ste /

translated: Then, on the path of meditation, one cultivates the eightfold noble path.üîΩThe noble ones arise and appear from the establishment of the path,

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa skye zhing 'byung ba'i sgo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa skye zhing 'byung ba'i sgo bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye mched ni gang lam dang mi mthun pa'o zhes gsungs te /

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen las dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa 'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen las dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / bsam pa 'am /
translated: Not engaging in listening to the sublime Dharma from a spiritual friend, reflection,

analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called the ‚Äúsense bases of the non-noble ones.‚Äù

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /

original: rab tu 'bar ba'i sems can dang / dgra'i dbang du song ba'i sems can dang / sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba'i sems can dang / mun pas sgrib pa'i sems can dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa'i sems can dang / 'ching ba chen po dang ldan pa'i sems can dang /

analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la myos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Beings who are obscured by darkness are those who are deeply involved in wrong behavior, such as hunters, because they are confused about the evolution of their actions.

translated: Beings who have entered a bad path are those who are not destined for nirvana,

original: 'khor ba'i lam rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'ching ba chen po dang ldan pa'i sems can ni lta ba sna tshogs kyi bcing ba dam pos bcings pa'i mu stegs can thar pa'i @122a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i lam rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro // 'ching ba chen po dang ldan pa'i sems can ni lta ba sna tshogs kyi bcing ba dam pos bcings pa'i mu stegs can thar pa'i @122a * //
translated: because they do not interrupt the path of cyclic existence.

original: lam log par zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lam log par zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: Beings who are bound by great bonds are the heterodox, who are bound by the tight bonds of various false views and have entered a path that is not the way to liberation.

original: zas mchog dug dang 'dres pa la zhen pa'i sems can ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la chags te /
analyzed: zas mchog dug dang 'dres pa la zhen pa'i sems can ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la chags te /
translated: Beings who are attached to food mixed with poison are attached to the pleasure of meditative concentration.

original: ji ltar kha zas zhim po dug dang 'dres pa 'phral du bde ba yang 'chi ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi ro la chags pa yang phyis de las nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar kha zas zhim po dug dang 'dres pa 'phral du bde ba yang 'chi ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi ro la chags pa yang phyis de las nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as delicious food mixed with poison is pleasant at first but becomes the cause of death, so attachment to the taste of samadhi later becomes the cause of falling from it.

original: lam stor ba'i sems can ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams te /
analyzed: lam stor ba'i sems can ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams te /
translated: Beings who have lost the path are those with manifest pride,

original: thar pa'i lam nor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa'i lam nor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have lost the path to liberation.

original: lam log par zhugs pa'i sems can ni ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams theg pa chung ngu'i lam du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lam log par zhugs pa'i sems can ni ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams theg pa chung ngu'i lam du zhugs pa'o //
translated: Beings who have entered a false path are those of unfixed potential who have entered the path of the Basic Vehicle.

original: nyam chung ba'i sems can tshogs gnyis rdzogs par mi btub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: nyam chung ba'i sems can tshogs gnyis rdzogs par mi btub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: Beings who are weak are bodhisattvas who are unable to complete the two accumulations.

original: de ni lam dang mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lam dang mi mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called being incompatible with the path.

original: lam dang mi mthun pas na de dag la 'phral du 'phags par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam dang mi mthun pas na de dag la 'phral du 'phags par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are incompatible with the path, they do not immediately become ƒÅryas.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye mched do //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye mched do //
translated: The bases of the non-noble.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas na zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i lam de la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' lam la gnas na zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i lam de la gnas pa'o //
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva who is established in the path is established in the path as previously explained.

original: lam dang mi mthun pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed cing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam dang mi mthun pa la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed cing zhes bya ba la /
translated: He generates great compassion for sentient beings who are engaged in what is contrary to the path.

original: lam dang mi mthun pa la gnas pa'i sems can bcu pa rnams te /
analyzed: lam dang mi mthun pa la gnas pa'i sems can bcu pa rnams te /
translated: There are ten kinds of sentient beings who are engaged in what is contrary to the path.

original: sems can de dag la snying rje chen po bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag la snying rje chen po bskyed pa'o //
translated: He generates great compassion for those sentient beings.

original: lam gyi skye mched kyang mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni lam gyi skye mched las nyams par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: lam gyi skye mched kyang mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni lam gyi skye mched las nyams par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: He does not abandon the bases of the path. He does not fall away from the bases of the path.

original: de ltar shes pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i skye mched la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i skye mched la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva‚Äôs expertise with regard to the bases.

original: skye mched la mkhas pa bshad pa'i 'og tu bden pa la mkhas pa bstan te /
analyzed: skye mched la mkhas pa bshad pa'i 'og tu bden pa la mkhas pa bstan te /
translated: Expertise with regard to the Truths is taught immediately following the expertise with regard to the bases.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par 'dod nas /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par 'dod nas /
translated: The author wishes to explain it in accordance with the way in which it is taught.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva's expertise in the truths?

original: de la zhes bya ba'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the term here is as explained above.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs shing bshad pa rnams phyin ci ma log pa ma nor ba /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs shing bshad pa rnams phyin ci ma log pa ma nor ba /
translated: That which is taught and explained by the Tathagata is unerring and non-erroneous.

original: de kho na nyid mi slu ba yin pas na bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mi slu ba yin pas na bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the truth that is not deceptive, it is called truth.

original: bden pa de la mkhas pa ni bden pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa de la mkhas pa ni bden pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Expertise in that truth is expertise in the truths.

original: bden pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'o //üîΩ'jug pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin te zhes bya ba la rtogs pa bzhi 'am /
analyzed: bden pa'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'o // 'jug pa bzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa yin te zhes bya ba la rtogs pa bzhi 'am /
translated: It is the unerring realization of the nature and characteristics of the truths.üîΩThe four engagements are a bodhisattva's expertise in the truths.

original: shes pa bzhi ni @122b byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa bzhi ni @122b byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The four realizations or four knowledges are called a bodhisattva's expertise in the truths.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa la bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa la bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is intended that the realization of the four noble truths is [expertise in the truths].

original: bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to understand the method of teaching and explaining, he says, ‚ÄúWhat are the four kinds of engagement?‚Äù

original: rtogs pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtogs pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What are the four kinds of understanding?

original: gang 'di sdug bsngal shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan pa'i tshul bshad do //
analyzed: gang 'di sdug bsngal shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bstan pa'i tshul bshad do //
translated: He explains the method of teaching with ‚ÄúThe knowledge of suffering, etc.‚Äù

original: de la sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: He explains the method of explaining with ‚ÄúThe knowledge of suffering is the knowledge of the teaching of suffering, etc.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad ce na /
translated: Why are the four noble truths taught?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi 'bras bu dang / rgyu mdor phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi 'bras bu dang / rgyu mdor phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bshad do //
translated: The four noble truths are taught in order to unerringly teach, in brief, the result and cause of the side of affliction and the side of purification.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu mdor phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu mdor phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is the unerring teaching, in brief, of the result of affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu mdor phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu mdor phyin ci ma log pa bstan pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of origination is the concise, unerring teaching of the cause of the side of complete affliction.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi 'bras bu mdor phyin ci ma log par bstan pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi 'bras bu mdor phyin ci ma log par bstan pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is the concise, unerring teaching of the result of the side of complete purification.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi rgyu mdor phyin ci ma log par bstan pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi rgyu mdor phyin ci ma log par bstan pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the path is the concise, unerring teaching of the cause of the side of complete purification.

original: yang na nad dang / nad kyi gzhi dang / nad med pa dang / sman lta bur bstan pa'i phyir bden pa bzhi nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: yang na nad dang / nad kyi gzhi dang / nad med pa dang / sman lta bur bstan pa'i phyir bden pa bzhi nyid du bshad de /
translated: Or, the four truths are explained in order to teach them to be like a disease, the basis of a disease, freedom from disease, and medicine.

original: mi mang mi nyung zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The number of truths is not more or less than that.

original: de la nad lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //üîΩnad kyi gzhi lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la nad lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o // nad kyi gzhi lta bu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: Among them, the truth of suffering is like a disease.üîΩThe truth of origination is like the basis of a disease.

original: nad med pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: nad med pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is like freedom from disease.

original: sman lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sman lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the path is like medicine.

original: yang na me dang shing dang / me zhi ba dang / me 'gog pa'i rgyu lta bu yin pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bstan te me lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: yang na me dang shing dang / me zhi ba dang / me 'gog pa'i rgyu lta bu yin pas 'phags pa'i bden pa bstan te me lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ste /
translated: Or, it is like fire, fuel, the pacification of fire, and the cause for the cessation of fire.

original: me'i gdung ba dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal gyi gdung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me'i gdung ba dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal gyi gdung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The truth of suffering is like fire, because it is associated with the burning of suffering, like the burning of fire.

original: shing lta bu ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: shing lta bu ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of origin is like fuel,

original: shing me skye ba'i rgyu byed pa bzhin du kun 'byung ba yang sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing me skye ba'i rgyu byed pa bzhin du kun 'byung ba yang sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because origination is the cause for the generation of suffering, like fuel is the cause for the generation of fire.

original: me zhi ba lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: me zhi ba lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of cessation is like the pacification of fire,

original: me'i gdung ba zhi ba dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal gyi gdung ba zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me'i gdung ba zhi ba dang 'dra bar sdug bsngal gyi gdung ba zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cessation of suffering is like the pacification of the burning of fire.

original: me zhi ba'i rgyu lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: me zhi ba'i rgyu lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of the path is like the cause for the cessation of fire,

original: 'gog pa thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyang @123a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa thob pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyang @123a * //
translated: because it is the cause for the attainment of cessation.

original: na bu lon dang / dbul ba dang / bu lon sbyangs pa dang / gter lta bu yin pas bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: na bu lon dang / dbul ba dang / bu lon sbyangs pa dang / gter lta bu yin pas bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four noble truths are like a debt, poverty, paying off a debt, and a treasure.

original: bu lon lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: bu lon lta bu ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of suffering is like a debt,

original: rtag tu yid mi bde ba'i gdung ba dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: rtag tu yid mi bde ba'i gdung ba dang ldan pas so //
translated: because it is always accompanied by the distress of mental dissatisfaction.

original: dbul ba lta bu ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: dbul ba lta bu ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of origin is like poverty,

original: dbul ba'i rgyus bu lon chags pa dang 'dra bar kun 'byung ba'i rgyus sdug bsngal skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbul ba'i rgyus bu lon chags pa dang 'dra bar kun 'byung ba'i rgyus sdug bsngal skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because suffering is produced by the cause of origin, as a debt is produced by the cause of poverty.

original: bu lon sbyangs pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: bu lon sbyangs pa lta bu ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of cessation is like paying off a debt,

original: bu lon sbyangs na bu lon gyi mi bde ba med pa bzhin du sdug bsngal rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bu lon sbyangs na bu lon gyi mi bde ba med pa bzhin du sdug bsngal rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because suffering does not exist when cessation is attained, just as the distress of a debt does not exist when a debt is paid off.

original: gter lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: gter lta bu ni lam gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The truth of the path is like a treasure,

original: gter bu lon sbyong ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang 'dra bar lam ni 'gog pa 'thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gter bu lon sbyong ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang 'dra bar lam ni 'gog pa 'thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path is the cause of attaining cessation, just as a treasure is the cause of paying off a debt.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The following verse is stated to illustrate the knowledge of suffering.

original: de la sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang phung po rnams mi skye bar shes pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal shes pa zhes bya ba ni gang phung po rnams mi skye bar shes pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The statement, The knowledge of suffering is the knowledge that the aggregates do not arise,

original: spungs shing tshogs su gyur ba'i phyir phung po ste /
analyzed: spungs shing tshogs su gyur ba'i phyir phung po ste /
translated: means that the aggregates are so called because they are heaps and collections.

original: de'ang gzugs dang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de'ang gzugs dang tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: They are the aggregates of form, sensation, conception, volition, and consciousness.

original: phung po de dag sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan tsam du snang mod kyi /
analyzed: phung po de dag sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan tsam du snang mod kyi /
translated: Although these aggregates appear to be mere illusions and reflections,

original: ngo bo nyid kyi skye ba med pas na mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi skye ba med pas na mi skye ba'o //
translated: they are not produced by any essential nature, and so they are said not to arise.

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga rnams las 'phags pa nyan thos dag sdug bsngal ba dang mi rtag pa la sogs par rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga rnams las 'phags pa nyan thos dag sdug bsngal ba dang mi rtag pa la sogs par rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi ;
translated: Thus, the noble disciples of the hearers do not understand the five aggregates to be suffering, impermanent, and so forth.

original: thog ma nas ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes par shes pa ni sdug bsngal shes pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma nas ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes par shes pa ni sdug bsngal shes pa'o //
translated: Rather, the knowledge that they are primordially not produced by any essential nature is the knowledge of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba shes pa bstan pa'i phyir gang srid pa la legs par 'joms pa'i shes pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba shes pa bstan pa'i phyir gang srid pa la legs par 'joms pa'i shes pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of the origin of suffering, it is said, The knowledge that thoroughly conquers existence.

original: de la srid pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la srid pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is existence?

original: gang mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: gang mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Lord has said in the sutra:

original: yang srid pa 'byung bar byed pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dag de dag la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa 'byung bar byed pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / de dag de dag la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The cause of the origin of existence is the desire that is accompanied by the passion for pleasure and the craving that delights in those things.

original: de la sred pa ni sgo gsum gyis zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sred pa ni sgo gsum gyis zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Craving is threefold:

original: yang 'byung ba'i srid pa 'dod pa dang / yul 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i srid pa 'dod pa dang / yul 'dod pa'o //
translated: the desire for the origin of existence, the desire for objects, and the desire for pleasure.

original: de la yang 'byung ba'i srid pa 'dod pa 'di yang srid pa 'dod pa 'byung ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang 'byung ba'i srid pa 'dod pa 'di yang srid pa 'dod pa 'byung ba byed pa yin no //
translated: The desire for the origin of existence is the cause of the origin of the desire for existence.

original: yul 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yul 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The desire for objects is twofold:

original: yul thob pa rnams la yid bde zhing lhag par chags pa dang ldan pa dang / yul ma thob pa rnams la kun du sbyor bar 'dod pa dang ldan @123b pa'o ;
analyzed: yul thob pa rnams la yid bde zhing lhag par chags pa dang ldan pa dang / yul ma thob pa rnams la kun du sbyor bar 'dod pa dang ldan @123b pa'o ;
translated: the desire for objects that are obtained, which is accompanied by mental satisfaction and attachment; and the desire for objects that are not obtained, which is accompanied by the desire to obtain them.

original: / de la yul thob pa rnams la yid bde zhing lhag par chags pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de la yul thob pa rnams la yid bde zhing lhag par chags pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who is pleased and attached to the objects that have been obtained is said to be ‚Äúendowed with the attachment of delight. ‚Äù

original: yul ma thob pa rnams la kun tu sbyor bar 'dod pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de dag la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul ma thob pa rnams la kun tu sbyor bar 'dod pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de dag la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who is desirous of uniting with the objects that have not been obtained is said to be ‚Äúdelighting in them. ‚Äù

original: legs par 'joms pa'i shes pa ni srid pa de dag ma lus par spang ba'i thabs shes pa ste /
analyzed: legs par 'joms pa'i shes pa ni srid pa de dag ma lus par spang ba'i thabs shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the complete destruction of the latter is the knowledge of the means of completely abandoning those existences.

original: 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni spong ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction‚Äù means abandonment.

original: nyan thos dag ltar kun 'byung ba'i bden ba la rgyu dang rkyen la sogs par rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dag ltar kun 'byung ba'i bden ba la rgyu dang rkyen la sogs par rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not like the disciples who understand the truth of the origination of suffering in terms of causes and conditions, etc.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'byung ba'i rgyu 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin sred pa zhes bya ba rab tu spang ba'i thabs shes pa ni kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'byung ba'i rgyu 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin sred pa zhes bya ba rab tu spang ba'i thabs shes pa ni kun 'byung ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the means of completely abandoning the craving that has the nature of attachment, which is the cause of the origination of the mass of suffering, is called the knowledge of the origination of suffering.

original: 'gog pa shes pa bstan pa'i phyir 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang bag la nyal rnams mi 'byung ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa bstan pa'i phyir 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang bag la nyal rnams mi 'byung ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: To demonstrate the knowledge of cessation, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe knowledge of cessation is the non-occurrence of ignorance and the latent forms of the mental afflictions.‚Äù

original: de yang ma rig pa mi 'byung ba dang / bag la nyal rnams mi 'byung ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa mi 'byung ba dang / bag la nyal rnams mi 'byung ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe non-occurrence of ignorance and the latent forms of the mental afflictions‚Äù should be understood as follows:

original: de la ma rig pa ni de kho na la kun tu gti mug pa ste /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni de kho na la kun tu gti mug pa ste /
translated: Ignorance is the state of being confused about reality.

original: ma rig pa ma lus par spangs nas phyis de'i rgyud la mi skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma rig pa mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ma lus par spangs nas phyis de'i rgyud la mi skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma rig pa mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: The non-occurrence of ignorance is the state in which ignorance has been abandoned without remainder and will not arise again in the future.

original: bag la nyal gyi sgras 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan gyi bag la nyal la bya ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal gyi sgras 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan gyi bag la nyal la bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúlatent forms of the mental afflictions‚Äù refers to the latent forms of desire and the other mental afflictions.

original: de dag ma lus par spangs nas phyis de'i rgyud la mi skye ba'i bag la nyal rnams mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ma lus par spangs nas phyis de'i rgyud la mi skye ba'i bag la nyal rnams mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: The non-occurrence of the latent forms of the mental afflictions is the state in which they have been abandoned without remainder and will not arise again in the future.

original: bag la nyal smos pas ma rig pa yang smras pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bag la nyal smos pas ma rig pa yang smras pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the term ‚Äúlatent forms of the mental afflictions‚Äù also includes ignorance,

original: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /

original: gtso bo yin par bstan pa'i phyir ming gis bkar te smos te /
analyzed: gtso bo yin par bstan pa'i phyir ming gis bkar te smos te /
translated: It is mentioned by name in order to show that it is the main one.

original: yang na ma rig pa bag la nyal bas na ma rig pas bag la nyal te /
analyzed: yang na ma rig pa bag la nyal bas na ma rig pas bag la nyal te /
translated: Or else, it is the latency of ignorance because it is the latency of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i bag la nyal rnams thog ma nas ma skyes pas mtha' 'gag pa yang med pa ni ma rig pa dang bag la nyal rnams mi 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i bag la nyal rnams thog ma nas ma skyes pas mtha' 'gag pa yang med pa ni ma rig pa dang bag la nyal rnams mi 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-arising of ignorance and the latencies from the beginning is also the non-cessation of the end. This is called the non-arising of ignorance and the latencies.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'phags pa nyan thos dag ltar zhi ba dang gya nom pa la sogs pa rtog pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'phags pa nyan thos dag ltar zhi ba dang gya nom pa la sogs pa rtog pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The noble disciples do not conceive the truth of cessation as peace, sublime, and so on.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa bag la nyal rnams thog ma nas ma skyes pas mtha' 'gag pa yang med par shes pa ni 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa bag la nyal rnams thog ma nas ma skyes pas mtha' 'gag pa yang med par shes pa ni 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Rather, it is the knowledge that the latencies of ignorance and so on do not arise from the beginning and thus do not cease in the end. This is called cessation.

original: lam shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of the path,üîΩthe text says:

original: lam shes pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i chos thams cad la sgro mi 'dogs pa @124a * //
analyzed: lam shes pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i chos thams cad la sgro mi 'dogs pa @124a * //
translated: The knowledge of the path is the non-superimposition of all phenomena that have become the same.

original: ste zhes bya ba smos te lam gyi bden pa la yang 'phags pa nyan thos pa dag ltar nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs sgrub par rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ste zhes bya ba smos te lam gyi bden pa la yang 'phags pa nyan thos pa dag ltar nyon mongs pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs sgrub par rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù indicates that, unlike the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas, they do not understand the truth of the path as the abandonment of the side of the afflictions and the practice of the side of purification.

original: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs gnyi g-yang mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas de nyid la sgro 'dogs pa med pa ni lam shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs gnyi g-yang mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas de nyid la sgro 'dogs pa med pa ni lam shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Rather, they understand the equality of both the side of the afflictions and the side of purification. The absence of reification with regard to that is called ‚Äúknowledge of the path.‚Äù

original: yang na chos thams cad ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar ro gcig pas mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar ro gcig pas mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, since all phenomena are of one taste, like space, they are equal.

original: mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i chos de dag las spang ba dang / blang ba dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa dang / skye ba dang / mi skye ba la sogs par sgro mi 'dogs pa ni lam shes pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i chos de dag las spang ba dang / blang ba dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa dang / skye ba dang / mi skye ba la sogs par sgro mi 'dogs pa ni lam shes pa'o //
translated: The absence of reification with regard to those phenomena that are equal, as being abandonable, or acceptable, or permanent, or impermanent, or existent, or nonexistent, or produced, or unproduced, and so on, is knowledge of the path.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba la bden pa bzhi po gong du bshad pa lta bu'i tshul du shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba la bden pa bzhi po gong du bshad pa lta bu'i tshul du shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is the bodhisattva's knowledge of the truths.üîΩThe knowledge of the four truths in the manner explained above is called the bodhisattva's knowledge of the truths.üîΩIn order to show that those bodhisattva knowledges of the truths are also embraced by wisdom and method, it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa shes pa de dag kyang shes rab dang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir de la byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag la de lta bur shes rab dang ye shes kyis rab tu
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa shes pa de dag kyang shes rab dang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir de la byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag la de lta bur shes rab dang ye shes kyis rab tu
translated: In that regard, the bodhisattvas, although they know those four noble truths in that way through wisdom and knowledge,

analyzed: 'phags par 'gyur ba'i bden pa yin pas na 'phags pa'i bden pa 'am /

analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa de dag de kho na lta bu yin par bden pa'i sgo nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen cing gzigs kyi byis pa rnams kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes mi mthong bas na /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams zhes bya'o ;

translated: Or, they are called noble truths because they are the truths explained by the noble ones, the Buddhas and the Buddha‚Äôs ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'chad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa 'dzin pa dang / 'phags par 'gyur ba'i rgyu byed pas na 'phags ba'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'chad pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa 'dzin pa dang / 'phags par 'gyur ba'i rgyu byed pas na 'phags ba'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Even the explanations of those who are not noble ones are called noble truths because they are explanations by the power of the TathƒÅgatas, because they uphold the teaching of the Bhagavat, and because they act as a cause for becoming a noble one.

original: de lta bur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as they are‚Äù means

analyzed: yang na skabs 'dir @124b shes rab bshad pas shes rab nyid gong du bshad pa lta bu'i tshul du stong par rtogs pa la ye shes zhes bya ste /

original: 'di ni shes rab kyis zin pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyis zin pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the inclusion of wisdom.üîΩAlthough he realizes the four noble truths in this way, he does not actualize them because he views sentient beings and he ripens sentient beings.

analyzed: sems can la lta ba'i phyir mngon sum du mi byed cing sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed de zhes bya ba ni de ltar bden pa bzhi rtogs kyang snying rje chen pos sems can gyi don gyi phyir nyan thos bzhin du zhi ba phyogs gcig
translated: Although he realizes the four noble truths in this way, he does not actualize them like the sravakas, who actualize the one-sided nirvƒÅ·πáa of the Hinayana, because of his great compassion for the sake of sentient beings.

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba la thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa gong du bshad pa lta bur bden pa bzhi po shes pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa'o // bden pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni gong du bden pa bzhi bshad pa tsam du yang ma zad kyi /

original: bden pa rnam pa gsum yang yod de zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //üîΩ'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /üîΩgang 'di kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'i tshul lo //

analyzed: mtshan nyid bden pa yin pas na mtshan nyid kyi bden pa yin pa ste /

analyzed: chos thams cad ro gcig par ma nor ba'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir bden pa rnam pa gsum bshad ce na /

analyzed: sems can rnam pa gsum gyi don du dgongs nas bden pa rnam pa gsum bshad de /

analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa bshad par bzhed nas /

analyzed: ji snyed kyi sgra ni ji tsam yod pa'i don drangs te /

analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ni bstan pa'o //
