analyzed: de yang yid kyi dang ngag gi sgo nas ston pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: And these are shown in two ways, by the mind and by speech.

original: de la yid kyis ston pa ni ji ltar brgya byin la yid kyis chos mngon par bshad pa dang / de dag gis kyang rang gi the tshom yid la btags pa dang / lan kyang yid kyis tshigs su bcad pas glan no //
analyzed: de la yid kyis ston pa ni ji ltar brgya byin la yid kyis chos mngon par bshad pa dang / de dag gis kyang rang gi the tshom yid la btags pa dang / lan kyang yid kyis tshigs su bcad pas glan no //
translated: In this regard, the teaching by the mind is like the teaching of Abhidharma by Sakra to the gods by means of the mind, and their reception of it by means of the mind, and their reply by means of the mind in verse.

original: mdo de dang de dag las 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo de dang de dag las 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like what appears in such and such s≈´tras.

original: ngag gis bstan pa ni tshig gi rig byed rnam pa sna tshogs nyan pa'i gang zag rnams kyi rna bar song ba rnams so //
analyzed: ngag gis bstan pa ni tshig gi rig byed rnam pa sna tshogs nyan pa'i gang zag rnams kyi rna bar song ba rnams so //
translated: Verbal teachings are the various kinds of verbal expressions that reach the ears of those who listen.

original: de dag gis ni mdor na 'di skad du /
analyzed: de dag gis ni mdor na 'di skad du /
translated: In brief, they indicate this:

original: gdul @125b bar bya ba'i sems can rnams kyi dbang du ji tsam du tha snyad brjod pa thams cad kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gdul @125b bar bya ba'i sems can rnams kyi dbang du ji tsam du tha snyad brjod pa thams cad kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: All the conventional expressions that are made for the sake of sentient beings who are to be trained are conventional truths.

original: de ltar dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de ltar dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las kyang /
translated: Thus, the Cloud of Jewels S≈´tra also says:

original: rigs kyi bu chos bcu dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob la mkhas pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos bcu dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob la mkhas pa rnams yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúChild of a good family, if bodhisattvas have ten qualities, they are skilled in the conventional.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs su'ang 'dogs la /
analyzed: gzugs su'ang 'dogs la /
translated: They designate things as forms,

original: don dam par na gzugs su'ang mi dmigs shing mi chags so //
analyzed: don dam par na gzugs su'ang mi dmigs shing mi chags so //
translated: but ultimately they do not observe forms and are not attached to them.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes par yang 'dogs la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes par yang 'dogs la /
translated: Similarly, they designate things as feelings, discriminations, composites, and consciousnesses,

original: don dam par na rnam par shes par yang mi dmigs shing mngon par mi chags so zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su'ang 'dogs la /
analyzed: don dam par na rnam par shes par yang mi dmigs shing mngon par mi chags so zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su'ang 'dogs la /
translated: Ultimately, consciousness is not observed and does not become attached.üîΩThis is how the qualities of a buddha are designated,

original: don dam par na sangs rgyas kyi chos su yang mi dmigs shing mngon par mi chags so //
analyzed: don dam par na sangs rgyas kyi chos su yang mi dmigs shing mngon par mi chags so //
translated: but ultimately, the qualities of a buddha are not observed and do not become attached.

original: byang chub tu'ang 'dogs la byang chub sems dpar yang mi dmigs shing de la mngon par mi chags so //
analyzed: byang chub tu'ang 'dogs la byang chub sems dpar yang mi dmigs shing de la mngon par mi chags so //
translated: Awakening is designated, but a bodhisattva is not observed and does not become attached.

original: rigs kyi bu de lta bas na ming dang 'dogs pa dang / tha snyad de ni kun rdzob ces bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de lta bas na ming dang 'dogs pa dang / tha snyad de ni kun rdzob ces bya ste /
translated: Son of noble family, therefore, name, designation, and convention are called the relative.

original: kun rdzob kyi chos rnam la don dam pa med kyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi chos rnam la don dam pa med kyi /
translated: Relative phenomena do not have an ultimate meaning.

original: kun rdzob kyi chos med par yang don dam par bstan par mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi chos med par yang don dam par bstan par mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
translated: But without relative phenomena, the ultimate cannot be taught.

original: de las bzlog pa ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni don dam pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is the ultimate.

original: de bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: de bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Wishing to teach that,

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni gang la sems kyi rgyu ba yang med pa ste /
translated: the ultimate truth is where the movement of the mind does not exist.

original: yi ge lta ci smos zhes bya ba gsungs so //üîΩdon dam pa ni skye ba dang / mi skye ba dang / bsam du yod pa dang / bsam du med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / brjod du yod pa dang / brjod du med pa dang / 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: yi ge lta ci smos zhes bya ba gsungs so // don dam pa ni skye ba dang / mi skye ba dang / bsam du yod pa dang / bsam du med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / brjod du yod pa dang / brjod du med pa dang / 'gog pa dang /
translated: What need be said about letters?üîΩThe ultimate is beyond all elaborations such as arising and non-arising, conceivable and inconceivable, permanent and impermanent, expressible and inexpressible, cessation and non-cessation, knowable and unknowable, permanent and impermanent, and so on.

original: mi 'gog pa dang / shes par rung ba dang / shes par mi rung ba dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i spros pa thams cad las 'das pa yin pas sems kyi rgyu ba med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi 'gog pa dang / shes par rung ba dang / shes par mi rung ba dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i spros pa thams cad las 'das pa yin pas sems kyi rgyu ba med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúwithout mental activity.‚Äù

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i spyod yul las 'das te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i spyod yul las 'das te /
translated: It is beyond the domain of mind and mental factors.

original: don dam pa dang de'i rig pa'i ye shes gnyis su med pa'i phyir sems kyi yul du yang mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: don dam pa dang de'i rig pa'i ye shes gnyis su med pa'i phyir sems kyi yul du yang mi 'gyur na /
translated: Since the ultimate and the wisdom that knows it are non-dual, it is not even the object of mind,üîΩwhat need be said about letters?

original: yi ge lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yi ge lta ci smos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de bas na dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Ratnamegha-sutra says:

original: rigs kyi bu chos bcu dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i don dam pa la mkhas pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos bcu dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i don dam pa la mkhas pa rnams yin no //
translated: Son of noble family, those who have ten qualities are skilled in the ultimate of bodhisattvas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mi skye ba'i chos nyid dang @126a * //üîΩldan pa rnams yin /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos nyid dang @126a * // ldan pa rnams yin /
translated: They have the nature of non-arising.üîΩThey have the nature of non-cessation.üîΩThey have the nature of non-destruction.üîΩThey have the nature of non-acceptance and non-rejection.üîΩThey have the nature of transcending the domain of words.

original: mi 'gag pa'i chos nyid dang / mi 'jig pa'i chos nyid dang / mi len mi 'dor ba'i chos nyid dang / tshig gi spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i chos nyid dang / smrar med pa'i chos nyid dang / spros pa med pa'i chos nyid dang /
analyzed: mi 'gag pa'i chos nyid dang / mi 'jig pa'i chos nyid dang / mi len mi 'dor ba'i chos nyid dang / tshig gi spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i chos nyid dang / smrar med pa'i chos nyid dang / spros pa med pa'i chos nyid dang /
translated: They have the nature of being inexpressible.üîΩThey have the nature of being free from mental proliferation.

original: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so /
translated: They have the nature of being beyond description.

original: de la mtshan nyid kyi bden pa bshad par bzhed nas mtshan nyid kyi bden pa gang zhen zhes khong nas dris pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi bden pa ni gang 'di mtshan nyid thams cad mtshan nyid gcig pa ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyi bden pa bshad par bzhed nas mtshan nyid kyi bden pa gang zhen zhes khong nas dris pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi bden pa ni gang 'di mtshan nyid thams cad mtshan nyid gcig pa ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: With the intention to explain the truth of characteristics, it is asked from within, What is the truth of characteristics? and it is stated, The truth of characteristics is that all characteristics are one characteristic.

original: 'di ltar sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba dang / chu'i mtshan nyid gsher ba dang zhes bya ba nas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / tshor ba'i mtshan nyid myong bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad ni mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba dang / chu'i mtshan nyid gsher ba dang zhes bya ba nas gzugs kyi mtshan nyid thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / tshor ba'i mtshan nyid myong bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad ni mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of earth is solidity, the characteristic of water is fluidity, and so on up to the characteristic of form is resistance, and the characteristic of feeling is experience, and so on. All of these are of one characteristic.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'dra ba'i phyir ro//
translated: Because they are similar in being the characteristic of suchness.

original: mtshan nyid gcig po de'i mtshan nyid kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig po de'i mtshan nyid kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of that one characteristic?

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig po yang mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig po yang mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThat one characteristic is also without characteristic.‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid de ni mtshan nyid du bgrang ba thams cad las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ni mtshan nyid du bgrang ba thams cad las 'das pa ste /
translated: That suchness transcends all enumerations of characteristics.

original: skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang ; mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang gi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pas na mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang ; mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang gi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pas na mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: Since it is not the characteristic of anything, such as arising, ceasing, existing, not existing, permanent, impermanent, and so on, it is without characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i bden pa 'di yang don dam pa'i bden pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i bden pa 'di yang don dam pa'i bden pa nyid de /
translated: This truth without characteristics is also the ultimate truth.

original: de la gzhan ma yin na ci'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba dang / mtshan nyid kyi bden pa zhes bya ba gnyis su bshad ;
analyzed: de la gzhan ma yin na ci'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba dang / mtshan nyid kyi bden pa zhes bya ba gnyis su bshad ;
translated: If it is not different from that, why is it explained as two: ultimate truth and truth of characteristics?

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true.

original: de las gzhan ma yin mod kyi /üîΩ'dis don dam pa mtshon par byed /
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin mod kyi / 'dis don dam pa mtshon par byed /
translated: It is not different from that.

original: khong du chud par byed pas na mtshan nyid kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: khong du chud par byed pas na mtshan nyid kyi bden pa ste /
translated: But it is the truth of characteristics because it causes the ultimate to be characterized and understood.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid kyi bden pa ni don dam pa la 'jug pa'i sgo lta bur gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid kyi bden pa ni don dam pa la 'jug pa'i sgo lta bur gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the truth of characteristics is posited as a gateway for engaging the ultimate.

original: yang na sems can rnam pa gsum gyi don gyi phyir bden pa rnam pa gsum bshad de /
analyzed: yang na sems can rnam pa gsum gyi don gyi phyir bden pa rnam pa gsum bshad de /
translated: Or, the three truths are explained for the sake of the three types of sentient beings.

original: nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa rnam pa gsum yang thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa rnam pa gsum yang thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa yin te /
translated: The three types of bodhisattva truths are also fully embraced by method and wisdom.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pas yongs su mi skyo ba zhes bya ba la sogs @126b pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pas yongs su mi skyo ba zhes bya ba la sogs @126b pa gsungs te /
translated: In this regard, the verse The bodhisattva is not discouraged by teaching conventional truth and so forth is stated.

original: sems can gyi don du byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob kyi bden pa tha snyad dang / yi ge dang / brda la sogs pa gzhan la bstan kyang kun rdzob kyi bden pa la yid 'byung zhing skyo ba med de /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du byang chub sems dpa' kun rdzob kyi bden pa tha snyad dang / yi ge dang / brda la sogs pa gzhan la bstan kyang kun rdzob kyi bden pa la yid 'byung zhing skyo ba med de /
translated: Even though the bodhisattva teaches conventional truth, such as terminology, letters, symbols, and so forth, to others for the sake of sentient beings, he is not discouraged or wearied by conventional truth.

original: shes rab kyis zin pas de dag sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan lta bur dngos po med par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis zin pas de dag sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan lta bur dngos po med par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he comprehends that they are like illusions, dreams, and reflections, being devoid of entities, by being embraced by wisdom.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byed par yang mi ltung zhes bya ba ni thabs kyis yongs su zin pas ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos rnams zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa lta bur de bzhin nyid 'ba' zhig gi
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byed par yang mi ltung zhes bya ba ni thabs kyis yongs su zin pas ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos rnams zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa lta bur de bzhin nyid 'ba' zhig gi
translated: He does not fall into actualizing ultimate truth. This means that, because he is embraced by method, he does not abide in suchness alone, like the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas who abide in the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is a one-sided peace.

original: phyogs su yang gnas par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩmtshan nyid kyi bden pas bden pa gcig tu rtogs kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi bden pa khong du chud pas don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: phyogs su yang gnas par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to // mtshan nyid kyi bden pas bden pa gcig tu rtogs kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi bden pa khong du chud pas don dam pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / sdug bsngal dang /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdoes not abide in any direction‚Äù is that it does not abide in any extreme.üîΩAlthough one realizes the one truth through the truth of characteristics, one ripens sentient beings.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du ro gcig par rtogs kyang thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis theg pa rnam pa gsum du gar rigs rigs su sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid du ro gcig par rtogs kyang thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis theg pa rnam pa gsum du gar rigs rigs su sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: Although one realizes that the truths of ultimate and conventional reality, suffering, origination, cessation, path, and so forth are of one taste in the characteristic of suchness through comprehending the truth of characteristics, one ripens sentient beings in the three vehicles through various methods, in whatever way is appropriate.

original: de lta bur thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i bden pa rtogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i bden pa rtogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The realization of the truth in this way, embraced by method and wisdom, is called the bodhisattva‚Äôs expertise in the truth.

original: de la yongs su smin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su smin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is complete ripening?

original: de yang mdor rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold:

original: yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'o ;
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'o ;
translated: the nature of complete maturation, the person who is being brought to complete maturation, and the classification of complete maturation.üîΩThe nature of complete maturation is like a fruit that, when ripe, is ready to burst open and, when the fruit is ripe, is ready to be eaten.

original: / yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin ni dper na 'bras smin par gyur na rdol par 'os pa dang / 'bras bu smin nas nam kun tu bza' bar 'os pa'i dus na yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du dge ba'i chos rnams kyi sa bon yang nas yang du bsten pa dang ldan pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar nus pa
analyzed: / yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin ni dper na 'bras smin par gyur na rdol par 'os pa dang / 'bras bu smin nas nam kun tu bza' bar 'os pa'i dus na yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du dge ba'i chos rnams kyi sa bon yang nas yang du bsten pa dang ldan pas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar nus pa
translated: In the same way, the seed of virtuous qualities, by being repeatedly cultivated, is able to eliminate the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus dang sems las su rung ba rnyed nas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i mthu dang ldan pa ni yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus dang sems las su rung ba rnyed nas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i mthu dang ldan pa ni yongs su smin pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: When one obtains a body and mind that are fit for the elimination of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, one is said to have the nature of complete maturation.

original: yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag ni rnam pa bzhin ste /üîΩnyan thos kyi rigs can dang / rang @127a * //
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag ni rnam pa bzhin ste / nyan thos kyi rigs can dang / rang @127a * //
translated: The person to be matured is of four kinds:

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang / rigs med pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs can dang / rigs med pa'i gang zag go //
translated: the disciple, the hermit buddha, the bodhisattva, and the person without potential.

original: de la rigs can gsum ni theg pa gsum du yongs su smin par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rigs can gsum ni theg pa gsum du yongs su smin par bya'o //
translated: Of these, the first three are to be matured in the three vehicles.

original: rigs med pa'i gang zag kyang lha dang mi'i bde 'gror yongs su smin par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs med pa'i gang zag kyang lha dang mi'i bde 'gror yongs su smin par bya'o //
translated: The person without potential is to be matured in the happy destinies of gods and humans.

original: yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa rab tu dbye ba yang mdor na gsum ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa rab tu dbye ba yang mdor na gsum ste /
translated: The classification of the aspects of maturity is also threefold:

original: dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang / shes pa yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang / shes pa yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: maturity of the faculties, maturity of the wholesome roots, and maturity of knowledge.

original: de la dbang po yongs su smin pa ni tshe dang / mdog dang / rigs dang / dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshig btsun pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa dang / mir gyur pa dang / rig pa'i gnas rnams la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po yongs su smin pa ni tshe dang / mdog dang / rigs dang / dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshig btsun pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa dang / mir gyur pa dang / rig pa'i gnas rnams la mkhas pa'o //

translated: In that regard, it is said that ‚Äúbodhisattvas are not discouraged by teaching conventional truth.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis bdag la bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bdag la bstan pa ste /
translated: Teaching conventional truth is either explaining suffering, origination, and so on to others or being taught those by others.

original: yongs su mi skyo ba ni shes rab kyi tha snyad kyi bden pa thams cad don dam par dngos po med par khong du chud pas de dag las yid byung zhing skrag pa dang ; dngos por 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su mi skyo ba ni shes rab kyi tha snyad kyi bden pa thams cad don dam par dngos po med par khong du chud pas de dag las yid byung zhing skrag pa dang ; dngos por 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not being discouraged means that, by understanding that all conventional truths are ultimately unreal, one is not discouraged or frightened by them, and does not grasp at substantial reality.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byed par yang mi ltung la zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bur khong du chud de /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mngon sum du byed par yang mi ltung la zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bur khong du chud de /
translated: Not falling into the direct realization of ultimate truth means that, understanding that all things are like illusions and dreams,

original: de yang ma brtags na gcig tu dga' ba tsam med pa ma yin zhes rig pa'i thabs kyis yongs su zin pas na /
analyzed: de yang ma brtags na gcig tu dga' ba tsam med pa ma yin zhes rig pa'i thabs kyis yongs su zin pas na /
translated: one does not fall into the extreme of nihilism, thinking that there is nothing at all, but rather, by the skillful means of understanding,

original: de kho na nyid 'ba' zhig la yang gnas par mi byed la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid 'ba' zhig la yang gnas par mi byed la /
translated: one does not remain in reality alone.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The maturation of sentient beings by means of wisdom and skillful means is called the bodhisattva‚Äôs expertise in the truths.

original: chos 'di pa dang / phyi rol pa rnams lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa'i gnyan por gzhan yang bden pa ni gcig ste gnyis su med ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: chos 'di pa dang / phyi rol pa rnams lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa'i gnyan por gzhan yang bden pa ni gcig ste gnyis su med ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha taught the truth is one, there is no second as an antidote to the various views of Buddhists and non-Buddhists.

original: gnyis su mde do zhes bya bas ni 'dir bden pa gcig bstan pa las ma gtogs pa rnams yang dag pa ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su mde do zhes bya bas ni 'dir bden pa gcig bstan pa las ma gtogs pa rnams yang dag pa ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: By saying two he shows that apart from the teaching of one truth, the others are not true.

original: bden pa gcig po gang zhe na zhes khong nas dris pa dang / de la bden pa gcig ni gang 'di chos thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa med cing sgro 'dogs par ltung pa'i sems can rnams kyang bden pa la rab tu gzud pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bden pa gcig po gang zhe na zhes khong nas dris pa dang / de la bden pa gcig ni gang 'di chos thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa med cing sgro 'dogs par ltung pa'i sems can rnams kyang bden pa la rab tu gzud pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: When asked what is the one truth? he said, The one truth is that all phenomena are inexpressible, and those who fall into the view of exaggeration are led to the truth.

original: chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa la /
analyzed: chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa la /
translated: All phenomena are by nature inexpressible.

original: gal te ming dang tshig dang yi ge dag gis gang zag @129a * //
analyzed: gal te ming dang tshig dang yi ge dag gis gang zag @129a * //
translated: If one were to express them with names, phrases, and letters,

original: dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu 'dogs na de ni sgro 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid dam bye brag tu 'dogs na de ni sgro 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: If one attributes an essence or a particular to phenomena, that is reification.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ji skad du btags bde dag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ji skad du btags bde dag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of phenomena is not as they are designated.

original: de ltar chos rnams la sgro mi 'dogs shing /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams la sgro mi 'dogs shing /
translated: Thus, one does not reify phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du yang shes par byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin du yang shes par byed la /
translated: And one causes the understanding of the nature of reality.

original: sgro 'dogs par ltung ba spros pa sna tshogs la mngon bar zhen pa'i sems can rnams kyang brjod du med pa'i bden pa de la rab tu 'dzud pa ni bden pa gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs par ltung ba spros pa sna tshogs la mngon bar zhen pa'i sems can rnams kyang brjod du med pa'i bden pa de la rab tu 'dzud pa ni bden pa gcig ces bya'o //
translated: And one causes those sentient beings who have fallen into reification and cling to the various conceptual elaborations to enter into that inexpressible truth. That is called the one truth.

original: 'dir yang thabs dang shes rab kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang thabs dang shes rab kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to teach by means of method and wisdom,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sgro 'dogs pa'i bden pa bstan pas kyang mi skyo la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sgro 'dogs pa'i bden pa bstan pas kyang mi skyo la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúTherein, the bodhisattva is not discouraged by teaching the truth of reification.‚Äù

original: de ltar bden pa gcig po de ni tshig gi spyod yul ma yin yang sems can de la gzud pa'i thabs gzhan med pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis sgro btags nas ston pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i bden pa ste
analyzed: de ltar bden pa gcig po de ni tshig gi spyod yul ma yin yang sems can de la gzud pa'i thabs gzhan med pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis sgro btags nas ston pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i bden pa ste
translated: Although that one truth is not the domain of words, since there is no other means to introduce sentient beings to it, it is taught by superimposing words such as conditioned and unconditioned.

original: / de dag bstan pas kyang mi skyo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩbshad pa gzhan ni snga ma bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: / de dag bstan pas kyang mi skyo zhes bya ba'i don to // bshad pa gzhan ni snga ma bzhin du blta'o //
translated: The meaning of that is ‚Äúone should not be discouraged by those teachings.‚Äù

original: gong du bden pa bzhi bshad pa'i rnam grangs bstan par bzhed de /üîΩsdug bsngal gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgzhan yang phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba ste /üîΩgang phung po lnga rnams kyi mtshan nyid 'di ni sdug bsngal zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gong du bden pa bzhi bshad pa'i rnam grangs bstan par bzhed de /üîΩsdug bsngal gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgzhan yang phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba ste /üîΩgang phung po lnga rnams kyi mtshan nyid 'di ni sdug bsngal zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: The other explanations should be viewed as before.

original: de la dang po dang bar ma dang tha ma'i sdug bsngal rnams bsdus pa'i don gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang po dang bar ma dang tha ma'i sdug bsngal rnams bsdus pa'i don gyis ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The five aggregates of form, etc., are called suffering because they include the three kinds of suffering: the suffering of pain, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: de la dang po'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la dang po'i sdug bsngal ni skye ba'o //
translated: The suffering of pain is the suffering of birth.

original: bar gyi sdug bsngal ni na ba dang rga ba dang / 'dod pa mi rnyed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bar gyi sdug bsngal ni na ba dang rga ba dang / 'dod pa mi rnyed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The suffering of change is the suffering of disease, old age, the non-attainment of what is desired, etc.

original: tha ma'i sdug bsngal ni 'chi ba ste /üîΩsdug bsngal de dag nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas der 'dus pas na phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tha ma'i sdug bsngal ni 'chi ba ste / sdug bsngal de dag nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i gnas der 'dus pas na phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The suffering of the formative forces is the suffering of death.üîΩThe five aggregates are called suffering because they are the basis for the occurrence of these three kinds of suffering.

original: de la phung po lnga rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa sdug bsngal yin par ston to //
analyzed: de la phung po lnga rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa sdug bsngal yin par ston to //
translated: The characteristic of suffering in the five aggregates is shown to be suffering.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of suffering, he says:

original: gang gis mtshan nyid de stong par rtogs pa 'di ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis mtshan nyid de stong par rtogs pa 'di ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is the noble truth of the knowledge of suffering as suffering.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dag ltar sdug bsngal gyi dngos po yod par lta ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dag ltar sdug bsngal gyi dngos po yod par lta ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not like the view of the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas, who see the thing that is suffering as existent.

original: gang zag gang gis gong du bshad pa'i sdug bsngal nyid kyang rang bzhin @129b med cing mi dmigs par rtogs pa de ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gang gis gong du bshad pa'i sdug bsngal nyid kyang rang bzhin @129b med cing mi dmigs par rtogs pa de ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The person who realizes that the suffering explained above is also essenceless and unobservable is said to have the noble truth of the knowledge of suffering as suffering.üîΩIn order to teach the origin,

original: kun 'byung ba gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it says,üîΩThe cause of craving for the five aggregates and the cause of views,

original: gang phung po lnga'i sred pa'i rgyu dang lta ba'i rgyu bag la nyal 'di ni kun 'byung ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang phung po lnga'i sred pa'i rgyu dang lta ba'i rgyu bag la nyal 'di ni kun 'byung ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: which is latent, is origin.

original: phung po lnga po de dag skyed pa'i rgyu ni phung po lnga'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag skyed pa'i rgyu ni phung po lnga'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of the arising of those five aggregates is the cause of the five aggregates.

original: de yang sred pa'i rgyu dang lta ba'i rgyu las phung po lnga la skye'o //
analyzed: de yang sred pa'i rgyu dang lta ba'i rgyu las phung po lnga la skye'o //
translated: Moreover, the five aggregates arise from the cause of craving and the cause of views.

original: de la sred pa dang lta pa ni sngar bshad par zad do //
analyzed: de la sred pa dang lta pa ni sngar bshad par zad do //
translated: Craving and views have already been explained above.

original: sred pa dang lta ba de dag nyid rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: sred pa dang lta ba de dag nyid rgyu yin pas /
translated: Since those very craving and views are causes,

original: sred pa'i rgyu dang lta ba'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu dang lta ba'i rgyu zhes bya ste /
translated: they are called the cause of craving and the cause of views.

original: bag la nyal yang de gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal yang de gnyis la bya'o //
translated: Latent states are also to be understood as those two.

original: ji ltar kun 'byung ba shes pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar kun 'byung ba shes pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of origination,

original: gang gis sred pa'i rgyu dang lta ba'i rgyu de dag pa mi len pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis sred pa'i rgyu dang lta ba'i rgyu de dag pa mi len pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúBy not taking up the cause of craving and the cause of views, and so on.

original: mi len pa ni sred pa dang lta ba la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mi len pa ni sred pa dang lta ba la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Not taking up is not apprehending craving and views as signs.

original: sgro mi 'dogs pa ni de dgal med pa dang / yod par mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: sgro mi 'dogs pa ni de dgal med pa dang / yod par mi lta ba'o //
translated: Not superimposing is not viewing them as nonexistent or existent.

original: reg par mi byed pa ni de dag gi rang bzhin la rtog par mi byed pa 'am /
analyzed: reg par mi byed pa ni de dag gi rang bzhin la rtog par mi byed pa 'am /
translated: Not contacting is not conceptualizing their nature,

original: sred pa dang lta ba la spyod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang lta ba la spyod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: or not engaging in craving and views.

original: des ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: phung po lnga'i rgyu sred pa dang lta ba rnams rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs shing dngos po med par rtogs na /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i rgyu sred pa dang lta ba rnams rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs shing dngos po med par rtogs na /
translated: If one realizes that craving and views, which are the causes of the five aggregates, are not perceived as having any intrinsic nature and are insubstantial,

original: kun 'byung ba la kun 'byung bar shes pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la kun 'byung bar shes pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the noble truth of the origin of suffering as the understanding of the origin in terms of the origin.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of the truth of cessation,

original: gang phung po lnga rnams shin tu zad de 'gags nas sngon gyi mthar mi 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang phung po lnga rnams shin tu zad de 'gags nas sngon gyi mthar mi 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúWhen the five aggregates are completely exhausted and cease, they do not arise in the past‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: shin tu zad pa ni phung po lnga bskyed pa'i rgyu sred pa'i bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal spangs pas skye ba'i rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu zad pa ni phung po lnga bskyed pa'i rgyu sred pa'i bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal spangs pas skye ba'i rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúComplete exhaustion‚Äù means that the continuum of birth is severed by abandoning the latent tendencies of craving and the latent tendencies of views, which are the causes that produce the five aggregates.

original: 'gags pa ni skye ba gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor zhing ma 'ongs pa'i phung po skyed pa'i rgyu mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni skye ba gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor zhing ma 'ongs pa'i phung po skyed pa'i rgyu mi byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCessation‚Äù means not connecting with another birth and not acting as the cause for producing future aggregates.

original: yang na skad cig ma re re la skye ba med pas na shin tu zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na skad cig ma re re la skye ba med pas na shin tu zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is called ‚Äúcomplete exhaustion‚Äù because there is no arising in each moment.

original: tshe'i nyid mtshams gcig nas gcig tu mtshams sbyor zhing skye ba med pas na 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: tshe'i nyid mtshams gcig nas gcig tu mtshams sbyor zhing skye ba med pas na 'gag pa'o //
translated: It is unceasing because it is not born from one limit of life to another.

original: yang na skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir shin tu zad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir shin tu zad pa'o //
translated: Or, it is utterly exhausted because it is free from the characteristic of birth.

original: 'jig pa'i chos dang bral ba'i phyir shin tu 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos dang bral ba'i phyir shin tu 'gag pa'o //
translated: It is utterly stopped because it is free from the nature of destruction.

original: de nyid kyi don gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of that, it is said:

original: sngon gyi mthar mi 'byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho ba dang / da ltar byung bar phyin pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar mi 'byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho ba dang / da ltar byung bar phyin pa med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It does not come from a prior limit, it does not go to a later limit, and it does not stay in the present.

original: @130a * // sngon gyi mthar mi 'byung ba ni 'das pa'i dus su yang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: @130a * // sngon gyi mthar mi 'byung ba ni 'das pa'i dus su yang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: It does not come from a prior limit means that it was not born in the past.

original: phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho ba ni da ltar gyi dus nas phung po lnga'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs shing /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho ba ni da ltar gyi dus nas phung po lnga'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs shing /
translated: It does not go to a later limit means that from the present time on, it is free from the causes of the five aggregates, karma and afflictions, and

original: phung po lnga yang rang bzhin med pas ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi tshe dang mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o ;
analyzed: phung po lnga yang rang bzhin med pas ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi tshe dang mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o ;
translated: since the five aggregates are also essenceless, it does not connect to a future time.

original: / da ltar byung bar phyin pa med pa ni 'das pa'i las dang nyon mongs pas da ltar gyi dus su'ang skyes pa med pa ste /
analyzed: / da ltar byung bar phyin pa med pa ni 'das pa'i las dang nyon mongs pas da ltar gyi dus su'ang skyes pa med pa ste /
translated: The non-existence of the present in the past is the non-arising of the present time through past karma and afflictions.

original: de ltar dus gsum du yang phung po lnga ma skyes pa de ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum du yang phung po lnga ma skyes pa de ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the non-arising of the five aggregates in the three times is the nature of the truth of cessation.

original: ji ltar na 'gog pa'i bden pa shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'gog pa'i bden pa shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of the truth of cessation,

original: de la gang gis de ltar shes pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gang gis de ltar shes pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said: That by which one knows in that way is... and so on.

original: phung po lnga po skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid la gang zag gang gis gong du bshad pa lta bur 'gog pa'i bden pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga po skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid la gang zag gang gis gong du bshad pa lta bur 'gog pa'i bden pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: For the person who knows the five aggregates to be characterized by non-arising, the truth of cessation is empty of inherent nature, as explained above.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa med par khong du chud cing mi dmigs par shes pa ni 'gog pa la 'gog par shes pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa med par khong du chud cing mi dmigs par shes pa ni 'gog pa la 'gog par shes pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The understanding and non-apprehending knowledge of the absence of arising and cessation is called the noble truth of the cessation of cessation.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir lam gang la brten te sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa la reg cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir lam gang la brten te sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa la reg cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach the nature of the truth of the path, it is said: ‚ÄúThe path on which one touches the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origination, and the knowledge of cessation.

original: lam gang la brten te zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa gsum rang bzhin gyis stong par khong du chud pa'i lam gang la gnas te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam gang la brten te zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa gsum rang bzhin gyis stong par khong du chud pa'i lam gang la gnas te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äù The path on which one touches means the path on which one abides in order to understand that suffering, origination, and cessation are empty by nature.

original: reg cing zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba gnyis la nag po'i phyogs su'ang mi lta /
analyzed: reg cing zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba gnyis la nag po'i phyogs su'ang mi lta /
translated: ‚Äú Touches‚Äù means that one does not view suffering and origination as belonging to the dark side,

original: 'gog pa la dkar po'i phyogs su'ang mi lta zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gog pa la dkar po'i phyogs su'ang mi lta zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and one does not view cessation as belonging to the bright side.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su 'jog ces bya ba ni de gnyis dbyer med par khong du chung ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes su 'jog ces bya ba ni de gnyis dbyer med par khong du chung ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Is established as nondual knowledge‚Äù means that one understands that those two are inseparable.

original: de ltar 'jog pa'i ye shes de ni lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ste /üîΩsdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'thob pa 'am //
analyzed: de ltar 'jog pa'i ye shes de ni lam 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ste / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'thob pa 'am //
translated: That intuition which is thus established is called the noble truth of the path.

original: chud par byed pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chud par byed pa'i lam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase which leads to the cessation of suffering means that it is the path which causes one to attain the cessation of suffering, or which causes one to enter into it.üîΩThis is the meaning of the phrase, the path which causes one to enter into it.

original: ji ltar na lam gyi bden pa shes par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang 'di la stong pa nyid du shes pa 'di ni lam la lam du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar na lam gyi bden pa shes par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir ro // gang 'di la stong pa nyid du shes pa 'di ni lam la lam du shes pa 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate how one comes to know the truth of the path, he says:üîΩThe knowledge of this as emptiness is the knowledge of the path as the path, which is the noble truth.

original: de lta bu'i lam @130b gyi bden pa de yang stong pa nyid du rtogs te mi dmigs par khong du chud pa de ni lam la lam du shes pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i lam @130b gyi bden pa de yang stong pa nyid du rtogs te mi dmigs par khong du chud pa de ni lam la lam du shes pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That knowledge of the truth of the path as emptiness is the knowledge of the path as the path, which is the noble truth.

original: bden pa rgya cher bshad pa rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa rgya cher bshad pa rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate the truths in brief, he says:üîΩThe knowledge of suffering as it really is, the abandonment of origination, the realization of cessation, and the cultivation of the path.

original: gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag la de dag ye shes kyis rtog cing bden pa'i rtog pas mi rtog pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag la de dag ye shes kyis rtog cing bden pa'i rtog pas mi rtog pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhoever understands these four noble truths with wisdom, without conceptualizing them as real, is called a noble one.‚Äù

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni gang zag gang gis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni gang zag gang gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhoever‚Äù refers to the person.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa bzhi gong du bshad pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa bzhi gong du bshad pa rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThese four noble truths‚Äù refers to the four truths of suffering and so on that were explained above.

original: de ltar ye shes rtog cing zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul du bden pa bzhi po de dag ngo bo nyid kyis stong par khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ye shes rtog cing zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul du bden pa bzhi po de dag ngo bo nyid kyis stong par khong du chud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way, understanding with wisdom‚Äù means comprehending that those four noble truths are empty of intrinsic reality in the manner explained above.

original: bden pa'i rtog pas mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa de dag nyid ngo bo nyid kyis med par khong du chud pas bden pa de dag la bden par yang mi 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden pa'i rtog pas mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa de dag nyid ngo bo nyid kyis med par khong du chud pas bden pa de dag la bden par yang mi 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout conceptualizing them as real‚Äù means that by comprehending that those very noble truths do not exist intrinsically, one does not grasp those truths as real.

original: de lta bu ni 'phags pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'phags pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúexpertise in the noble truths.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa gzhan yang bshad par bzhed de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i rnam pa gzhan yang bshad par bzhed de /
translated: Another explanation of the aspects of the four noble truths is now presented.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of the truth of suffering, he says:

original: gzhan yang tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, all feelings are suffering.

original: de la tshor ba thams cad ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de la tshor ba thams cad ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Here, all feelings are feelings of suffering, feelings of pleasure, and feelings that are neither pleasurable nor suffering.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal pa'o //
translated: Among them, the feeling of suffering is suffering because of its very nature.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni mthar sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab pas sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni mthar sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab pas sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: The feeling of pleasure and the feeling that is neither pleasurable nor suffering are suffering because they end in suffering and because they are pervaded by the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the truth of suffering.

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin shes par gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin shes par gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of the nature of suffering, he says:

original: tshor ba de la rnam par 'byed cing rig par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba de la rnam par 'byed cing rig par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The knowledge of the discernment of those feelings, etc.

original: tshor ba de la zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum la'o //üîΩrnam par 'byed ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bas khyab pa dang bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal bas khyab pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba de la zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum la'o // rnam par 'byed ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bas khyab pa dang bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal bas khyab pa dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: Those feelings refers to the three kinds of feelings explained above.

original: @131a * // sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab par bye brag phyed cing zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @131a * // sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab par bye brag phyed cing zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Discernment means the discernment of the pervasion of the feeling of pain by the suffering of pain, the pervasion of the feeling of pleasure by the suffering of change, and the pervasion of the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain by the suffering of the formative forces.

original: rig par shes zhes bya ba ni tshor ba de dag kyang mi dmigs par khong du chud ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rig par shes zhes bya ba ni tshor ba de dag kyang mi dmigs par khong du chud ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: Knowledge means the understanding that those feelings are not apprehended.

original: gong du bshad pa lta bur tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal yin par bye brag phyed cing mi dmigs pa shes pa de ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa lta bur tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal yin par bye brag phyed cing mi dmigs pa shes pa de ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: As explained above, the knowledge that distinguishes and does not objectify all feelings as suffering is called ‚Äúthe noble truth of the knowledge of suffering as suffering.‚Äù

original: kun 'byung ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of origination,

original: tshor ba de rgyu gang gis kun 'byung ba de ni kun 'byung ba zhes bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshor ba de rgyu gang gis kun 'byung ba de ni kun 'byung ba zhes bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe cause from which that feeling originates is called ‚Äòorigination.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: gong du bshad pa'i tshor ba de dag rgyu gang gis bskyed cing phyung ba'i rgyu de ni kun 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i tshor ba de dag rgyu gang gis bskyed cing phyung ba'i rgyu de ni kun 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The cause that produces and generates those feelings explained above is called ‚Äúorigination.‚Äù

original: tshor ba kun 'byung ba'i rgyu ni reg pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba kun 'byung ba'i rgyu ni reg pa ste /
translated: The cause of the origination of feeling is contact.

original: rig pa las tshor ba 'byung bas na reg pa la kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa las tshor ba 'byung bas na reg pa la kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since feeling arises from contact, contact is called ‚Äúorigination.‚Äù

original: de bas na mdo las /üîΩreg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: de bas na mdo las / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: Therefore, a s≈´tra says:üîΩFeeling has contact as its condition.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Craving has feeling as its condition.

original: ji ltar na kun 'byung ba shes par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar na kun 'byung ba shes par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how one comes to know the truth of origination, he said:

original: gang gis rgyu de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩgang gis zhes bya ba ni gang zag gang gis sam /
analyzed: gang gis rgyu de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gang gis zhes bya ba ni gang zag gang gis sam /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who knows that cause correctly, as it is, in reality, will know the origination of suffering.‚Äù

original: shes rab gang zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: shes rab gang zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: ‚ÄúOne who‚Äù means the person who, or the wisdom by means of which.

original: / rgyu de zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i rgyu reg pa ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / rgyu de zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i rgyu reg pa ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThat cause‚Äù means the cause of feeling, which is contact.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba'i tshor ba 'byung ba'i rgyu de stong pa nyid du phyin ci ma log par khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba'i tshor ba 'byung ba'i rgyu de stong pa nyid du phyin ci ma log par khong du chud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúKnows correctly, as it is, in reality‚Äù means that one who has unmistakenly understood that cause of the arising of feeling to be emptiness.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / ji ltar na 'gog pa'i bden pa shes par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / ji ltar na 'gog pa'i bden pa shes par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the truth of cessation and how one comes to know the truth of cessation, he said:

original: gang tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad de /
analyzed: gang tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad de /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen all feelings cease,

original: tshor ba med pa yang tshor zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshor ba med pa yang tshor zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd also feelingless, feeling‚Äù and so on.

original: gong du smos pa lta bu'i tshor ba rnam pa thams cad du rgyun chad de med par gyur pa de ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gong du smos pa lta bu'i tshor ba rnam pa thams cad du rgyun chad de med par gyur pa de ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The cessation of all kinds of feeling, as mentioned above, is the nature of the truth of cessation.

original: de lta bu'i tshor ba med pa 'gog pa'i bden pa phyin ci ma log par shes te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshor ba med pa 'gog pa'i bden pa phyin ci ma log par shes te /
translated: One who knows the truth of cessation, which is the absence of such feeling, without error,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la yang gnas la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la yang gnas la /
translated: and who also abides in nonconceptual intuition,

original: sems can la lta ba'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa yang mngon du mi byed pa de ni /
analyzed: sems can la lta ba'i phyir 'gog pa'i bden pa yang mngon du mi byed pa de ni /
translated: but does not realize the truth of cessation because of his regard for sentient beings,

original: 'gog pa la 'gog par shes pa'i @131b 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la 'gog par shes pa'i @131b 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called the noble truth of the cessation of cessation.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the nature of the truth of the path,

original: tshor ba gang gis bsgrubs pa'i lam de ni gzings lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshor ba gang gis bsgrubs pa'i lam de ni gzings lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe path by which one practices is like a raft‚Äù and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la gnas na tshor ba'i rang bzhin gong du bshad pa lta bur tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la gnas na tshor ba'i rang bzhin gong du bshad pa lta bur tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: If one is abiding in the noble path, then all feelings are suffering, as explained above, in terms of the nature of feeling.

original: tshor ba de nyid ngo bo nyid kyis stong bar rtogs par byed pa'i lam de la tshor bas bsgrubs pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba de nyid ngo bo nyid kyis stong bar rtogs par byed pa'i lam de la tshor bas bsgrubs pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, the path that brings about the realization that those feelings are empty of inherent nature is called the path that is accomplished by means of feeling.

original: lam de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rnams grub nas dor dgos pa'i phyir gzings lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rnams grub nas dor dgos pa'i phyir gzings lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: And that path is like a raft, because it is a dharma that must be abandoned once one has accomplished what is to be done.

original: yang na 'phags pa'i lam la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i tshor bde las sgrol zhing de dag spong bar byed pas na lam ni rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'i gzings dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa'i lam la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i tshor bde las sgrol zhing de dag spong bar byed pas na lam ni rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'i gzings dang 'dra'o //
translated: Or else, the path is like a ship that crosses the ocean, because it liberates one from and causes one to abandon the feelings that are by nature suffering.

original: ji ltar lam gyi rang bzhin shes par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar lam gyi rang bzhin shes par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate how one comes to know the nature of the path, the text says:

original: gang tshor bar 'dod pa de ni lam 'dod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang tshor ba rnam pa gsum la chags pa de ni phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa yin pas /
analyzed: gang tshor bar 'dod pa de ni lam 'dod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang tshor ba rnam pa gsum la chags pa de ni phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pa yin pas /
translated: Whoever is attached to the three kinds of feelings is attached to error, and therefore

original: 'phags pa'i lam la gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: does not abide in the noble path.

original: bden pa rgya cher bstan pa'i don rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bden pa rgya cher bstan pa'i don rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the extensive explanation of the truths in brief,

original: de ltar bden pa bzhi po 'di mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar bden pa bzhi po 'di mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThus, whoever sees these four noble truths . . . ‚Äù

original: gang zhes bya ba ni gang zag gang ngo //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni gang zag gang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúWhoever‚Äù refers to a person.

original: de ltar bden pa bzhi po 'di mthong zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar bden pa bzhin mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa bzhi po 'di mthong zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul ltar bden pa bzhin mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus, whoever sees these four noble truths‚Äù means that one sees the four noble truths in the manner explained above.

original: rnam par dag pas mnyam par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes rnam par dag pas zhe'am /
analyzed: rnam par dag pas mnyam par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes rnam par dag pas zhe'am /
translated: ‚ÄúRealizes their equality through purification‚Äù means that one realizes their equality through the purification of wisdom.

original: bden pa bzhi po nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas bden pa thams cad mtshan nyid gcig cing rang bzhin gcig par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas bden pa thams cad mtshan nyid gcig cing rang bzhin gcig par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the four truths themselves are pure by nature, it means that all truths are realized to have the same characteristic and the same nature.

original: bden pa'i rnam grangs gzhan bstan par bzhed de /
analyzed: bden pa'i rnam grangs gzhan bstan par bzhed de /
translated: He wishes to teach another enumeration of the truths.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of suffering, etc., in brief,

original: gzhan yang mdor na skye ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdor na skye ba ni sdug bsngal ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, in brief, birth is suffering,‚Äù and so on.

original: phung po lnga mngon par smin te /
analyzed: phung po lnga mngon par smin te /
translated: The five aggregates are fully matured.

original: skyes pa sdug bsngal sna tshogs dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: skyes pa sdug bsngal sna tshogs dang ldan pas na /
translated: Since the one who is born possesses various kinds of suffering,

original: skye ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: birth is said to be suffering.

original: yang na nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i las kyi bag chags bsags pa'i khyad par de dang de dag gis lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba de dang de dag tu phung @132a * //
analyzed: yang na nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i las kyi bag chags bsags pa'i khyad par de dang de dag gis lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba de dang de dag tu phung @132a * //
translated: Or, by the particular accumulations of the latent impressions of karma that cause rebirth, in this and that realm of gods, humans, and so on, the aggregates

analyzed: po dang khams dang skye mched blangs bar gyur pa ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The taking up of the elements and sense-spheres is called birth.

original: yang na skye ba rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang na skye ba rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Or, there are five kinds of birth:
