analyzed: chos rtogs pa'i skye ba dang / mngal du gnas pa'i skye ba dang / rigs kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pa'i skye ba dang / sems can gyi rigs mthun pa'i ngo bo mthun par gyur ba'i skye ba dang / so sor byung ba'i skye ba'o //
translated: birth as understanding of the teaching, birth in the womb, birth in a perfect family, birth in a similar class of sentient beings, and birth as an individual.

original: de la chos rtogs pa'i skye ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bshad pa'i gsung rab kyi don rtogs nas sras su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos rtogs pa'i skye ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bshad pa'i gsung rab kyi don rtogs nas sras su gyur pa ste /
translated: Among them, birth as understanding of the teaching is becoming a son by understanding the meaning of the scriptures taught by the Tathagata.

original: de bas na mdo las kyang zhal nas skyes pa /
analyzed: de bas na mdo las kyang zhal nas skyes pa /
translated: Therefore, a sutra says,

original: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba las skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so /üîΩmngal du gnas pa'i skye ba ni sa bon las myu gu /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba las skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so / mngal du gnas pa'i skye ba ni sa bon las myu gu /
translated: Born from the mouth, born from the noble Dharma and Vinaya.

original: myu gu las 'dab ma bzhin du mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa'i rim pas skyes pa'o //
analyzed: myu gu las 'dab ma bzhin du mer mer po dang nur nur po la sogs pa'i rim pas skyes pa'o //
translated: Birth in the womb is birth through the stages of kalala, arbuda, and so on, like a sprout from a seed, a leaf from a sprout, and so on.

original: rigs kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pas skye ba ni nor bu rin po che aindra n'i la'i rigs dang / aindra n'i la chen po'i rigs zhes bya ba bzhin du rgyal rigs su gyur pa dang / bram ze'i rigs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi gnas phun sum tshogs pas skye ba ni nor bu rin po che aindra n'i la'i rigs dang / aindra n'i la chen po'i rigs zhes bya ba bzhin du rgyal rigs su gyur pa dang / bram ze'i rigs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Birth by the perfection of the abode of the species is like the species of the precious gem sapphire and the species of the great sapphire. It is to be born in the royal class or the priestly class.

original: sems can gyi ris mthun par ngo bo mthun par skye ba ni dper na shing rnam pa sna tshogs la ta la ta lar ris mthun pa dang / seng ldeng seng ldeng du ris mthun pa bzhin du sems can rnams la mi dang mir ris mthun pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris mthun par ngo bo mthun par skye ba ni dper na shing rnam pa sna tshogs la ta la ta lar ris mthun pa dang / seng ldeng seng ldeng du ris mthun pa bzhin du sems can rnams la mi dang mir ris mthun pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Birth by the homogeneity of the class of sentient beings is like the homogeneity of the palm tree among various trees and the homogeneity of the k·π£ƒ´ra tree among k·π£ƒ´ra trees. It is the homogeneity of humans among sentient beings, and so on.

original: so sor byung ba'i skye ba ni me tog dang 'bras bu 'byung ba bzhin du phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams byung bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: so sor byung ba'i skye ba ni me tog dang 'bras bu 'byung ba bzhin du phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams byung bar gyur pa ste /
translated: Birth by individual occurrence is like the occurrence of flowers and fruits. It is the occurrence of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de ltar skye ba rnam pa lnga las kyang 'dir mngal du gnas pa'i skye ba dang so sor 'byung ba'i skye ba la bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba rnam pa lnga las kyang 'dir mngal du gnas pa'i skye ba dang so sor 'byung ba'i skye ba la bya bar dgongs so //
translated: From among these five kinds of birth, here it is intended to refer to birth in the womb and birth by individual occurrence.

original: skye ba de dag rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba de dag rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: Birth is suffering for two reasons:

original: gnod pa'i rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gzhan gyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa'i rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal gzhan gyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is suffering by its very nature as an injury, and it is the basis for other suffering.

original: de la gnod pa'i rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba ni ma'i mngal na zhu ba'i gnas dang / ma zhu ba'i gnas kyi bar na gnas pa dang / mngal nas phyir byung ba'i tshe mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnam pa sna tshogs kyis btsir ba na ri'i them par bcug pa bzhin du yan lag la dpag tu med pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bas na skye ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: de la gnod pa'i rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba ni ma'i mngal na zhu ba'i gnas dang / ma zhu ba'i gnas kyi bar na gnas pa dang / mngal nas phyir byung ba'i tshe mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnam pa sna tshogs kyis btsir ba na ri'i them par bcug pa bzhin du yan lag la dpag tu med pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bas na skye ba sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Birth is suffering by its very nature as an injury, because when one is in the womb, one is in a place that is like a prison, in the dark, confined, and pressed by the wind and urine and feces, and when one comes out of the womb, one is as if coming out of a prison.

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyi rten du gyur pa ni skye bar gyur na rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams zhar la 'byung bas na skye ba sdug bsngal @132b ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyi rten du gyur pa ni skye bar gyur na rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams zhar la 'byung bas na skye ba sdug bsngal @132b ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Birth is suffering because it is the basis for other suffering, because when one is born, the suffering of old age and so on occur together.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the truth of suffering.

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shes par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shes par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate how the truth of suffering is known, he says:

original: gang mi skye ba la rtogs pa'i shes pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang mi skye ba la rtogs pa'i shes pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis knowledge of realization regarding non-arising‚Äù and so on.

original: skye ba de ni don dam par skye ba med cing mi dmigs par rtogs pa de ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa bden pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba de ni don dam par skye ba med cing mi dmigs par rtogs pa de ni sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du shes pa bden pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That realization of the non-arising of arising, ultimately, is the knowledge of suffering as suffering with regard to the truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsrid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir / srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the truth of origination, he says:üîΩ‚ÄúConditioned by existence, birth‚Äù and so on.

original: srid pa gang yin pa kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: srid pa gang yin pa kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Existence is the origination.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyur gyur pa las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bag chags bsags pa ni sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyur gyur pa las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bag chags bsags pa ni sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The accumulation of various habitual tendencies that serve as the cause for rebirth is called craving.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis las srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes 'byung ste srid pa de las skye ba kun du 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa la kun du 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis las srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes 'byung ste srid pa de las skye ba kun du 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa la kun du 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: From the twelve members of dependent origination, ‚Äúconditioned by existence, birth‚Äù occurs. Since birth occurs from that existence, existence is called ‚Äúoccurrence.‚Äù

original: ji ltar kun 'byung ba shes pa bstan pa'i phyir gang srid pa 'jig pa shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar kun 'byung ba shes pa bstan pa'i phyir gang srid pa 'jig pa shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of origination, he says, ‚ÄúThe knowledge of the destruction of existence,‚Äù and so on.

original: srid pa 'jig par shes pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rang bzhin med par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srid pa 'jig par shes pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rang bzhin med par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of existence means the knowledge of the essencelessness of existence.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the truth of cessation, he says,

original: skye ba thams cad ni skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba thams cad ni skye ba med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll arising is non-arising.

original: mi skye ba ni 'gog pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mi skye ba ni 'gog pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Non-arising is cessation.‚Äù

original: skye ba rnam pa lnga bshad pa la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi dngos po skye ba thams cad ni don dam par na skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba rnam pa lnga bshad pa la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi dngos po skye ba thams cad ni don dam par na skye ba med pa ste /
translated: With respect to the explanation of the five types of arising, all internal and external things that arise are ultimately non-arising.

original: gang skye ba med pa mi skye ba de ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa mi skye ba de ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: That which is non-arisen and does not arise is the truth of cessation.

original: ji ltar na 'gog pa'i bden pa shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'gog pa'i bden pa shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the knowledge of the truth of cessation,

original: gang mi skye ba de la 'gog pa gang yang med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang mi skye ba de la 'gog pa gang yang med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat which is non-arisen does not cease at all,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'gog pa ni skye ba la brten pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni skye ba la brten pa ste /
translated: Cessation is based on arising,

original: skyes par gyur na 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes par gyur na 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because what has arisen will perish.

original: 'di ltar ma skyes na 'jig pa med pas na ma skyes pa de la 'gog pa gang yang med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma skyes na 'jig pa med pas na ma skyes pa de la 'gog pa gang yang med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, since what is non-arisen does not perish, it is said that ‚Äúwhat is non-arisen does not cease at all.‚Äù

original: gang 'gog pa med par shes pa 'di ni brad pa'i 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: gang 'gog pa med par shes pa 'di ni brad pa'i 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya la /
translated: The knowledge that there is no cessation is called ‚Äúthe knowledge of the cessation of suffering.‚Äù

original: skye ba thams cad skye ba med cing mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa de nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis med par shes pa ni mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad skye ba med cing mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa de nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis med par shes pa ni mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid mi 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cessation of all arising, which has the characteristic of non-arising, is also known to be essentially nonexistent. This is called ‚Äúthe knowledge of the non-cessation of the characteristic of non-arising.‚Äù

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin dang / ji ltar lam gyi bden pa shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin dang / ji ltar lam gyi bden pa shes pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the truth of the path and how the truth of the path is known,

original: @133a * // gang de ltar bgrang ba'am 'jal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: @133a * // gang de ltar bgrang ba'am 'jal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat which is counted or measured, etc.‚Äù

original: gong du bshad pa ltar sdug bsngal ci 'dra ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa ci 'dra ba nges par rtog cing gtan la 'bebs pa la lam gyi bden pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar sdug bsngal ci 'dra ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa ci 'dra ba nges par rtog cing gtan la 'bebs pa la lam gyi bden pa zhes bya ste /
translated: As explained above, the truth of the path is that which ascertains and determines the nature of suffering, origination, and cessation.

original: de dag phyin ci ma log par shes pa ni lam gyi bden pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag phyin ci ma log par shes pa ni lam gyi bden pa shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the truth of the path is the unerring knowledge of those.

original: bgrang ba dang 'jal ba zhes bya ba ni gtan la 'bebs shing shes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bgrang ba dang 'jal ba zhes bya ba ni gtan la 'bebs shing shes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äú Counting and measuring‚Äù means ascertaining and knowing.

original: yang na gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge rnams kyi grangs ji snyed 'byung ba la rtogs pa ni bgrang ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge rnams kyi grangs ji snyed 'byung ba la rtogs pa ni bgrang ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the knowledge of counting is the understanding of the extent of the names, phrases, and letters that occur in the sutras, etc., which teach the four noble truths.

original: gang gis gnyis bzung nas gnyis kun du rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis gnyis bzung nas gnyis kun du rtog pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of comprehension is that by which one comprehends the two and imagines the two.

original: ming kun du bzung nas don kun rtogs pa dang / don kun du bzung nas ming kun rtogs pa ni 'jal ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: ming kun du bzung nas don kun rtogs pa dang / don kun du bzung nas ming kun rtogs pa ni 'jal ba shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of comprehension is that by which one comprehends the name and imagines the object, and by which one comprehends the object and imagines the name.

original: gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa'i ming kun 'dzin pa sngon du byas nas don rtogs pa 'jug pa ni tshol ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'phags pa'i bden pa'i ming kun 'dzin pa sngon du byas nas don rtogs pa 'jug pa ni tshol ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of investigation is that by which one comprehends the name of the noble truths and, having done so, one imagines the object.

original: rab tu rtogs pa'i sbyor ba bcu gcig ni rtogs pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i sbyor ba bcu gcig ni rtogs pa shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of realization is the eleven applications of realization.

original: bcu gcig po shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gcig po shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eleven?

original: glo bur du byung ba rab tu rtogs pa dang / yang dag par snang ba'i rgyu mtshan rab tu rtogs pa dang / don mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / dmigs pa mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: glo bur du byung ba rab tu rtogs pa dang / yang dag par snang ba'i rgyu mtshan rab tu rtogs pa dang / don mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / dmigs pa mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa dang /
translated: The realization of adventitious appearance, the realization of the sign of correct appearance, the realization of the non-perception of objects, the realization of the non-perception of perception, the realization of the realm of phenomena,

original: gang zag la bdag med pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos la bdag med pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / bsam pa chung ngu rab tu rtogs pa dang / rgya chen po'i bdag nyid chen po'i bsam pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / ji ltar chos khong du chud pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa rab tu rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos la bdag med pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / bsam pa chung ngu rab tu rtogs pa dang / rgya chen po'i bdag nyid chen po'i bsam pa rab tu rtogs pa dang / ji ltar chos khong du chud pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa rab tu rtogs pa dang /
translated: the realization of the selflessness of the person, the realization of the selflessness of things, the realization of the lesser attitude, the realization of the great attitude of the magnanimous, the realization of the arrangement of things according to the understanding of things,

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i chos rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i chos rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: and the realization of the things that are arranged.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ming dang don du btags pa de dag thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa la glo bur du btags pa yin no zhes khong du chud pa ni glo bur du byung ba rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ming dang don du btags pa de dag thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa la glo bur du btags pa yin no zhes khong du chud pa ni glo bur du byung ba rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The understanding that all those designations of names and meanings of the four noble truths are adventitious designations on what is unreal is called the realization of the adventitious.

original: de ni drod kyi dus na'o //
analyzed: de ni drod kyi dus na'o //
translated: That is at the time of heat.

original: dngos po thams cad yod pa ma yin pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba ni yang dag par snang ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yod pa ma yin pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa lta bur snang ba ni yang dag par snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance of all things as if they were apprehended and apprehender, when they do not exist, is the correct appearance.

original: snang ba de dag gi rgyu yang sems dang sems las byung pa yin @133b pas na sems dang sems las byung ba ni snang ba'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: snang ba de dag gi rgyu yang sems dang sems las byung pa yin @133b pas na sems dang sems las byung ba ni snang ba'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: Since the cause of those appearances is mind and mental factors, mind and mental factors are the causal signs of appearance.üîΩThe appearance of those apprehended objects and apprehending subjects appears to mind and mental factors.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de dag snang ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba la snang ste zhes rtogs pa ni yang dag par snang ba'i rgyu mtshan rab tu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa de dag snang ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba la snang ste zhes rtogs pa ni yang dag par snang ba'i rgyu mtshan rab tu rtogs pa ste /
translated: The realization of that is the full realization of the causal signs of appearance.

original: 'di ni spyi bo'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spyi bo'i tshe na'o //
translated: This is the stage of the crown.

original: don ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i yul rnams te /
analyzed: don ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i yul rnams te /
translated: Objects are external objects such as form and so on.

original: de dag med par rtogs pa ni don mi dmigs par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag med par rtogs pa ni don mi dmigs par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The realization that they do not exist is the realization of the nonobservation of objects.

original: 'di ni bzod pa'i dus so //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa'i dus so //
translated: This is the stage of acceptance.

original: de ltar gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yang mi 'jug pas phyi'i yul la 'dzin pa'i sems med par rtogs pa ni dmigs pa mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba med na 'dzin pa yang mi 'jug pas phyi'i yul la 'dzin pa'i sems med par rtogs pa ni dmigs pa mi dmigs pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, if there is no apprehended object, the apprehending subject also does not operate. Therefore, the realization that there is no mind apprehending external objects is called the full realization of the nonobservation of the focal object.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi dus na'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi dus na'o //
translated: This is the stage of the supreme mundane state.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis mi dmigs par gyur nas thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gyi de bzhin nyid rtogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis mi dmigs par gyur nas thams cad du 'gro ba'i don gyi de bzhin nyid rtogs pa ni chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, when both the object and subject are not perceived, the realization of the suchness of the meaning that is all-pervading is the realization of the expanse of reality.

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe'o //
translated: This is at the time of the path of seeing.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas gang zag la bdag med par rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i lam gyi tshe 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas gang zag la bdag med par rab tu rtogs so //
translated: Thus, at the time of the path of seeing, noble disciples, having eliminated the obscurations that are the afflictions to be eliminated by the path of seeing, realize the no self of the individual.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa che long spangs nas gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis rtogs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa che long spangs nas gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa gnyis rtogs so //
translated: Bodhisattvas, having eliminated the gross afflictive obscurations and the cognitive obscurations to be eliminated by the path of seeing, realize the two kinds of no self, that of the individual and that of phenomena.

original: de lta bas na 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam rtogs pa dang / bdag gi don gyi phyir zhugs pas na bsam pa chung ngu rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam rtogs pa dang / bdag gi don gyi phyir zhugs pas na bsam pa chung ngu rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the noble disciples have a small realization, since they realize only the selflessness of persons and they are engaged for their own welfare.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs la /
translated: The bodhisattvas realize the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir zhugs pas na de dag gi rtogs pa ni rgya chen po'i bdag nyid kyi bsam pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir zhugs pas na de dag gi rtogs pa ni rgya chen po'i bdag nyid kyi bsam pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are engaged for the welfare of both themselves and others, their realization is called the realization of the attitude of vast extent.

original: sa dang po'i tshe chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid khor du chud pa ni ji ltar chos khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po'i tshe chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid khor du chud pa ni ji ltar chos khong du chud pa'o //
translated: When they realize the suchness of phenomena on the first stage, it is called the realization of the phenomena that are realized.

original: de ltar khong du chud nas khong du chud pa'i chos kyi yon tan rnams rtogs pa ni ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud nas khong du chud pa'i chos kyi yon tan rnams rtogs pa ni ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having realized that, the realization of the qualities of the realized phenomena is called the realization of the classification of the realized phenomena.

original: de nas bsgom pa'i chos rnams sems la yang dag par 'jog cing /
analyzed: de nas bsgom pa'i chos rnams sems la yang dag par 'jog cing /
translated: Then, the dharmas of meditation are correctly placed in the mind.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dus na bsgom par bya ba'i chos dang yon tan rnams rtogs pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i chos rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dus na bsgom par bya ba'i chos dang yon tan rnams rtogs pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i chos rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of the path of meditation, the realization of the dharmas and qualities to be meditated upon is called the realization of the dharmas that are set forth.

original: gang gis @134a * //
analyzed: gang gis @134a * //
translated: By what

original: rnam pa gnyis la nye bar 'jug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis la nye bar 'jug ste /
translated: is one engaged in the two?

original: yi ge rnams tshad yod pa la 'jug pa dang / ming dang tshig gi tshad med pa la 'jug ste de ltar 'jug pa ni 'jug pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge rnams tshad yod pa la 'jug pa dang / ming dang tshig gi tshad med pa la 'jug ste de ltar 'jug pa ni 'jug pa shes pa'o //
translated: One is engaged in the limited number of syllables and engaged in the limitless number of names and phrases. Thus, engagement is the knowledge of engagement.

original: 'di ltar bgrang ba dang 'jal ba dang / tshol ba dang / rtogs pa dang / 'jug pa rnam pa lnga ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bgrang ba dang 'jal ba dang / tshol ba dang / rtogs pa dang / 'jug pa rnam pa lnga ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
translated: Thus, the five aspects of counting, measuring, investigating, realizing, and engaging are the noble path.

original: de ltar shes na lam la lam du shes pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes na lam la lam du shes pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If one knows it in that way, it is called the noble truth of knowing the path as the path.

original: ji ltar bshad pa'i don rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa'i don rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize and teach the meaning that was explained,

original: gang bden pa'i shes pa 'di la 'jug cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang bden pa'i shes pa 'di la 'jug cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhoever engages in this knowledge of the truth‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: bden pa'i shes pa la 'jug pa ni bden pa bzhi po gong du bshad pa rnams stong par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i shes pa la 'jug pa ni bden pa bzhi po gong du bshad pa rnams stong par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The entry into the knowledge of the truths is the realization of the emptiness of the four noble truths explained above.

original: bden pa'i shes pa la yang mi gnas zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don du lta bas ji ltar stong par rtogs pa de 'ba' zhig gi phyogs la yang gnas par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden pa'i shes pa la yang mi gnas zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don du lta bas ji ltar stong par rtogs pa de 'ba' zhig gi phyogs la yang gnas par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase one does not abide in the knowledge of the truths means that one does not abide in the mere realization of emptiness as it is seen by the view for the sake of sentient beings.üîΩThis is the meaning of the phrase one does not abide in the realization of emptiness.

original: bden pa la mkhas pa bshad pa'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: bden pa la mkhas pa bshad pa'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: After explaining the skill in the truths, in order to explain the skill in dependent origination as it was taught, he asks,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: What is the bodhisattva's skill in dependent origination?

original: de la zhes bya ba'i don ni gong du smos pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i don ni gong du smos pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The phrase in this regard has the same meaning as before.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas dus mnyam du 'bras bu 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas dus mnyam du 'bras bu 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Dependent origination is the simultaneous arising of effects in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: de la mkhas pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in dependent origination means skill in the characteristics of dependent origination.

original: de ni 'di skad du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa yin par ston to //
translated: This is what is being said: The understanding of the unerring characteristics of dependent origination is skill in dependent origination.

original: de bas rten zhes bya ba dang / 'brel zhes bya ba dang / 'byung zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis rnam pa gsum 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: de bas rten zhes bya ba dang / 'brel zhes bya ba dang / 'byung zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis rnam pa gsum 'gog par byed de /
translated: Therefore, the three terms dependent, originated, and arisen refute three types of views.

original: rnam pa gsum ni rgyu med par smra ba dang / rgyu mi 'dra bar smra ba dang / med par smra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni rgyu med par smra ba dang / rgyu mi 'dra bar smra ba dang / med par smra ba'o //
translated: The three types of views are the view of causelessness, the view of discordant causes, and the view of nihilism.

original: de la rten zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen la brten te 'byung ba yin pas na 'dis ni rgyu med par smra ba 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de la rten zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen la brten te 'byung ba yin pas na 'dis ni rgyu med par smra ba 'gog par byed do //
translated: Among them, dependent means that things originate in dependence on causes and conditions. This refutes the view of causelessness.

original: 'brel zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mthun pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'brel zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mthun pa la bya ste /
translated: The term originated refers to a concordant cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa las skye'i mi mthun pa las ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa las skye'i mi mthun pa las ma yin te /
translated: Things originate from concordant causes and effects, not from discordant ones.

original: dper na ma rig pa las 'du byed 'byung gi / dbang phyug dang byed pa po las mi 'byung ba 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra @134b ba 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: dper na ma rig pa las 'du byed 'byung gi / dbang phyug dang byed pa po las mi 'byung ba 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra @134b ba 'gog par byed do //
translated: For example, formations arise from ignorance, not from a creator or an almighty being.

original: 'byung ba'i sgra ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bar chad med par skye ba la bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sgra ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bar chad med par skye ba la bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúarising‚Äù refers to the uninterrupted arising of cause and effect.

original: 'dis ni med par smra ba 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni med par smra ba 'gog par byed do //
translated: This refutes the doctrine of nihilism.

original: ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba bshad ce na /
translated: Why is dependent origination explained?

original: 'gro ba 'di dag ma rig pa'i rkyen las skye'i /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag ma rig pa'i rkyen las skye'i /
translated: It is explained in order to show that this world arises from the condition of ignorance,

original: mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rgyu med pa las mi skye'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rgyu dang rgyu med pa las mi skye'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: not from a discordant cause or without cause.

original: yang na 'khor bar 'jug pa la rmongs pa dang / 'khor ba las ldog pa la rmongs pa bsal ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun par 'byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis bshad do //
analyzed: yang na 'khor bar 'jug pa la rmongs pa dang / 'khor ba las ldog pa la rmongs pa bsal ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun par 'byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis bshad do //
translated: Alternately, dependent origination is explained in two ways, in forward and reverse order, in order to remove the confusion about entering cyclic existence and about turning away from cyclic existence.

original: de la 'khor bar 'jug pa la rmongs pa ni rgyu gang gis 'khor bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'khor bar 'jug pa la rmongs pa ni rgyu gang gis 'khor bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mi shes pa ste /
translated: Here, the delusion of entering samsara is not knowing the cause by which one is born in samsara.

original: mi shes pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi shes pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate that ignorance,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun 'byung ba las ma rig pa kun 'byung ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun 'byung ba las ma rig pa kun 'byung ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúFrom the arising of the origin of what is incorrect, ignorance arises.‚Äù

original: 'khor ba las ldog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba las ldog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Reversing samsara is nirvana.

original: rgyu gang gis 'khor ba las 'grol zhing mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba mi shes pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis 'khor ba las 'grol zhing mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba mi shes pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Not knowing the cause by which one is liberated from samsara and attains nirvana, in order to eliminate that,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúBy the cessation of what is incorrect, ignorance ceases,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun par 'byung ba yang mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs dang mthun par 'byung ba yang mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the forward progression of dependent origination should be understood in terms of four characteristics.

original: yan lag rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yan lag bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yan lag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag med pa rkyen las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yan lag bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yan lag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag med pa rkyen las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the analysis of the members, the characteristic of the collection of the members, the characteristic of the collection of the defilement of the members, and the characteristic of the selflessness which arises from conditions.

original: yan lag rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid las brtsams te gsungs pa /
analyzed: yan lag rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid las brtsams te gsungs pa /
translated: The characteristic of the analysis of the members is stated:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus:

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun 'byung ba las ma rig pa kun 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun 'byung ba las ma rig pa kun 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: From the arising of the non-real as a condition, the arising of ignorance.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni tshig gi mgo drang ba 'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni tshig gi mgo drang ba 'am /
translated: Thus means that the beginning of the sentence is stated,

original: tshig gi rkyen du bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi rkyen du bzhag pa'o //
translated: or it is stated as a condition of the sentence.

original: de la mi rtag pa la rtag bar 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'du shes pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'du shes pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa la rtag bar 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'du shes pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'du shes pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa ste /
translated: Therein, the non-real is the perception of the impermanent as permanent, the perception of suffering as happiness, the perception of the impure as pure, and the perception of the selfless as a self.

original: kun 'byung ba las zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun du skyes par 'gyur ba las ma rig pa kun 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba las zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa kun du skyes par 'gyur ba las ma rig pa kun 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the origination of the truth of origination‚Äù means that ignorance originates from the origination of the non-realization of things as they are.

original: ma rig pa @135a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa @135a * //
translated: Ignorance

original: kun du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: originates from the origination of the non-realization of things as they are.

original: 'dir tshul bzhin ma yin pa smos pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir tshul bzhin ma yin pa smos pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa yin te /
translated: Here, the mention of non-realization is stated to show the cause of ignorance.

original: 'byung ba'i don ni lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i don ni lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of origination should be applied in the same way to the remaining [links].

original: de la gcig bur 'du shes pa dang / ril por 'du shes pa dang ; / rtag par 'du shes pa dang / brtan par 'du shes pa dang / ther zug tu 'du shes pa dang / bde bar 'du shes pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gcig bur 'du shes pa dang / ril por 'du shes pa dang ; / rtag par 'du shes pa dang / brtan par 'du shes pa dang / ther zug tu 'du shes pa dang / bde bar 'du shes pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the perception of singularity, the perception of wholeness, the perception of permanence, the perception of stability, the perception of eternity, and the perception of happiness are called ignorance.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa tha dad pa mi 'dra ba du ma 'dus pas bskyed na 'di la gcig pur sems pa ni gcig pur 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa tha dad pa mi 'dra ba du ma 'dus pas bskyed na 'di la gcig pur sems pa ni gcig pur 'du shes pa'o //
translated: When generated by the aggregation of many different and dissimilar things such as earth, water, fire, wind, space, and so on, the mind that thinks of this as singular is the perception of singularity.

original: sa la sogs pa de dag kyang rdul phra rab tha dad pa las 'byung ba yin na de la gcig bur sems ba ni ril por 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa de dag kyang rdul phra rab tha dad pa las 'byung ba yin na de la gcig bur sems ba ni ril por 'du shes pa'o //
translated: And if these elements such as earth are produced from different atoms, the idea of them as a whole is the idea of a mass.

original: skad cig ma re re la yang mi rtag par gyur nas gzhan dang gzhan du gyur na /üîΩgnas nas kyang bdag ces 'dzin /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la yang mi rtag par gyur nas gzhan dang gzhan du gyur na / gnas nas kyang bdag ces 'dzin /
translated: If they are impermanent from moment to moment, changing from one moment to the next,üîΩand yet one still thinks of them as a self,

original: phyis kyang bdag nyid 'dug go snyam du sems pa ni rtag par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: phyis kyang bdag nyid 'dug go snyam du sems pa ni rtag par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: then the idea that ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is the idea of permanence.

original: med pa las 'byung ba la gang yong pa las skye bar 'dzin pa ni brtan par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: med pa las 'byung ba la gang yong pa las skye bar 'dzin pa ni brtan par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The idea of stability is the idea that what is produced from nonexistence is born from something.

original: yang na 'di dag thams cad dngos po med pa sgyu ma lta bu yin na /
analyzed: yang na 'di dag thams cad dngos po med pa sgyu ma lta bu yin na /
translated: Or, if all this is unreal like a magical illusion,

original: bdag nyid can du dngos por sems pa ni brtan par 'du shes pa'o ;
analyzed: bdag nyid can du dngos por sems pa ni brtan par 'du shes pa'o ;
translated: the idea that it is a real entity is the idea of stability.

original: / byung nas med par 'gyur ba la yang rdza ma'i byi'u ltar bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'pho bar 'dzin pa ni ther zug tu 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: / byung nas med par 'gyur ba la yang rdza ma'i byi'u ltar bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'pho bar 'dzin pa ni ther zug tu 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The idea of eternity is the idea that what has come into being will not pass away, like the idea that the clay bird will not fly away.

original: 'jig rten gsum dang 'dus byas thams cad ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi mes gdungs pas sdug bsngal dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum dang 'dus byas thams cad ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi mes gdungs pas sdug bsngal dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: The three worlds and all conditioned things are associated with suffering, since they are tormented by the fire of the three kinds of suffering.

original: gang gcig bu bzang po'i ngo bor 'dzin pa de ni bde par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gcig bu bzang po'i ngo bor 'dzin pa de ni bde par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The notion that one thing is good is the notion of pleasure.

original: de ltar kun du gti mug pa'i rgyus lus dang ngag dang yid kyis las rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: de ltar kun du gti mug pa'i rgyus lus dang ngag dang yid kyis las rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa ni 'du byed do //
translated: Thus, the various actions of body, speech, and mind that are performed on the basis of this kind of delusion are called the formations.

original: yang na 'du byed rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na 'du byed rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or else, there are three kinds of formations:

original: bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gor ba'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i 'du byed dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gor ba'i 'du byed do //
translated: the formations that lead to evil, the formations that lead to merit, and the formations that lead to unchangeableness.

original: de la sdig pa'i las byed pa la mngon par chags pa tshe rabs gzhan dang las dang las kyi 'bras bu la kun du gti mug pas med par lta ba rnams ni bsod nams ma yin pa'i las mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: de la sdig pa'i las byed pa la mngon par chags pa tshe rabs gzhan dang las dang las kyi 'bras bu la kun du gti mug pas med par lta ba rnams ni bsod nams ma yin pa'i las mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Those who are attached to the performance of evil actions, and who, because of their delusion about the results of actions in other lives, hold the view that there is no such thing as action, perform the formations that lead to evil.

original: ma rig @135b pas rmongs par gyur pa srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod la yon tan du lta zhing bde bar 'du shes pa rnams ni bsod nams kyi las mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: ma rig @135b pas rmongs par gyur pa srid pa dang srid pa'i longs spyod la yon tan du lta zhing bde bar 'du shes pa rnams ni bsod nams kyi las mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Those who are confused by ignorance, who see existence and the enjoyments of existence as good qualities, and who perceive them as happiness, create meritorious actions.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro la chags par lta bas sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan rnams ni mi g-yo ba'i las mngon par 'du byed de //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro la chags par lta bas sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan rnams ni mi g-yo ba'i las mngon par 'du byed de //
translated: Those who are attached to the taste of meditative absorption due to the condition of ignorance, and who see the absorptions that are dominated by craving, views, and pride, create unmoving actions.

original: de bas na ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las 'du byed kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las 'du byed kun 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the origin of ignorance is the origin of volitional action.

original: de la ma'i mngal du dang po nyid du skad cig ma gcig la zhugs pa'i sems /
analyzed: de la ma'i mngal du dang po nyid du skad cig ma gcig la zhugs pa'i sems /
translated: In this regard, the first moment of consciousness that enters the mother's womb

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos pa sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i sa bon thams cad pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'dir 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos pa sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i sa bon thams cad pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'dir 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yin par dgongs so //
translated: The consciousness that arises from the condition of karmic formations is the consciousness that is the seed of all that is projected by previous karma, and is completely soaked with the latent tendencies of the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres.

original: de nas skad cig ma gnyis phan chad mer mer po dang nur nu ra po la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: de nas skad cig ma gnyis phan chad mer mer po dang nur nu ra po la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs so //
translated: The consciousness that is accompanied by the kalala, arbuda, and so on, from the second moment onward, is name-and-form.

original: de la ming ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: Name is the aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: gzugs ni bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa ste /
translated: Form is that which is demonstrable and has resistance, that which is not demonstrable but has resistance, and that which is neither demonstrable nor has resistance.

original: de gnyis gcig tu bsdoms nas ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis gcig tu bsdoms nas ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Those two combined together are called name-and-form.

original: mig gi skye mched nas yid kyi bar du drug ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: mig gi skye mched nas yid kyi bar du drug ni skye mched drug go //
translated: The six sense-spheres are the six sense-fields, from the eye-sense-field to the mind-sense-field.

original: de la mig gi skye mched ni lta ba'i bdag nyid can dang ba'i rang bzhin gzugs la dmigs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la mig gi skye mched ni lta ba'i bdag nyid can dang ba'i rang bzhin gzugs la dmigs par byed pa ste /
translated: The eye-sense-field is the clear form which is the nature of seeing.

original: lhag ma la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same method applies to the rest.

original: yul dang dbang po dang ; rnam par shes pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du dus mnyam pa nyid du tshogs pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang ; rnam par shes pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du dus mnyam pa nyid du tshogs pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: Contact is the coming together of the three, the object, the sense faculty, and the consciousness, in the nature of cause and effect, at the same time.

original: de la dbang po dang yul ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la dbang po dang yul ni rgyu'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The sense faculty and the object have the nature of cause.

original: de gnyis la brten nas de ma thag tu rnam par shes pa skye bas na rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de gnyis la brten nas de ma thag tu rnam par shes pa skye bas na rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Consciousness arises immediately after them, and so has the nature of effect.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i myong ba ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Sensation is the experience of pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de la lus dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la phan par byed pa'i bdag nyid ni bde ba'i 'tshor ba zhes bya'o //üîΩlus dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la gnod par byed pa'i bdag nyid ni @136a * //
analyzed: de la lus dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la phan par byed pa'i bdag nyid ni bde ba'i 'tshor ba zhes bya'o // lus dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la gnod par byed pa'i bdag nyid ni @136a * //
translated: The nature of that which benefits the body, the faculties, and the consciousness is called the sensation of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'o //
translated: The nature of that which harms the body, the faculties, and the consciousness is called the sensation of pain.

original: lus dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la phan gnod gnyi ga mi byed pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la phan gnod gnyi ga mi byed pa ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The nature of that which neither benefits nor harms the body, the faculties, and the consciousness is called the sensation that is neither pleasant nor painful.

original: sred pa dang sred pa'i longs spyod la rgyun du spyod kyang tshva chu 'thungs pa dang 'dra bar ngoms pa dang tshim pa med pa ni sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang sred pa'i longs spyod la rgyun du spyod kyang tshva chu 'thungs pa dang 'dra bar ngoms pa dang tshim pa med pa ni sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Craving is the desire to constantly enjoy craving and the objects of craving, but like drinking salt water, it is never satisfied or sated.

original: de 'ang dus gsum tha dad pa'i dbye bas sred pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'ang dus gsum tha dad pa'i dbye bas sred pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, craving becomes three types due to the division of the three times.

original: lta ba'i sred pa dang / mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa dang / mngon par chags pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i sred pa dang / mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa dang / mngon par chags pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: There is craving for views, craving for delight, and craving for attachment.

original: de la 'das pa'i dus su mthong ba'i sred pa dang / thos pa dang / reg pa'i dngos po 'gags par gyur pa rnams dang yang phrad par 'dod pa ni lta ba'i sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i dus su mthong ba'i sred pa dang / thos pa dang / reg pa'i dngos po 'gags par gyur pa rnams dang yang phrad par 'dod pa ni lta ba'i sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The craving for the things of the future, which one wishes to obtain, is called the craving for desire.üîΩThe craving for the things of the present, which one does not want to give up, is called the craving for existence.

original: ma 'ongs ba'i dus na rang gi lus rnam pa sna tshogs dang / yo byad rnam pa mang po dang ldan par smon pa ni mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa'o //üîΩda ltar gyi dus kyi phung po dang yo byad la chags pas mi gtong ba ni /
analyzed: ma 'ongs ba'i dus na rang gi lus rnam pa sna tshogs dang / yo byad rnam pa mang po dang ldan par smon pa ni mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa'o // da ltar gyi dus kyi phung po dang yo byad la chags pas mi gtong ba ni /
translated: The craving for the things of the future, which one wishes to obtain, is called the craving for desire.

original: mngon par chags pa'i sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa'i sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The craving for the things of the present, which one does not want to give up, is called the craving for existence.

original: yang na 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa dang / mi srid pa'i sred pa dang / lta ba'i sred pa ste bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / srid pa'i sred pa dang / mi srid pa'i sred pa dang / lta ba'i sred pa ste bzhi'o //
translated: Or else, there are four kinds of craving: craving for desire, craving for existence, craving for non-existence, and craving for views.

original: de la 'dod pa'i sred pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags so //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i sred pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags so //
translated: The craving for desire is the attachment to the desire realm, which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: srid pa'i sred pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags so //
analyzed: srid pa'i sred pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags so //
translated: Craving for existence is the attachment to the form and formless realms that is to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: mi srid bar sred pa ni thar pa la mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: mi srid bar sred pa ni thar pa la mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: Craving for nonexistence is attachment to liberation.

original: lta ba'i sred pa ni 'jig tshogs la sogs pa lta ba lnga la chags pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i sred pa ni 'jig tshogs la sogs pa lta ba lnga la chags pa'o //
translated: Craving for views is attachment to the five views such as the view of the perishing aggregates.

original: de la len ba yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la len ba yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are also four kinds of grasping:

original: 'dod pa len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs len pa dang / lta ba len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs len pa dang / lta ba len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba len pa'o //
translated: grasping at desire, grasping at morality and asceticism, grasping at views, and grasping at the doctrine of self.

original: de la 'dod chags rnam pa gsum ni 'dod pa len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags rnam pa gsum ni 'dod pa len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Among these, the three kinds of attachment are called grasping at desire.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / chos kyi 'dod chags dang / yul gyi 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / chos kyi 'dod chags dang / yul gyi 'dod chags so //
translated: They are attachment to desire, attachment to doctrine, and attachment to objects.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kyis gnyis sprod pa las chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyis kyis gnyis sprod pa las chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment to desire is attachment from the union of male and female.

original: mu stegs can gyi chos la chags pa ni chos kyi 'dod chags so //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi chos la chags pa ni chos kyi 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment to doctrine is attachment to the doctrines of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la chags pa ni yul gyi 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la chags pa ni yul gyi 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment to the five sense pleasures is attachment to objects.

original: khyi dang ba lang la sogs pa'i @136b dka' thub 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs len ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyi dang ba lang la sogs pa'i @136b dka' thub 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs len ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Taking up the discipline and ritual of dogs, cows, and so on is called taking up discipline and ritual.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa lta ba sna tshogs la zhugs pa ni lta ba len pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa lta ba sna tshogs la zhugs pa ni lta ba len pa'o //
translated: Engaging in various views such as annihilation, permanence, and so on is taking up views.

original: bdag yod par lta zhing chags pa ni bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag yod par lta zhing chags pa ni bdag tu smra ba len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Viewing the self as existent and being attached to it is called taking up the assertion of a self.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bag chags bstsags pa ni srid pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i las rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bag chags bstsags pa ni srid pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The accumulation of the latent propensities of various types of karma that serve as the cause for rebirth is called existence.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa ste rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa ste rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, it is threefold: existence in the desire realm, existence in the form realm, and existence in the formless realm.

original: las kyi bag chags rnam pa sna tshogs pa bsags pa'i khyad par la nying mtshams sbyor ba de dang de dag phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs ba mngon par grub pa ni skye ba zhes bya'o //üîΩmer mer po dang / nur nur po dang / mkhrang gyur dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa nas gzhon nu dang / lang tsho dar la bab pa'i bar gyi stobs dang / mthu dang / gzi brjid dang / mdangs la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur te thabs ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi bag chags rnam pa sna tshogs pa bsags pa'i khyad par la nying mtshams sbyor ba de dang de dag phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs ba mngon par grub pa ni skye ba zhes bya'o // mer mer po dang / nur nur po dang / mkhrang gyur dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa nas gzhon nu dang / lang tsho dar la bab pa'i bar gyi stobs dang / mthu dang / gzi brjid dang / mdangs la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur te thabs ni rga ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúbirth‚Äù of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases is the manifestation of the particular aggregates, elements, and sense bases that are connected to the various karmic propensities that have been accumulated.üîΩ‚ÄúOld age‚Äù is the transformation of the power, strength, splendor, radiance, and so forth of the embryo, the fetus in the first stage, the fetus in the second stage, the fetus in the third stage, the fetus in the fourth stage, the infant, the child, the adolescent, and the adult.

original: yang na yang tsho bcom pa dang na tshod nyams pa dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams bri ba dang / 'du byed rnams rnyings par gyur pa dang / lus lhod par gyur pa dang / yan lag rnams shig shig por gyur pa dang / kha dog dang dbyibs mi mdzes pa dang /
analyzed: yang na yang tsho bcom pa dang na tshod nyams pa dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams bri ba dang / 'du byed rnams rnyings par gyur pa dang / lus lhod par gyur pa dang / yan lag rnams shig shig por gyur pa dang / kha dog dang dbyibs mi mdzes pa dang /
translated: Alternatively, old age is the destruction of youth, the decline of the life force, the decrease of the great elements, the aging of the compounded phenomena, the looseness of the body, the shaking of the limbs, and the ugliness of the complexion and shape.

original: dbang po rnams nyam chung ba dang / dran pa dang / rtog pa dang / blo gros rnams rab tu nyams pa dang / 'jig pa la mngon du bltas pa ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams nyam chung ba dang / dran pa dang / rtog pa dang / blo gros rnams rab tu nyams pa dang / 'jig pa la mngon du bltas pa ni rga ba'o //
translated: The faculties become weak, memory, understanding, and discernment deteriorate, and one is faced with destruction: this is aging.

original: de la lang tsho bcom pa ni dar la bab pa med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la lang tsho bcom pa ni dar la bab pa med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Here, the destruction of youth is the disappearance of the prime of life.

original: na tshod nyams pa ni byis pa dang gzhon nu'i spyod pa dang tshul rnams bral ba'o //
analyzed: na tshod nyams pa ni byis pa dang gzhon nu'i spyod pa dang tshul rnams bral ba'o //
translated: The deterioration of age is the loss of the behavior and mannerisms of childhood and adolescence.

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams bri ba ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams zhum par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams bri ba ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams zhum par gyur pa ste /
translated: The diminution of the great elements is the weakening of the elements such as earth, etc.

original: sha sla ba dang gnyer ma can du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sha sla ba dang gnyer ma can du gyur pa'o //
translated: The flesh becomes flabby and wrinkled.

original: 'du byed rnams rnyings par gyur pa ni ngar la babs la lang tsho'i byad gzugs sar pa dang bral bar gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rnyings par gyur pa ni ngar la babs la lang tsho'i byad gzugs sar pa dang bral bar gyur pa'o ;
translated: The aging of formations is the loss of the freshness of youth and the appearance of wrinkles.

original: / lus lhod par gyur pa na ldang ba dang 'dug pa la lus lci ba'o //
analyzed: / lus lhod par gyur pa na ldang ba dang 'dug pa la lus lci ba'o //
translated: The slackening of the body is the heaviness of the body in rising and sitting.

original: yan lag shig shig por 'gyur ba ni rkang pa dang lag pa la sogs pa rnams tshigs tshigs su so sor gyes shing nyams dang mthu med par gyur pa'o //üîΩkha dog dang dbyibs mi sdug pa ni sha dang / khrag @137a * //
analyzed: yan lag shig shig por 'gyur ba ni rkang pa dang lag pa la sogs pa rnams tshigs tshigs su so sor gyes shing nyams dang mthu med par gyur pa'o // kha dog dang dbyibs mi sdug pa ni sha dang / khrag @137a * //
translated: The limbs become loose: the feet, hands, etc. become loose, separated at the joints, and without strength.

original: skam sa la rus pa phyir snang ba dang / khabs nag pos khebs pa dang / gnyer ma dang skra dkar gyis gang ba'o //
analyzed: skam sa la rus pa phyir snang ba dang / khabs nag pos khebs pa dang / gnyer ma dang skra dkar gyis gang ba'o //
translated: The complexion and figure become ugly: the flesh and blood dry up, the veins appear, the skin becomes wrinkled and covered with moles, and the hair turns white.

original: dbang po rnams nyam chung ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams mthong ba dang / thos pa mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams nyam chung ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams mthong ba dang / thos pa mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The senses become weak: the eye, etc. sense organs become unclear in seeing, hearing, etc.

original: dran pa dang rtogs pa dang / blo gros rab tu nyams pa ni sngon smras pa dang / thos pa rnams mi dran zhing brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang rtogs pa dang / blo gros rab tu nyams pa ni sngon smras pa dang / thos pa rnams mi dran zhing brjed pa'o //
translated: Memory, understanding, and insight deteriorate: one forgets and is unable to recall what was said and heard in the past.

original: 'jig pa la mngon du bltas pa ni 'chi ba'i dus dang khad nye ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa la mngon du bltas pa ni 'chi ba'i dus dang khad nye ba'o //
translated: One is headed toward destruction: one is close to the time of death.

original: yang na rga ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na rga ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or else, aging is twofold:

original: rten nyams pa dang / brten pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rten nyams pa dang / brten pa nyams pa'o //
translated: degeneration of the support and degeneration of what is supported.

original: de la rten nyams pa ni 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po las gyur pa ;
analyzed: de la rten nyams pa ni 'di ltar 'byung ba chen po las gyur pa ;
translated: The degeneration of the basis is as follows:

original: khrag dang sha dang tshil dang rkang dang rus pa la sogs pa bri bas de'i rgyus na rgyug pa dang rgal ba dang / mchong ba dang / bskum pa dang / rmyong ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba ni mi nus shing /
analyzed: khrag dang sha dang tshil dang rkang dang rus pa la sogs pa bri bas de'i rgyus na rgyug pa dang rgal ba dang / mchong ba dang / bskum pa dang / rmyong ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba ni mi nus shing /
translated: Since blood, flesh, fat, bone, and so on, which are derived from the great elements, diminish, one is unable to perform activities such as running, jumping, leaping, bending, stretching, coming, and going.

original: lus kyi brtson 'grus dang stobs mthu chung ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi brtson 'grus dang stobs mthu chung ba'o //
translated: Physical striving and strength are weak.

original: de la brten pa nyams pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams lta ba dang nyan pa la mi gsal bar 'jug cing de'i rgyus na dran pa dang / rtogs pa dang / blo gros la sogs pa nyams shing sems kyi stobs dang brtson 'grus bri ba'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa nyams pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams lta ba dang nyan pa la mi gsal bar 'jug cing de'i rgyus na dran pa dang / rtogs pa dang / blo gros la sogs pa nyams shing sems kyi stobs dang brtson 'grus bri ba'o //
translated: The degeneration of that which is based on the body is that the sense faculties such as the eyes engage in seeing and so on unclearly. Due to that, memory, understanding, intelligence, and so on degenerate and the strength and striving of the mind diminish.

original: dbang po rnams nyams pa las de'i rgyus sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi mthun pa ni 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnams nyams pa las de'i rgyus sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi mthun pa ni 'chi ba ste /
translated: From the degeneration of the sense faculties, the mind and mental factors become discordant due to that cause, which is death.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rgyus med par gyur pa na gang zag de shi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rgyus med par gyur pa na gang zag de shi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind and mental factors cease due to the exhaustion of their causes, that person is said to have died.

original: de la 'chi ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'chi ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Death is of two kinds:

original: rang gi ngang gis 'chi ba dang / nye bar bcom pas 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'chi ba dang / nye bar bcom pas 'chi ba'o //
translated: death by natural causes and death by violence.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'chi ba ni tshe zad pa dang / bsod nams zad nas 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'chi ba ni tshe zad pa dang / bsod nams zad nas 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death by natural causes is death due to the exhaustion of life or the exhaustion of merit.

original: nye bar bcom pa ni mtshon cha dang / dbyig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis shi ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar bcom pa ni mtshon cha dang / dbyig pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis shi ba'o //
translated: Death by violence is death due to the conditions of weapons, sticks, and so on.

original: yang na 'chi ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na 'chi ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or, death is of three kinds:

original: rjes su skad cig mas 'chi ba dang / nye bar bcom pas 'chi ba dang / rgyu zad pas 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su skad cig mas 'chi ba dang / nye bar bcom pas 'chi ba dang / rgyu zad pas 'chi ba'o //
translated: death by the moment, death by violence, and death by the exhaustion of causes.

original: de la rjes su skad cig mas 'chi ba ni skad cig ma re re la yang 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su skad cig mas 'chi ba ni skad cig ma re re la yang 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Death by the moment is called death in each moment.

original: nye bar bcom pas 'chi ba ni dug dang mtshon la sogs pa phog nas shi ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar bcom pas 'chi ba ni dug dang mtshon la sogs pa phog nas shi ba'o //
translated: Death by violence is death by the impact of poison, weapons, and so on.

original: rgyu zad nas 'chi ba ni tshe ring por gyur pa'i las zad nas gang 'chi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu zad nas 'chi ba ni tshe ring por gyur pa'i las zad nas gang 'chi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Death through the exhaustion of the cause is the death of one whose long-life karma is exhausted.

original: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa ni rga shi'i yan lag tu @137b gtogs te /
analyzed: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa ni rga shi'i yan lag tu @137b gtogs te /
translated: Sorrow, lamentation, etc. are included in the member of aging and death.

original: de la mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'i rnam par rtog pa las skyes pa'i sems kyi gdung ba ni mya ngan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mdza' ba dang bral ba dang / mi mdza' ba dang phrad pa'i rnam par rtog pa las skyes pa'i sems kyi gdung ba ni mya ngan zhes bya'o //
translated: Sorrow is the burning of the mind born from the conception of separation from what is dear and encountering what is not dear.

original: sems kyi gdung ba'i rgyu las tshig tu smra ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byin pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gdung ba'i rgyu las tshig tu smra ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byin pa ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: Lamentation is the utterance of various words born from the cause of the burning of the mind.

original: khams rnams 'khrugs pas yul mngon du gyur ba la yang dbang pos 'dzin par mi nus shing rmongs pa'i gnod pas reg par gyur pa ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams rnams 'khrugs pas yul mngon du gyur ba la yang dbang pos 'dzin par mi nus shing rmongs pa'i gnod pas reg par gyur pa ni sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Pain is the inability of the sense faculties to grasp manifest objects due to the disturbance of the elements, and the affliction of contact with confusion.

original: yul mngon du ma gyur ba rnams dbang pos gzung bar chags pa skye ba ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yul mngon du ma gyur ba rnams dbang pos gzung bar chags pa skye ba ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is the desire to grasp manifest objects with the sense faculties that are not manifest.

original: zhe sdang las byung ba'i rgyu lus dang sems nyon mongs par gyur pa ni 'khrug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang las byung ba'i rgyu lus dang sems nyon mongs par gyur pa ni 'khrug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The disturbance of body and mind that arises from hatred is called ‚Äúagitation.‚Äù

original: yang na bu smad la sogs pa dang / yo byad rnams la gtong mi nus shing chags pa ni mya ngan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bu smad la sogs pa dang / yo byad rnams la gtong mi nus shing chags pa ni mya ngan zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the inability to give up one‚Äôs wife and children and possessions, and the attachment to them, is called ‚Äúgrief.‚Äù

original: mya ngan las langs pa'i tshig tu smra ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las langs pa'i tshig tu smra ba ni smre sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: The words that arise from grief are called ‚Äúlamentation.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i mi bde ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa'i mi bde ba myong ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The experience of pain associated with the five collections of consciousness is called ‚Äúsuffering.‚Äù

original: yid la byed pa dang ldan pa yid kyi sdug bsngal ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang ldan pa yid kyi sdug bsngal ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: The mental suffering associated with mental activity is called ‚Äúgrief.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang de la sogs pa sngon rgyal po'i zhabs 'bring byed byed pa las dben pa dang / tshod byed byed pa las khe med pa la sogs pa nyes pa byas pa rnams dran nas mi dga' ba ni 'khrug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de la sogs pa sngon rgyal po'i zhabs 'bring byed byed pa las dben pa dang / tshod byed byed pa las khe med pa la sogs pa nyes pa byas pa rnams dran nas mi dga' ba ni 'khrug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the unpleasant recollection of past service to a king, or of past service as a judge, or of past misdeeds such as the lack of profit, and so on, is called ‚Äúagitation.‚Äù

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyas par bshad nas de'i don bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rgyas par bshad nas de'i don bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Having thus explained dependent origination in detail, in order to teach its meaning in brief, he says: ‚ÄúThus, this entire great mass of suffering comes to be.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar na'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means in the way that has been explained above.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po ni sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad la sogs pa sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po ni sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad la sogs pa sdug bsngal mang po dang ldan pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúMass of suffering‚Äù means that which possesses many kinds of suffering, such as the three or eight kinds of suffering.

original: chen po ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas rgyun du sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas rgyun du sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat‚Äù means that it has been suffering continuously since beginningless cyclic existence.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to phenomena such as form.

original: 'ba' zhig ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEntire‚Äù means that it is devoid of self and what belongs to self.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúComes to be‚Äù means that it arises.

original: de la yan lag bsdu ba ni de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su phye ba de yang bsdus na yan lag gnyis su blta ste /
analyzed: de la yan lag bsdu ba ni de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis su phye ba de yang bsdus na yan lag gnyis su blta ste /
translated: The twelve members of dependent origination are to be seen as two members:

original: ring ba'i rgyu dang nye ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ring ba'i rgyu dang nye ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: the remote cause and the proximate cause.

original: de la ring ba'i rgyu ni dper na sa bon dang myu gu lta bu ste /üîΩ'bras bu dang thag @138a * //
analyzed: de la ring ba'i rgyu ni dper na sa bon dang myu gu lta bu ste / 'bras bu dang thag @138a * //
translated: The remote cause is like the seed and the sprout,

original: ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring ba'i phyir ro //

original: nye ba'i rgyu ni me tog la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i rgyu ni me tog la sogs pa lta bu ste /

original: 'bras bu dang thag nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang thag nye ba'i phyir ro //

original: de la ring ba'i rgyu yang rnam pa gsum du blta ste /
analyzed: de la ring ba'i rgyu yang rnam pa gsum du blta ste /
translated: The remote cause is to be seen as threefold:

analyzed: jis 'debs ji 'debs ji ltar 'debs pa'o //

analyzed: jis 'debs she na ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pas 'debs pa'o //

original: ji 'debs she na /
analyzed: ji 'debs she na /

analyzed: ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba rnams 'debs so //

original: ji ltar 'debs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'debs she na /

analyzed: ma rig pa las byung ba'i 'du byed kyis ci bsgrubs pa'i bag chags kun gzhi la 'debs so //

analyzed: nye ba'i rgyu yang rnam pa gsum du blta ste / jis mngon du phyung /

original: de la jis mngon du byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la jis mngon du byung ba ni /

analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pas mngon du phyung ngo //

original: ji mngon du phyung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: ji mngon du phyung ba ni skye ba'o //

analyzed: de dag gi nyes dmigs bstan pa ni rga shi'o //
