analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can gyi las byas pas sbyin pa yongs su btang nas mi'i nang du mi'i longs spyod myong bar 'gyur ba las mi de nyid kyis tshul khrims nyams pa la sogs pa'i las byas pa'i dbang gis mir skye ba'i rnam par smin pa
translated: Having given gifts through the action of sentient beings in the desire realm, one experiences human enjoyments among humans. Through the power of the action of that human himself, such as the action of violating ethics, the ripening of birth as a human

original: bskyod nas rgyal po 'am blon po'i ba lang ngam rtar skye ba lta bur gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi las la rnam par smin pa g-yo ba med pas na mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskyod nas rgyal po 'am blon po'i ba lang ngam rtar skye ba lta bur gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi las la rnam par smin pa g-yo ba med pas na mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The karma of the form and formless realms is called ‚Äúunmoving‚Äù because it does not move to another realm, just as a king or minister is born as a cow or horse.

original: 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu ni 'khor ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu ni 'khor ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of samsara is the cause of samsara.

original: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba dang mi g-yo ba'i las zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: Thus, it is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and unmoving karma that is contaminated.

original: rgyu de las byung ba ni 'khor ba nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu de las byung ba ni 'khor ba nyid do //
translated: Samsara arises from that cause.

original: mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa'i rgyu ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa'i rgyu ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of nirvana is the cause of nirvana.

original: 'phags pa'i lam rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam rnams so //
translated: It is the noble path.

original: de las byung ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana arises from that.

original: de las mya ngan las 'das pa'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de las mya ngan las 'das pa'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Nirvana is also twofold:

original: cha gcig spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / cha gnyis spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: cha gcig spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / cha gnyis spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: the nirvana of abandoning one part and the nirvana of abandoning two parts.

original: de la cha gcig spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i cha spangs te /üîΩphung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //üîΩcha gnyis spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i cha spangs pa bzhin du phung po'i cha yang spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de la cha gcig spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i cha spangs te / phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o // cha gnyis spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i cha spangs pa bzhin du phung po'i cha yang spangs pa ste /
translated: Nirvana that is the abandonment of one part is the nirvana that has a remainder of aggregates, since it is the abandonment of the part of affliction that is to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: phung po'i lhag ma yang ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma yang ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana that is the abandonment of two parts is the nirvana that is the complete abandonment of the remainder of the aggregates, since it is the abandonment of the part of the aggregates that is similar to the abandonment of the part of affliction.

original: de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i dge ba'i rgyu dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu dang / mi g-yo ba'i rgyu dang / 'khor ba'i rgyu dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu las byung ba de dag thams cad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i dge ba'i rgyu dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu dang / mi g-yo ba'i rgyu dang / 'khor ba'i rgyu dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu las byung ba de dag thams cad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: All of those means all that arises from the causes of virtue, nonvirtue, the imperturbable, samsara, and nirvana, as explained above.

original: sems can gang dbang po'i rgyu la 'jug pa tshad mar byed pa de ni dbang po'i rgyu las byung zhing /
analyzed: sems can gang dbang po'i rgyu la 'jug pa tshad mar byed pa de ni dbang po'i rgyu las byung zhing /
translated: Any sentient being who engages in the cause of the faculties and takes that as valid is born from the cause of the faculties.üîΩThe cause of karma is born from the cause of the faculties.

original: las kyi rgyu las byung ba ste 'bras bu'i rgyu grub par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las kyi rgyu las byung ba ste 'bras bu'i rgyu grub par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cause of the result is established.

original: dbang po nyid dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa rnams byed pa dang 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pas na dbang po'i rgyu ste /

translated: The cause of the faculties is the cause of the virtuous, nonvirtuous, samsara, and nirvana that are created and established by the faculties.

original: de ltar dbang po'i rgyu las @139b chos de dag 'byung gi byed pa po la sogs pas byas pa ma yin pa shes pa ni dbang po'i rgyu las 'jug pa tshad mar byed pa ste /

translated: In that way, knowing that those phenomena arise from the cause of the faculties and are not created by a creator, and so on, is engaging in the cause of the faculties and taking that as valid.

analyzed: de dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa kun kyang dbang po dang las kyi rgyu las byung zhing dge ba la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rgyu dbang po las grub par byed do zhes zin pa'i chos rnams la yang shes la ma zin pa'ang las kyi rgyu las 'byung
translated: One who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin

translated: One who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.üîΩOne who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.üîΩOne who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.üîΩOne who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.üîΩOne who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.üîΩOne who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.üîΩOne who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.üîΩOne who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.üîΩOne who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.üîΩOne who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.

original: lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lugs las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: One who is skilled in the arising of birth from the cause of origin is skilled in the cessation of cessation.

original: gzhan yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o ;
analyzed: gzhan yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o ;
translated: Moreover, it is said, ‚ÄúOne who is skilled in the characteristics of dependent origination . . . ‚Äù

original: /'di lta ste shing med na me dang du ba mi 'byung ba dang / sa bon med na myu gu mi skye ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa 'gags na de las skyes pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag ces bya'o //
analyzed: /'di lta ste shing med na me dang du ba mi 'byung ba dang / sa bon med na myu gu mi skye ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa 'gags na de las skyes pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag ces bya'o //
translated: Just as fire and smoke do not occur without wood, and a sprout does not arise without a seed, so when the afflictions are stopped, the effect that arises from them does not occur. Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúWhen incorrect mental activity is stopped, ignorance is stopped.‚Äù

original: ji ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gags pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gags pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that the cessation of ignorance, etc., is called dependent origination?

original: smras pa / nyes pa med de /
analyzed: smras pa / nyes pa med de /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThere is no fault.

original: 'di la gtan med par dgag pa la ni ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gag go zhes mi bya'i dper na mar me'i rkyen gyis mun pa 'gags na snang ba nyid skye ba dang / sman bcud kyis len zos na nad med pa la bde ba skye ba de bzhin du lam bsgoms pa'i mthus ma rig pa dang mi mthun pa gang rig pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ni ma rig pa 'gags pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la gtan med par dgag pa la ni ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gag go zhes mi bya'i dper na mar me'i rkyen gyis mun pa 'gags na snang ba nyid skye ba dang / sman bcud kyis len zos na nad med pa la bde ba skye ba de bzhin du lam bsgoms pa'i mthus ma rig pa dang mi mthun pa gang rig pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ni ma rig pa 'gags pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Similarly, through the power of cultivating the path, that which is the opposite of ignorance arises and that is called the cessation of ignorance.

original: de ltar gong nas gong du 'du byed la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i gnas 'byung ba la 'du byed la sogs pa 'gags par blta'o //
analyzed: de ltar gong nas gong du 'du byed la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i gnas 'byung ba la 'du byed la sogs pa 'gags par blta'o //
translated: Thus, one should view the cessation of formations and so on as the arising of states that are the opposite of formations and so on.üîΩMoreover, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: gzhan yang chos rnams mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu las mi 'byung bar shes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos rnams mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu las mi 'byung bar shes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: The knowledge that phenomena arise from concordant causes and do not arise from discordant causes is expertise in dependent origination.

original: gzhan yang chos thams cad ni rgyu la rag lus pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos thams cad ni rgyu la rag lus pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, it is said that all phenomena are dependent on causes.

original: chos thams cad @140a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad @140a * //
translated: All phenomena

original: ni nang gi chos dang phyi'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: ni nang gi chos dang phyi'i chos rnams so //
translated: are internal phenomena and external phenomena.

original: de la nang gi chos ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi chos ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, internal phenomena are the formative forces due to the condition of ignorance and so forth.

original: phyi'i chos ni sa bon dang / myu gu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i chos ni sa bon dang / myu gu la sogs pa'o //
translated: External phenomena are seeds, sprouts and so forth.

original: rgyu la rag lus pa ni chos de dag rgyu drug la brten nas skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu la rag lus pa ni chos de dag rgyu drug la brten nas skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Dependent on causes means that those phenomena arise in dependence on six causes.

original: de la rgyu drug po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyu drug po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six causes?

original: byed pa'i rgyu dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: They are the active cause, co-originating cause, homogeneous cause, concomitant cause, pervasive cause and ripening cause.

original: de la byed pa'i rgyu ni chos de dag skye ba na gzugs dang sems la sogs pa mtshan nyid de dag bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos gzhan thams cad ni byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de la byed pa'i rgyu ni chos de dag skye ba na gzugs dang sems la sogs pa mtshan nyid de dag bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos gzhan thams cad ni byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The active cause is that when phenomena arise, all phenomena other than the characteristics of form, mind and so on are active causes.

original: skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The active cause is all dharmas other than the characteristics of form, mind, etc., which are produced, because they exist in the nature of not obstructing the arising of those dharmas.

original: chos gang dag gcig la gcig gi 'bras bur gyur ba de ni lhan cig byung ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: chos gang dag gcig la gcig gi 'bras bur gyur ba de ni lhan cig byung ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The co-originated cause is those dharmas that are the effect of each other.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams lhan cig skye ba na phan tshun skyed par byed pas gcig la gcig lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams lhan cig skye ba na phan tshun skyed par byed pas gcig la gcig lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: the four great elements are co-originated causes in relation to each other, because they mutually generate each other when they are produced together.

original: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos sdar skyes pa rnams phyis skyes pa dang ma skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos sdar skyes pa rnams phyis skyes pa dang ma skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Similarly, mind and mental factors, and the dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm, are homogeneous causes of those that arise later and those that do not arise.

original: de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same applies to the wholesome, unwholesome, and undefined factors.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba gang dag skad cig ma gang la brten nas gnas pa'i dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba gang dag skad cig ma gang la brten nas gnas pa'i dbang po rnams so //
translated: The associated cause is the mind and mental factors that are based on the same support, the same aspect, the same time, and the same substance.

original: sngar skyed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams phyis skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i rang gis pa rnams kyis kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sngar skyed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams phyis skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i rang gis pa rnams kyis kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The pervasive cause is the pervasive factors that are the cause of the later arising and non-arising of the same type of affliction that was previously generated.

original: mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The ripening cause is unwholesome and wholesome contaminated factors.

original: rkyen la rag lus zhes bya ba ni rkyen bzhi la brten nas skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rkyen la rag lus zhes bya ba ni rkyen bzhi la brten nas skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Dependent on conditions means that they arise in dependence on the four conditions.

original: rkyen bzhi ni rgyu'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rkyen bzhi ni rgyu'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: The four conditions are the causal condition, the object condition, the immediately preceding condition, and the dominant condition.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni gang 'bras bu skyed pa la rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen ni gang 'bras bu skyed pa la rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa ste /
translated: The causal condition is that which exists as the cause of generating an effect.

original: sa bon la sogs pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bag chags dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bag chags dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is the seed, etc., and the foundation consciousness along with its propensities.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du 'chad de /
translated: Others explain it differently.

original: byed @140b pa'i rgyu ma gtogs par rgyu rnam pa lnga rnams ni rgyu'i rkyen to zhe'o //
analyzed: byed @140b pa'i rgyu ma gtogs par rgyu rnam pa lnga rnams ni rgyu'i rkyen to zhe'o //
translated: The five causes, excluding the active cause, are the causal condition.

original: dmigs pa gang la sems dang sems las byung ba gang dmigs nas skye bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa de dag ni de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang la sems dang sems las byung ba gang dmigs nas skye bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa de dag ni de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen te /
translated: The objective condition is that objective domain in which mind and mental factors arise by observing it.

original: de'ang ci rigs par chos thams cad rnam par shes pa drug gi dmigs pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de'ang ci rigs par chos thams cad rnam par shes pa drug gi dmigs pa'i rkyen to //
translated: All phenomena are the objective condition of the six consciousnesses, as appropriate.

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i tha ma'i sems ma gtogs par sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu rnams ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'jug pa'i tha ma'i sems ma gtogs par sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyu rnams ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: The causes of mind and mental factors are the equivalent immediately preceding condition, except for the final mind and mental factors of an arhat.

original: byed pa'i rgyu nyid bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu nyid bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: The active cause is the dominant condition.

original: tshogs pa la rag lus zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus nas 'bras bu bskyed nus pa'i mthu dang ldan par gnas pa la brten nas /
analyzed: tshogs pa la rag lus zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams 'dus nas 'bras bu bskyed nus pa'i mthu dang ldan par gnas pa la brten nas /
translated: ‚ÄúDependent on the assembly‚Äù means that the effect arises in dependence on the power of the causes and conditions abiding in a state of being able to generate the effect when they are assembled.

original: 'bras bu skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthe effect arises.‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba bstan nas mi mthun pa'i rgyu las mi 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba bstan nas mi mthun pa'i rgyu las mi 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the concordant cause, in order to teach that it does not arise from a discordant cause,

original: chos gang rgyu dang rkyen dang tshogs pa la rag lus pa de dag la rag ma lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos gang rgyu dang rkyen dang tshogs pa la rag lus pa de dag la rag ma lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúAny phenomena that are dependent on causes and conditions and the assembly are not independent.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag gis btags pa'i bdag la sogs pa la brten te mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis btags pa'i bdag la sogs pa la brten te mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that they do not arise in dependence on a self and so on imputed by others.

original: de 'di na zhe 'am /
analyzed: de 'di na zhe 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúHere,

original: snga ma zhe 'am /
analyzed: snga ma zhe 'am /
translated: in the past,

original: gzhan zhes bgrang ba ci yang med de zhes bya ba ni bdag la ji ltar rag ma lus pa dang / sems can la sogs pa la rag ma lus pas na da lta'i dus su yang 'di na zhes bgrang du med /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bgrang ba ci yang med de zhes bya ba ni bdag la ji ltar rag ma lus pa dang / sems can la sogs pa la rag ma lus pas na da lta'i dus su yang 'di na zhes bgrang du med /
translated: or elsewhere‚Äù means that because the self is not independent, and because sentient beings and so on are not independent, it cannot be enumerated as ‚Äúhere‚Äù in the present time.

original: 'das pa'i dus su yang 'di 'dra ba zhig ces bgrang du med /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su yang 'di 'dra ba zhig ces bgrang du med /
translated: In the past, there was no counting of this kind,  and in the future, there will be no counting of this kind.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang 'di ltar 'gyur zhes bgrang du med pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang 'di ltar 'gyur zhes bgrang du med pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no counting of this kind,  in the present.

original: yang na chos thams cad ni rgyu la rag lus zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'brel pa la skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad ni rgyu la rag lus zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'brel pa la skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Alternatively, all phenomena are dependent on causes means that external and internal dependent origination arises in connection with causes. The meaning of the term arising is the same.

original: de la phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'brel pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'brel pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the connection with causes in external dependent origination?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sa bon las myu gu /
analyzed: sa bon las myu gu /
translated: from a seed, a sprout;

original: myu gu las 'dab ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: myu gu las 'dab ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: from a sprout, a leaf, and so on.

original: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rgyu dang 'brel ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the connection with causes in internal dependent origination?

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
translated: Conditioned by ignorance, there are volitions;

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: conditioned by volitions, there is consciousness, and so on.

original: rkyen la rag lus pa zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang rkyen dang 'brel pa la skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rkyen la rag lus pa zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang rkyen dang 'brel pa la skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúDependent on conditions‚Äù means that external and internal dependent origination arises in connection with conditions.

original: phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What are the conditions for external dependent origination?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sa dang @141a * //
analyzed: sa dang @141a * //
translated: earth,

original: chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus kyi khams rnams zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / dus kyi khams rnams zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: water, fire, wind, space, and time.

original: nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What are the conditions for internal dependent origination?

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams rnams zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are the elements of earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness.

original: tshogs pa la rag lus pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang bar ma gyur pa la rten zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshogs pa la rag lus pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang bar ma gyur pa la rten zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúDependent on a collection‚Äù means that the absence of a deficiency in causes and conditions is what is meant by ‚Äúsupport.‚Äù

original: de bas na s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Rice Seedling S≈´tra says:

original: rgyu'i skabs su sa bon med na myu gu mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i skabs su sa bon med na myu gu mi 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is no seed, a sprout does not arise.‚Äù

original: me tog med na 'bras bu'i bar du yang mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa dang ; rkyen gyi skabs su rkyen 'di rnams med par sa bon las myu gu skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: me tog med na 'bras bu'i bar du yang mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa dang ; rkyen gyi skabs su rkyen 'di rnams med par sa bon las myu gu skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: And in the context of conditions, it says, ‚ÄúWithout these conditions, a sprout would not arise from a seed.

original: nam phyi rol gyi sa'i khams ma tshang ba med par gyur pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nam phyi rol gyi sa'i khams ma tshang ba med par gyur pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: When the external earth element is not deficient, etc.‚Äù

original: nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la yang rgyu'i skabs su gal te ma rig pa ma byung na 'du byed kyang mi 'byung ba zhig na /
analyzed: nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la yang rgyu'i skabs su gal te ma rig pa ma byung na 'du byed kyang mi 'byung ba zhig na /
translated: In the context of internal dependent arising, it says, ‚ÄúIf ignorance did not exist, the compositional processes would not occur.

original: de bzhin du skye ba ma byung du zin na rga shi'i bar du yang mi mngon pa zhig na /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba ma byung du zin na rga shi'i bar du yang mi mngon pa zhig na /
translated: If birth did not exist, aging and death would not be evident.üîΩBut because ignorance exists, the compositional processes arise.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa yod pa las 'du byed rnams skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / rkyen gyi skabs su yang rkyen 'di dag med par lus skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa yod pa las 'du byed rnams skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / rkyen gyi skabs su yang rkyen 'di dag med par lus skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: And in the context of conditions, it says, ‚ÄúWithout these conditions, the body would not arise.

original: nam sa'i khams tshang zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //üîΩchos gang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa la rag lus pa de zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi chos gang rgyu dang rkyen dang / rgyu rkyen 'brel pa las skyes pa'i chos de dag ni bdag las mi skye /
analyzed: nam sa'i khams tshang zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o // chos gang rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa la rag lus pa de zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi chos gang rgyu dang rkyen dang / rgyu rkyen 'brel pa las skyes pa'i chos de dag ni bdag las mi skye /
translated: The passage beginning When the earth element is complete and so on is stated.

original: sems can las mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can las mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The passage beginning Any phenomenon that depends on the assembly of causes and conditions refers to any external or internal phenomenon that arises from causes and conditions and from the connection between causes and conditions. The meaning of those phenomena are not produced from self is that they are not produced from sentient beings.

original: de bas na mdo sde de nyid las phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su de la sa'i khams kyang 'di ltar bdag gi sa bon rten pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba nas myu gu de yang bdag gis ma byas /
analyzed: de bas na mdo sde de nyid las phyi'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su de la sa'i khams kyang 'di ltar bdag gi sa bon rten pa'i bya ba bya'o snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba nas myu gu de yang bdag gis ma byas /
translated: Therefore, in that very sutra, in the section on external dependent origination, it says, The earth element does not think, 'I will perform the function of supporting the seeds.' And so on up to That sprout is not produced by me.

original: pha rol gyis ma byas /
analyzed: pha rol gyis ma byas /
translated: It is not produced by others.

original: gnyis kas ma byas /
analyzed: gnyis kas ma byas /
translated: It is not produced by both.

original: dbang pos ma sprul ;
analyzed: dbang pos ma sprul ;
translated: It is not created by the elements.

original: dus kyi ma bsgyur /
analyzed: dus kyi ma bsgyur /
translated: It is not transformed by time.

original: rang bzhin las ma byung /
analyzed: rang bzhin las ma byung /
translated: It does not arise from inherent nature.

original: rgyu med pa las kyang ma skyes te zhes gsungs pa dang / nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su yang ma rig pa yang 'di ltar bdag gis 'du byed skyed do snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba nas bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang ma skyes te zhes gsungs pa dang / nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skabs su yang ma rig pa yang 'di ltar bdag gis 'du byed skyed do snyam du mi sems so zhes bya ba nas bdag ma yin no //
translated: It is not a self.

original: sems @141b can ma yin /
analyzed: sems @141b can ma yin /
translated: It is not a sentient being.üîΩIt is not a life force.

original: srog ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And so on.

original: de na 'di na zhe 'am /
analyzed: de na 'di na zhe 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù means in the present.

original: snga ma na zhe 'am /
analyzed: snga ma na zhe 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the past‚Äù means in the past.üîΩ‚ÄúIn another‚Äù means in the future.

original: gzhan na zhes bgrang ba ci yang med de zhes bya ba ni chos gang rgyu dang rkyen dang tshogs pa la rag lus pas bdag dang sems can la rag ma lus pa'i chos de ni da ltar ci yin zhes brtag tu med pa dang / sngon gyi dus na ci 'dra zhes brtag tu med pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan na zhes bgrang ba ci yang med de zhes bya ba ni chos gang rgyu dang rkyen dang tshogs pa la rag lus pas bdag dang sems can la rag ma lus pa'i chos de ni da ltar ci yin zhes brtag tu med pa dang / sngon gyi dus na ci 'dra zhes brtag tu med pa dang /
translated: The meaning is that since any phenomenon depends on causes and conditions and their assembly, a phenomenon that does not depend on a self or sentient being cannot be analyzed as to what it is in the present, cannot be analyzed as to what it was like in the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ci lta bur 'gyur zhes brtag tu med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ci lta bur 'gyur zhes brtag tu med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: and cannot be analyzed as to what it will be like in the future.

original: de bas na s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las kyang /üîΩji bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam /
analyzed: de bas na s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las kyang / ji bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam /
translated: Therefore the Rice Seedling S≈´tra says:

original: 'on te ma byung ba zhig snyam du sngon gyi mtha' la mi rtog /üîΩma 'ongs pa'i dus na jir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te ma byung ba zhig snyam du sngon gyi mtha' la mi rtog / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na jir 'gyur /
translated: Do not think about the past, wondering whether or not I existed in the past.

original: ji lta bur 'gyur zhes ma 'ongs pa'i dus la mi rtog go //üîΩ'di ji zhig / ci zhig yod /üîΩcir 'gyur / sems can 'di dag gang nas 'ongs /
analyzed: ji lta bur 'gyur zhes ma 'ongs pa'i dus la mi rtog go // 'di ji zhig / ci zhig yod / cir 'gyur / sems can 'di dag gang nas 'ongs /
translated: Do not think about the future, wondering how I will be in the future or what I will be in the future.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas gong du 'gro bar 'gyur zhes da ltar byung ba la mi rtog go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas gong du 'gro bar 'gyur zhes da ltar byung ba la mi rtog go zhes gsungs so //
translated: Do not think about the present, wondering what this is, what this exists, what this will be, or where these sentient beings have come from, where they will go after they die, or where they will reappear.

original: gzhan yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mtha' gnyis dang bral ba shes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa yin no zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mtha' gnyis dang bral ba shes pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa yin no zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Moreover, the one who knows dependent origination to be free from the two extremes is skilled in dependent origination.

original: gzhan yang gang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi rten thams cad kyang nye bar gzhog la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi rten thams cad kyang nye bar gzhog la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To explain this, the text says, ‚ÄúMoreover, the bodhisattva who is skilled in dependent origination does not say that things arise from any of the four extremes.‚Äù

original: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub ces bya ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge and the perfection of abandonment are called enlightenment.

original: byang chub ni ye shes dang spangs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub ni ye shes dang spangs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because enlightenment has the characteristic of knowledge and abandonment.

original: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is fourfold:

original: thams cad shes pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du shes pa dang / 'bad pa med par shes pa dang / ma bstan par shes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du shes pa dang / 'bad pa med par shes pa dang / ma bstan par shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge of all, knowledge of all aspects, effortless knowledge, and unerring knowledge.

original: thams cad shes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa shes bya'i dngos po ma lus par shes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa shes bya'i dngos po ma lus par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of all is the knowledge of all things to be known without exception, such as the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad du shes pa ni de dag kyang mi rtag pa 'am /üîΩbdag med pa'i rnam par shes pa 'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du shes pa ni de dag kyang mi rtag pa 'am / bdag med pa'i rnam par shes pa 'am /
translated: Knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of those things as impermanent,üîΩas painful, as empty, and as insubstantial.

original: dus gsum thams cad du shes pa ste /
analyzed: dus gsum thams cad du shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of all times is the knowledge of the three times.

original: nams kyang shes pa de la nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nams kyang shes pa de la nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: Effortless knowledge is the knowledge that is never deficient in those knowledges.üîΩUnerring knowledge is the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of the nonerroneous path.

original: 'bad pa med par shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i rgyu la mi ltos shing brtsal ba med par lhun gyis grub par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i rgyu la mi ltos shing brtsal ba med par lhun gyis grub par shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge without effort is knowledge that does not depend on causes such as concentration, and is spontaneously achieved without exertion.

original: ma bstan par shes pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi man ngag med par @142a * //
analyzed: ma bstan par shes pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi man ngag med par @142a * //
translated: Knowledge without teaching is knowledge that is not dependent on the instructions of a preceptor or master.

original: rang 'byung gi ye shes kyi chos thams cad rang nyid kyis mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang 'byung gi ye shes kyi chos thams cad rang nyid kyis mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because all dharmas are self-awakened by the knowledge that arises by itself.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The perfection of abandonment is also fivefold:

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shin tu spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shin tu spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: abandonment of the obscurations of the afflictions, abandonment of the obscurations to omniscience, complete abandonment, abandonment together with the instincts, and abandonment of all obscurations to meditative concentration.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'o //
translated: Among these, the abandonment of the obscurations of the afflictions is the abandonment of the afflictions such as attachment that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mngon par chags pa'i bag chags nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mi shes pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mngon par chags pa'i bag chags nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mi shes pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The elimination of the obscurations to omniscience is the elimination of the non-afflicted ignorance which is the instinct for the notional attachment to the subject-object-dichotomy in regard to the aggregates, elements and media.

original: shin tu spangs pa ni sgrib pa de gnyis phyis sems kyi rgyud la 'byung zhing skye ba med par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu spangs pa ni sgrib pa de gnyis phyis sems kyi rgyud la 'byung zhing skye ba med par spangs pa'o //
translated: The very elimination is the elimination of the non-recurrence of these two obscurations in the mental stream at a later time.

original: bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa ni sgrib pa de gnyis kyi bag la nyal rtsa nas bton pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa ni sgrib pa de gnyis kyi bag la nyal rtsa nas bton pa'o //
translated: The elimination together with the instincts is the uprooting of the proclivity for these two obscurations.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa spangs pa ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa rnams spangs pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa spangs pa ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa rnams spangs pa'o //
translated: The elimination of the obscurations to all meditative concentrations is the elimination of the obscurations to the attainment of the nine successive concentrations, the spheres of mastery, and the spheres of totality.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gang gis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang rkyen de rnams nye bar sgrub pa la byang chub kyi rkyen rnams kyang nye bar gzhog la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gang gis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang rkyen de rnams nye bar sgrub pa la byang chub kyi rkyen rnams kyang nye bar gzhog la zhes bya ste /
translated: The conditions for enlightenment are also brought to completion in the accomplishment of the causes and conditions by which unsurpassable enlightenment is attained.

original: rgyu dang rkyen kyang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //üîΩrkyen de dag kyang zad cing 'gog par rtogs te zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams ngo bo nyid med par shes pa 'am /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen kyang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs so // rkyen de dag kyang zad cing 'gog par rtogs te zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams ngo bo nyid med par shes pa 'am /
translated: The causes and conditions are also the accumulations of merit and wisdom.üîΩThose conditions are also realized as exhausted and ceased.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed 'byung ba la sogs pa rkyen gong du smos pa rnams ngo bo nyid med par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed 'byung ba la sogs pa rkyen gong du smos pa rnams ngo bo nyid med par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the causes and conditions for enlightenment are known to be essenceless, or that the previously mentioned conditions, such as compositional activity arising due to the condition of ignorance, are known to be essenceless.

original: sems can la lta ba'i phyir zad cing 'gog pa'i ye shes su mi 'jog ces bya ba ni de ltar de bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs kyang sems can gyi don du mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig la gnas par mi byedüîΩces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can la lta ba'i phyir zad cing 'gog pa'i ye shes su mi 'jog ces bya ba ni de ltar de bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs kyang sems can gyi don du mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig la gnas par mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that although he thus realizes the nature of emptiness of nirvana, he does not rest in nirvana alone for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bshad pa'i don du dus gsum la mkhas pa bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bshad pa'i don du dus gsum la mkhas pa bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: In order to explain dependent origination, the text teaches skill in the three times.

original: de la @142b byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes dris so //
analyzed: de la @142b byang chub sems dpa'i dus gsum la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes dris so //
translated: Here, what is a bodhisattva's skill in the three times?

original: dus gsum po de yang dus nyid la rnam pa gsum yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dus gsum po de yang dus nyid la rnam pa gsum yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Those three times do not have three aspects in terms of time itself.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba la dus gsum du bzhag ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba la dus gsum du bzhag ste /
translated: The three times are posited in terms of mind and mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i dngos po de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu bcas par 'das te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i dngos po de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu bcas par 'das te /
translated: Those very things of mind and mental factors, along with their causes and effects,

original: zhig pa ni 'das pa'i dus zhes bya /
analyzed: zhig pa ni 'das pa'i dus zhes bya /
translated: having passed, having ceased, are called the past time.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu da dung ma skyes pa la ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes bya /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu da dung ma skyes pa la ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes bya /
translated: That which is neither the cause nor the effect has arisen is called the future time.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu skyes nas ma zhig gi bar du ni da ltar byung ba'i dus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu skyes nas ma zhig gi bar du ni da ltar byung ba'i dus zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the cause and the effect and has arisen but not yet ceased is called the present time.

original: dngos po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams ci 'dra ba la mkhas pa ni dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams ci 'dra ba la mkhas pa ni dus gsum la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the expertise in the past, future, and present entities is called expertise in the three times.

original: 'das pa'i dus la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgang bdag dang sems can gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩdge ba dang mi dge ba dang 'brel ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba gang yin pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir / gang bdag dang sems can gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang 'brel ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba gang yin pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: To demonstrate expertise in the past time, he says:üîΩWhatever virtuous and nonvirtuous karma I and other sentient beings have created in the past,üîΩWhatever virtuous and nonvirtuous karma I and other sentient beings have created in the past is called virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: bdag dang sems can gzhan gyis 'das pa'i dus na dge ba ni 'di lta bu zhig byas /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can gzhan gyis 'das pa'i dus na dge ba ni 'di lta bu zhig byas /
translated: Whatever virtuous and nonvirtuous karma I and other sentient beings have created in the past is called virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: mi dge ba ni 'di lta bu zhig byas zhes bdag dang gzhan gyis dge ba dang mi dge ba byas pa ma brjed pa ni rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'di lta bu zhig byas zhes bdag dang gzhan gyis dge ba dang mi dge ba byas pa ma brjed pa ni rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Remembering is not forgetting what one has done and what others have done, such as I have done such and such a virtuous or non-virtuous deed.

original: de tsam gyi 'das pa'i dus la mkhas pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de tsam gyi 'das pa'i dus la mkhas pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is one skilled in the past time just to that extent?

original: ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that it is not so, he says:

original: mi dge ba sems dang sems las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi dge ba sems dang sems las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Non-virtue is the mind and mental factors and so on.

original: 'di yang bdag dang gzhan gyi mi dge ba dang 'brel ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba dran nas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di yang bdag dang gzhan gyi mi dge ba dang 'brel ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba dran nas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is also to be connected with having remembered the mind and mental factors associated with one's own and others' non-virtue.

original: byang chub tu bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba byas pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rgyur gyur zhes smon pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu bsngo ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba byas pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rgyur gyur zhes smon pa'o //
translated: Dedications to enlightenment are dedicating virtuous deeds to becoming the cause for attaining unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show skill in the future time,üîΩhe says:

original: gang ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Whatever future mind and mental factors and so on.

original: ma 'ongs pa na bdag gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rgyu bdag dang gzhan la phan par byed pa'i rkyen du gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams gdon mi za bar bya'o zhes sems pa ni dge ba'i rtsa
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na bdag gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i rgyu bdag dang gzhan la phan par byed pa'i rkyen du gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams gdon mi za bar bya'o zhes sems pa ni dge ba'i rtsa
translated: The thought In the future, I will certainly create the roots of virtue that are the cause of attaining unsurpassed enlightenment, which is the collection of my merit and wisdom, and which will be the condition for benefiting myself and others is the thought of the roots of virtue.

original: ba'i tshogs la nges par sems pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i tshogs la nges par sems pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the definite thought of the collection of virtue.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just this meaning,

original: byang chub mngon du gyur pa'i las sems @143a * //üîΩte zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub mngon du gyur pa'i las sems @143a * // te zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, The thought of the action of actualizing enlightenment.

original: byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i las bya bar sems pa ni byang chub mngon du 'gyur ba'i las sems pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i las bya bar sems pa ni byang chub mngon du 'gyur ba'i las sems pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought I will perform the virtuous action that will lead to attaining enlightenment is called the thought of the action of actualizing enlightenment.

original: don de nyid ji lta bu yin pa gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid ji lta bu yin pa gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clearly teach just what this meaning is,

original: bdag gi dge ba'i sems bskyed pa gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gi dge ba'i sems bskyed pa gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, Whatever virtuous thoughts I have generated...

original: dge ba dang 'brel pa'i sems ni dge ba'i sems so //
analyzed: dge ba dang 'brel pa'i sems ni dge ba'i sems so //
translated: A virtuous thought is a thought that is connected with virtue.

original: bskyed pa ni da ltar gyi dus na dge ba'i sems skyes zin pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa ni da ltar gyi dus na dge ba'i sems skyes zin pa'o //
translated: The generated is the virtuous mind that has already arisen in the present time.

original: skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba dang 'brel ba'i sems gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba dang 'brel ba'i sems gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The one that will arise is the virtuous mind that will definitely arise in the future time, connected with virtue.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dus gnyis kyi dge ba'i sems nyid la snyegs te /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dus gnyis kyi dge ba'i sems nyid la snyegs te /
translated: Those refers to the virtuous minds of the two times.

original: da ltar gyi dus na dge ba'i sems skyed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na skye bar 'gyur ba de dag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na dge ba'i sems skyed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na skye bar 'gyur ba de dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the virtuous mind that is generated in the present time and the one that will arise in the future time are called those.

original: ni zhes bya bas dge ba de dag theg pa gnyis dang / lha dang mi'i bde 'gror mi bsngo zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya bas dge ba de dag theg pa gnyis dang / lha dang mi'i bde 'gror mi bsngo zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The word only shows that those virtues are not dedicated to the two vehicles or to the happy realms of gods and humans.

original: byang chub ces bya ba ni byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba ni byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Enlightenment means for the sake of attaining enlightenment.

original: skabs mi dbye zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba'i skabs mi dbye zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: skabs mi dbye zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i mi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba'i skabs mi dbye zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Not making an opportunity shows that it is taught that one does not make an opportunity for the arising of non-virtuous minds and mental factors in the future.

original: gong du bshad pa'i don rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i don rnams bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the above,

original: gang de lta bur sems la bsgo ba de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang de lta bur sems la bsgo ba de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúOne who has thus instructed the mind‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de lta bur sems la bsgo zhes bya ba ni ji nas da ltar gyi dus nas dge ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba de dag nges par byang chub tu bsngo la /
analyzed: de lta bur sems la bsgo zhes bya ba ni ji nas da ltar gyi dus nas dge ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba de dag nges par byang chub tu bsngo la /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who has thus instructed the mind‚Äù means that one has definitely dedicated to enlightenment the generation of virtuous mind in the present and the generation of virtuous mind in the future.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i mi dge pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba'i skabs mi dbye'o zhes de lta bur de nas sems la bsgo zhing sems la 'jog par byed pa de ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i mi dge pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba'i skabs mi dbye'o zhes de lta bur de nas sems la bsgo zhing sems la 'jog par byed pa de ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who has thus instructed the mind‚Äù means that one has thus instructed the mind and has thus settled the mind, in the sense that one does not open a door for the generation of non-virtuous mind and mental factors in the future.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach skill with regard to the present,

original: da ltar byung ba la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la mkhas pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is skill with regard to the present?‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba byed cing /
analyzed: 'dod ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba byed cing /
translated: One who is skilled in the present is one who, while engaged in the roots of virtue such as non-attachment,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la mi 'jug pa ni tshul bzhin sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la mi 'jug pa ni tshul bzhin sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Not engaging in the roots of nonvirtue such as desire is called proper application.

original: don gzhan ni sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: don gzhan ni sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Since the other meanings are easy to understand, they are not explained.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi ye shes kyis dus gsum na gnas pa'i dngos po rnams ji lta @143b ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par khong du chud pa ni dus gsum la mkhas pa yin no zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi ye shes kyis dus gsum na gnas pa'i dngos po rnams ji lta @143b ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par khong du chud pa ni dus gsum la mkhas pa yin no zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the knowledge of the three times is the thorough understanding of things as they are, without error, through the wisdom of method and wisdom, it is said:

original: gzhan yang gang 'das pa'i dus kyi chos rnams stong par mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang 'das pa'i dus kyi chos rnams stong par mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, faith in the emptiness of phenomena of the past...

original: gang 'das pa'i dus kyi chos phung po dang / skye mched la sogs pa gang zag dang chos kyi dngos por yod pa ma yin pa yid ches pa ni 'das pa'i dus kyi chos rnams stong par mos pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'das pa'i dus kyi chos phung po dang / skye mched la sogs pa gang zag dang chos kyi dngos por yod pa ma yin pa yid ches pa ni 'das pa'i dus kyi chos rnams stong par mos pa'o //
translated: Faith in the emptiness of phenomena of the past is the conviction that the aggregates, sense spheres, and so forth of the past do not exist as the entities of persons and phenomena.

original: lhag ma yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: lhag ma yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The rest should be applied in the same way.

original: tshig gzhan ni sla bsam bshad do //
analyzed: tshig gzhan ni sla bsam bshad do //
translated: The other words are easy to understand, so they are not explained.

original: gang yang dus gsum gyi chos rnams mi 'pho ba dang / mi skye ba dang mi gnas par rtogs pa ni dus gsum la mkhas pa'o zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: gang yang dus gsum gyi chos rnams mi 'pho ba dang / mi skye ba dang mi gnas par rtogs pa ni dus gsum la mkhas pa'o zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Furthermore, the realization that all phenomena of the three times do not pass on, do not arise, and do not abide is skill with regard to the three times.üîΩWith the thought to teach this, he said,

original: gzhan yang 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, in the past‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'das pa'i dus na zad pa'i chos rnams phyi ma'i mthar 'phos par mi lta zhes bya ba ni chos snga ma 'das pa rnams ngo bo nyid kyis 'das te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na zad pa'i chos rnams phyi ma'i mthar 'phos par mi lta zhes bya ba ni chos snga ma 'das pa rnams ngo bo nyid kyis 'das te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the past, do not view exhausted phenomena as passing on to the future‚Äù means that former phenomena, having already passed by their own nature,

original: phyi ma dang mtshams mi sbyor bar rtogs kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi ma dang mtshams mi sbyor bar rtogs kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: do not connect with the later. This is the meaning of ‚Äúdo not view.‚Äù

original: dge pa mngon par 'du byed pa la brtson 'grus kyang mi gtong ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par mi 'pho yang las dang 'bras bu la yid ches te /
analyzed: dge pa mngon par 'du byed pa la brtson 'grus kyang mi gtong ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par mi 'pho yang las dang 'bras bu la yid ches te /
translated: ‚ÄúDo not abandon effort in the creation of virtue‚Äù means that although in this way, ultimately, there is no passing on, one should have confidence in the relationship between actions and their effects.

original: snga ma'i rgyus phyi ma'i 'bras bu sgrub par shes na dge ba spyod pa'i brtson 'grus kyang mi gtong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma'i rgyus phyi ma'i 'bras bu sgrub par shes na dge ba spyod pa'i brtson 'grus kyang mi gtong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one understands that the cause of the former produces the effect of the later, one should not abandon the effort to engage in virtue. This is the meaning.

original: mi dge ba mngon par 'du mi byed ces bya ba ni de ltar dngos po med de snga ma dang phyi mar mi 'pho bas mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa med par yang mi blta ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba mngon par 'du mi byed ces bya ba ni de ltar dngos po med de snga ma dang phyi mar mi 'pho bas mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa med par yang mi blta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not create non-virtue‚Äù means that since there is no such entity, and since it does not pass from the past to the future, one should not view the maturation of non-virtuous karma as nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir mi dge ba mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dge ba mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, one does not create non-virtue.

original: gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi chos rnams ma skye mi 'byung bar rtog cing byang chub tu bsngo ba'i brtson 'grus kyang mi 'dor zhes bya ba ni don dam par na ma 'ongs pa'i dus na thob par bya ba'i byang chub nyid mi skye mi 'byung bar rtogs
analyzed: gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi chos rnams ma skye mi 'byung bar rtog cing byang chub tu bsngo ba'i brtson 'grus kyang mi 'dor zhes bya ba ni don dam par na ma 'ongs pa'i dus na thob par bya ba'i byang chub nyid mi skye mi 'byung bar rtogs
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not abandon the striving that dedicates future phenomena, which are unborn and unarisen, to enlightenment‚Äù means that ultimately, one realizes that the enlightenment to be attained in the future is unborn and unarisen.

original: kyang kun rdzob tu med par mi lta bas byang chub tu bsngo ba'i brtson 'grus kyang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: kyang kun rdzob tu med par mi lta bas byang chub tu bsngo ba'i brtson 'grus kyang mi gtong ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, one does not abandon the striving that dedicates to enlightenment, since one does not view it as nonexistent conventionally.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus na chos rnams 'dug pa med cing mi gnas par rtogs te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus na chos rnams 'dug pa med cing mi gnas par rtogs te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne realizes that phenomena in the present do not remain and are not present.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu brtan pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyang mi brjed de zhes bya ba ni don dam par da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams mi gnas pas byang chub kyi sems nyid kyang mi gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu brtan pa ni byang chub kyi sems kyang mi brjed de zhes bya ba ni don dam par da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams mi gnas pas byang chub kyi sems nyid kyang mi gnas te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is very firm in his superior intention does not forget the thought of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi @144a * //üîΩsems la rmongs pa 'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyi @144a * // sems la rmongs pa 'am /
translated: The thought of awakening itself does not endure, because present phenomena do not endure ultimately.

original: brjed par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: brjed par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: If it were possible for the thought of awakening to be confused or forgotten,üîΩthen the bodhisattva who is very firm in his superior intention would forget the thought of awakening in all his activities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu brtan pa ni spyod lam thams cad du byang chub kyi sems kyang mi brjed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa rab tu brtan pa ni spyod lam thams cad du byang chub kyi sems kyang mi brjed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: dus gsum la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: dus gsum la mkhas pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Wishing to teach another enumeration of the three times, he says,

original: gzhan yang gang 'das pa de ni zad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang 'das pa de ni zad pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, what is past is exhausted, etc.

original: 'das pa'i chos rnams ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bcas te 'gags pas na zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i chos rnams ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bcas te 'gags pas na zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Past phenomena are called ‚Äúexhausted‚Äù because they have ceased along with their causes and effects.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bcas te ma phyin pas nam phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos rnams ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bcas te ma phyin pas nam phyin pa'o //
translated: Future phenomena are not yet arrived, since they have not yet come with their causes and effects.

original: da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams ni rgyus 'bras bu bskyed nas de ma thag tu 'gags pas na gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams ni rgyus 'bras bu bskyed nas de ma thag tu 'gags pas na gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: Present phenomena do not remain, since the cause of an effect has just ceased.

original: de ltar dus gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the characteristics of the three times,

original: de la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir gang de ltar sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa bstan pa'i phyir gang de ltar sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: in order to teach skill in them, he says, ‚ÄúOne who thus knows the arising of mind and mental factors,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtog cing zhes bya ba'i sgra re re dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rtog cing zhes bya ba'i sgra re re dang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúknows‚Äù should be supplied with each.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams la rtog pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba zhig pa rnams la rtog pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba zhu ba rnams la rtog ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams la rtog pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba zhig pa rnams la rtog pa dang / sems dang sems las byung ba zhu ba rnams la rtog ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One knows the arising of mind and mental factors, one knows the cessation of mind and mental factors, and one knows the dissolution of mind and mental factors.

original: de la da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rgyus 'bras bu bskyed de bskyed ma thag tu rgyu dang 'bras bu bcas te /üîΩ'gags pas dngos po med do zhes rtog pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rgyus 'bras bu bskyed de bskyed ma thag tu rgyu dang 'bras bu bcas te / 'gags pas dngos po med do zhes rtog pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought that the present mind and mental factors are produced by causes, and that as soon as they are produced, they cease together with their causes, and so are non things is the thought of the arising of mind and mental factors.üîΩThe thought that past mind and mental factors, together with their causes, are non things because their results have ceased is the thought of the disintegration of mind and mental factors.

original: 'das pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rgyu dang bcas te 'bras bu 'gags pas dngos po med do zhes rtog pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i zhig pa rnams la rtog pa zhes sbyar ro //üîΩma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung bas ni rgyu dang bcas te 'bras bu ma skyes pas na dngos po med do zhes rtog pa ni zhu ba rnams la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni rgyu dang bcas te 'bras bu 'gags pas dngos po med do zhes rtog pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i zhig pa rnams la rtog pa zhes sbyar ro //üîΩma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung bas ni rgyu dang bcas te 'bras bu ma skyes pas na dngos po med do zhes rtog pa ni zhu ba rnams la rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought that future mind and mental factors, together with their causes, are non things because their results have not yet arisen is the thought of the nonarising of mind and mental factors.

original: de ltar dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams yang dag par na dngos po med pas dge ba'i tshogs rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i phyir tshogs gnyis kyang mi 'grub pa ma snyam pa la byang chub sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang yang dag par sgrub paüîΩzhes bya bar smos te /
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams yang dag par na dngos po med pas dge ba'i tshogs rnams kyang dngos po med pa'i phyir tshogs gnyis kyang mi 'grub pa ma snyam pa la byang chub sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya bar smos te /
translated: Nevertheless, the roots of virtue that accomplish enlightenment are truly accomplished.

original: tshogs gang gis @144b byang chub sgrub par byed pa'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba ni byang chub sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs gang gis @144b byang chub sgrub par byed pa'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba ni byang chub sgrub pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The definition of the accumulation that accomplishes enlightenment is the roots of virtue that accomplish enlightenment.

original: de yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: They are the definition of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de ni 'di skad du don dam pas dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams kyang rang bzhin med mod kyi kun rdzob tu ji lta ji ltar las byas pa de lta de ltar 'bras bu med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du don dam pas dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams kyang rang bzhin med mod kyi kun rdzob tu ji lta ji ltar las byas pa de lta de ltar 'bras bu med pa ma yin te /
translated: This is stated as follows: In reality, things of the three times are indeed essenceless. However, conventionally, the effect is not nonexistent in accordance with the karma that is performed.

original: de bas na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyang sgrub par byed ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de bas na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i rgyu bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyang sgrub par byed ces bya bar ston to //
translated: Therefore, it shows that one also accomplishes the accumulations of merit and wisdom, which are the causes for attaining unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pas dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams khong du chud cing dran te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pas dus gsum gyi dngos po rnams khong du chud cing dran te /
translated: Moreover, by possessing the five superknowledges, one comprehends and remembers things of the three times.

original: bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba chud mi za bar byed pa ni dus gsum la mkhas pa'o zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba chud mi za bar byed pa ni dus gsum la mkhas pa'o zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to teach that the non-wastage of one's roots of virtue is expertise in the three times,

original: gzhan yang gang mngon par shes pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang mngon par shes pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says Moreover, one who is skilled in the superknowledges... and so on.

original: mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni mngon par shes pa la mkhas pa 'am /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni mngon par shes pa la mkhas pa 'am /
translated: One who possesses the superknowledges is skilled in the superknowledges,

original: yang na mngon par shes pas dngos po rnams shes shing dran te /
analyzed: yang na mngon par shes pas dngos po rnams shes shing dran te /
translated: or else, by means of the superknowledges, one knows and remembers things.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba byas pa rnams chud mi gson pa'i mngon par shes pa 'das pa'i dus rjes su dran te zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pas 'das pa'i dus na mi dge ba ci byas pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba byas pa rnams chud mi gson pa'i mngon par shes pa 'das pa'i dus rjes su dran te zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pas 'das pa'i dus na mi dge ba ci byas pa dang /
translated: The superknowledge of the non-loss of the roots of virtue is the recollection of the past.

original: dge ba ci byas pa ma brjed pa ni 'das pa'i dus dran pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ci byas pa ma brjed pa ni 'das pa'i dus dran pa'o //
translated: The recollection of the past is the recollection of what non-virtue was done in the past and what virtue was done,

original: de ltar dran pa yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de ltar dran pa yang ma zad kyi /
translated: not forgetting that by means of the superknowledge of the recollection of past abodes.

original: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams rjes su dran nas byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa ni 'das pa'i dus la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa rnams rjes su dran nas byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pa ni 'das pa'i dus la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not only that, but also the recollection of the previously generated roots of virtue, and the dedication of them to enlightenment is called ‚Äúexpertise in the past.‚Äù

original: gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i sems bskyed pa rnams rab tu shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pas ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba rnams shes shing mthong zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i sems bskyed pa rnams rab tu shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pas ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba rnams shes shing mthong zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The future generation of virtuous mind is fully known means that here, the superknowledge of the recollection of past lives and the superknowledge of the knowledge of death and rebirth are applied to the future generation of virtuous mind, which is known and seen.

original: ma 'ongs pa na byang chub tu sems bskyed nas 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu las sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dge ba rnams gdon mi za bar skye bar shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba'i sems skyed pa rnams rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na byang chub tu sems bskyed nas 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu las sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa dge ba rnams gdon mi za bar skye bar shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba'i sems skyed pa rnams rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The future generation of virtuous mind is fully known means that, having generated the mind of enlightenment in the future, one knows without doubt that the roots of virtue of nonattachment, nonaversion, and nondelusion will arise, such as generosity, moral discipline, and so on.

original: @145a * // de ltar shes nas kyang da lta nyid kyi dus na dge ba de dag yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: @145a * // de ltar shes nas kyang da lta nyid kyi dus na dge ba de dag yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: Having known that, one should perfect those virtues in the present moment.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur cig par sems la mngon par 'du byed cing re ba ni de la smon pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur cig par sems la mngon par 'du byed cing re ba ni de la smon pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The aspiration is the mental disposition that is directed toward the fulfillment of the wish that the roots of virtue be transformed into the requisites for enlightenment.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la mkhas pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la mkhas pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Skill in the present is also threefold:

original: phyin ci ma log par byed pa dang / mi nyams par byed pa dang / 'bras bu gzhan du mi 'gyur bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par byed pa dang / mi nyams par byed pa dang / 'bras bu gzhan du mi 'gyur bar byed pa ste /
translated: the avoidance of error, the avoidance of diminution, and the avoidance of transformation into a different result.

original: de la gang da ltar byung ba'i dus la dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes shing byung ba rnams yid la byed cing zhes bya bas phyin ci ma log par byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la gang da ltar byung ba'i dus la dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes shing byung ba rnams yid la byed cing zhes bya bas phyin ci ma log par byed pa bstan te /
translated: The avoidance of error is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúhe attends to those roots of virtue that have arisen and have come into being in the present.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes shing byung ba la phyin ci ma log par yang dang yang yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes shing byung ba la phyin ci ma log par yang dang yang yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he repeatedly attends to the roots of virtue that have arisen and have come into being without error.

original: gnas par byed ces bya ba ni mi nyams par byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: gnas par byed ces bya ba ni mi nyams par byed pa bstan te /
translated: The avoidance of diminution is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúhe stabilizes them.‚Äù
