original: dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes shing byung ba gong nas gong du khyad par du 'bogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba skyes shing byung ba gong nas gong du khyad par du 'bogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the roots of virtue that have arisen to be developed more and more.

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya bas 'bras bu gzhan du mi 'gyur bar byed pa bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba zhes bya bas 'bras bu gzhan du mi 'gyur bar byed pa bstan te /
translated: By dedicating to enlightenment, it shows that it causes the result to not change into something else.

original: de ltar byung ba'i dus su dge ba byas te gnas par gyur pa rnams lha dang klu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi bsngo'i /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba'i dus su dge ba byas te gnas par gyur pa rnams lha dang klu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mi bsngo'i /
translated: At the time when they have arisen, those who have done virtue and abide in it do not dedicate it to the result of becoming a god or a nƒÅga, etc.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They dedicate it to attaining unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: dus gsum gyi bsod nams kyi tshogs ci byas pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni dus gsum la mkhas pa yin no zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi bsod nams kyi tshogs ci byas pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni dus gsum la mkhas pa yin no zhes bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: In order to show that being skilled in the three times is the ripening of sentient beings by whatever accumulation of merit is done in the three times,

original: gzhan yang gang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúMoreover, it is the ripening of all sentient beings,‚Äù and so on.

original: sems can thams cad ces bya bas ni rigs lnga dang ldan pa'i gang zag rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces bya bas ni rigs lnga dang ldan pa'i gang zag rnams bsdus te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll sentient beings‚Äù includes all persons who possess the five lineages.

original: de dag so so'i theg pa dang / lha dang mi'i bde 'gror 'gog pa ni yongs su smin par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag so so'i theg pa dang / lha dang mi'i bde 'gror 'gog pa ni yongs su smin par bya ba ste /
translated: Their respective vehicles and the happy realms of gods and humans are what is to be fully matured.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i ched du'o //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i ched du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that‚Äù means for their sake.

original: 'das pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dran nas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sngon dge ba 'di dang 'di byas so zhes sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs ci byas pa ma brjed pa ni dran pa'o //üîΩsems can gang dag ji lta bur yongs su smin pa dang bya ba de dag thams cad de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed ces bya bas sngon byas pa'i bsod nams de dag dran pa tsam du ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'das pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dran nas zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sngon dge ba 'di dang 'di byas so zhes sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa bsod nams kyi tshogs ci byas pa ma brjed pa ni dran pa'o // sems can gang dag ji lta bur yongs su smin pa dang bya ba de dag thams cad de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed ces bya bas sngon byas pa'i bsod nams de dag dran pa tsam du ma zad kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúRemembering the past accumulation of merit‚Äù means not forgetting whatever merit one has accumulated, such as generosity and morality, thinking ‚ÄúI did this and that virtue in the past.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúWhatever beings are to be matured in whatever way, all of them are matured in just that way‚Äù means that, not only does one remember those past merits,

original: bsod nams de dag gi mthus @145b sems can ji snyed cig ji ltar smin par bya ba de dag thams cad de bzhin du smin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsod nams de dag gi mthus @145b sems can ji snyed cig ji ltar smin par bya ba de dag thams cad de bzhin du smin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but by the power of those merits, ‚Äúall those beings who are to be matured in whatever way are matured in just that way.‚Äù

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can gang dag sangs rgyas mnyes par bya bas yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba'i sgo nas ma 'ongs pa'i sems can yongs
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can gang dag sangs rgyas mnyes par bya bas yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba'i sgo nas ma 'ongs pa'i sems can yongs
translated: All those sentient beings of the future who are to be brought to full maturity by pleasing the buddhas will be brought to full maturity in just the same way.

original: su smin par bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can gang dag sangs rgyas mnyes par bya bas yongs su smin par bya ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: su smin par bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sems can gang dag sangs rgyas mnyes par bya bas yongs su smin par bya ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Those sentient beings of the future who are to be brought to full maturity by pleasing the buddhas are called those who are to be brought to full maturity in the future.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi drung du song nas dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang ; bsgom pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i mchod pa dang / mnyes par byas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi drung du song nas dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang ; bsgom pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i mchod pa dang / mnyes par byas nas /
translated: Having gone into the presence of those tathagatas, by pleasing them through the worship of listening to the holy Dharma, reflection, meditation, and so on,

original: de la brten te sems can ji snyed cig yod pa ji ltar yongs su smin par bya ba de snyed cig de bzhin yongs su smin par byed ces bya ba ston to //
analyzed: de la brten te sems can ji snyed cig yod pa ji ltar yongs su smin par bya ba de snyed cig de bzhin yongs su smin par byed ces bya ba ston to //
translated: and by bringing to maturity as many sentient beings as there are, just as they are to be brought to maturity, one will bring them to maturity in just that way.

original: da ltar byung ba'i sems can rnams la chos bstan pa 'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i sems can rnams la chos bstan pa 'am /
translated: He ripens all those sentient beings of the present by teaching the Dharma or by the miraculous power of his magical transformation.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed de zhes bya ba la /
translated: He ripens all those sentient beings of the present by teaching the Dharma or by the miraculous power of his magical transformation.

original: cho 'phrul gyi sgra gnyi ga dang sbyar te /
analyzed: cho 'phrul gyi sgra gnyi ga dang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúmiraculous power‚Äù is connected with both.

original: chos bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with the miraculous power of teaching the Dharma and the miraculous power of magical transformation.

original: de la chos bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la chos bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The miraculous power of teaching the Dharma is also of two kinds.

original: kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul lo //
translated: It is the miraculous power of prediction and the miraculous power of instruction.

original: de la kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul ni sems can rnams kyi khams dang rang bzhin dang bag la nyal rnams la btags nas de dag la de bzhin du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul ni sems can rnams kyi khams dang rang bzhin dang bag la nyal rnams la btags nas de dag la de bzhin du brjod pa'o //
translated: The miraculous power of prediction is the prediction of the spiritual gene, nature, and proclivity of sentient beings, and the prediction of their future enlightenment.

original: rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul ni de ltar gdul bya de dag brda sprad nas bstan pa la btsud de /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul ni de ltar gdul bya de dag brda sprad nas bstan pa la btsud de /
translated: The miraculous power of instruction is the instruction of those disciples who have been introduced to the teaching.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa /
translated: This is the truth of suffering.

original: 'di ni kun 'byung gi bden pa /
analyzed: 'di ni kun 'byung gi bden pa /
translated: This is the truth of origin.

original: 'di ni 'gog pa'i bden pa /
analyzed: 'di ni 'gog pa'i bden pa /
translated: This is the truth of cessation.

original: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa'o zhes bden pa bzhi la sogs pa 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam gyi bden pa'o zhes bden pa bzhi la sogs pa 'chad pa'o //
translated: This is the truth of the path.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul ni dbang lnga dang ldan pa ste /üîΩgcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / snang ba dang mi snang ba la dbang bas sprul pa la dbang ba dang / rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro /üîΩrab la yang thad kar 'gro ba la sogs pa la dbang bas 'gro ba la dbang ba dang / nam mkha' la mngon du 'phags @146a * //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul ni dbang lnga dang ldan pa ste / gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / snang ba dang mi snang ba la dbang bas sprul pa la dbang ba dang / rtsig pa la yang thad kar 'gro / rab la yang thad kar 'gro ba la sogs pa la dbang bas 'gro ba la dbang ba dang / nam mkha' la mngon du 'phags @146a * //
translated: The magical emanation miracle is endowed with five powers:

original: te spyod lam rnam bzhi byed pa dang / chu la yang mi nub par 'gro ste /
analyzed: te spyod lam rnam bzhi byed pa dang / chu la yang mi nub par 'gro ste /
translated: Having been one, becoming many; having been many, becoming one; having been visible, becoming invisible; having been invisible, becoming visible; having been obstructed, becoming unobstructed; having been unobstructed, becoming obstructed; going through walls, through fences, through mountains, without being obstructed; diving in and out of the earth as if in water; walking on water without sinking as if on earth; flying cross-legged through the sky like a bird; touching and stroking with the hand the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful; and making the body reach and touch with the body even up to the Brahma world.

original: sa chen po la bya ba bzhin byed pa la dbang bas gnas pa la dbang ba dang / mi'i 'gro ba 'di na gnas bzhin du lha'i 'gro bar gtogs pa /üîΩzla ba dang / nyi ma 'di gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba /
analyzed: sa chen po la bya ba bzhin byed pa la dbang bas gnas pa la dbang ba dang / mi'i 'gro ba 'di na gnas bzhin du lha'i 'gro bar gtogs pa / zla ba dang / nyi ma 'di gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba /
translated: They have power over the place where they live, since they can live in the human realm and at the same time belong to the celestial realm.üîΩThey have power over the body, since they can take hold of and touch with their hands the sun and moon, which are so powerful, so mighty and so glorious.

original: 'di ltar mthu che ba 'di ltar gzi brjid che ba la'ang lag pas 'dzin cing kun tu nyug par byed pas lus la dbang ba dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du sems can rnams la lus kyi dbang sgyur bas khams khyad par can la dbang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthu che ba 'di ltar gzi brjid che ba la'ang lag pas 'dzin cing kun tu nyug par byed pas lus la dbang ba dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du sems can rnams la lus kyi dbang sgyur bas khams khyad par can la dbang ba ste /
translated: They have power over the special realm, since they can control their bodies up to the Brahma realm.

original: de ltar dbang lnga dang ldan pas gdul bya'i sems can 'dun par byed pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: de ltar dbang lnga dang ldan pas gdul bya'i sems can 'dun par byed pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
translated: Thus, by possessing these five powers, they attract sentient beings who are to be trained, which is the miraculous power of their miracles.

original: da ltar gyi sems can kha cig chos bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis yongs su smin par bya ba yin /
analyzed: da ltar gyi sems can kha cig chos bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis yongs su smin par bya ba yin /
translated: Some present sentient beings are to be brought to maturity by the miracle of teaching the Dharma.

original: sems can kha cig rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis yongs su smin par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can kha cig rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis yongs su smin par bya ba yin te /
translated: Some sentient beings are to be brought to full maturity by the miraculous power of the Buddha.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul gang gis sems can gang yongs su smin par bya ba cho 'phrul des sems can de yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul gang gis sems can gang yongs su smin par bya ba cho 'phrul des sems can de yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: By whatever miracle of the Buddha a sentient being is to be brought to full maturity, that sentient being is brought to full maturity by that miracle.

original: de bas na sems can yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sems can yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin du yongs su smin par byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, all those sentient beings to be brought to full maturity are brought to full maturity in just that way.

original: dus gsum la mkhas pa gong du bshad pa rnams kyi don bsdus te /
analyzed: dus gsum la mkhas pa gong du bshad pa rnams kyi don bsdus te /
translated: Having explained the expertise in the three times,

original: bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: in order to teach the summary of that,üîΩit is said, ‚ÄúWhatever is in these three times‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang dus gsum 'di dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gang dus gsum 'di dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dang sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúbodhisattva.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means ‚Äúwhatever bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: dus gsum 'di dag ces bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus dag la'o //
analyzed: dus gsum 'di dag ces bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus dag la'o //
translated: These three times are the past, future, and present times, as explained above.

original: ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba'i tshig gong ma'i tshig gsum char dang yang sbyar te /
analyzed: ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba'i tshig gong ma'i tshig gsum char dang yang sbyar te /
translated: The word ‚Äúperfected‚Äù is to be connected with the three previous words:

original: bdag gi don la ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / gzhan gyi don la ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi don la ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩde la bdag yongs su smin par 'gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: bdag gi don la ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / gzhan gyi don la ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi don la ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya bar sbyar ro // de la bdag yongs su smin par 'gyur pa 'am /
translated: perfected by nonattachment to one‚Äôs own aim, perfected by nonattachment to the aims of others, and perfected by nonattachment to the aim of enlightenment.

original: bdag la phan par 'gyur ba'i don ni bdag gi don te /
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'gyur ba'i don ni bdag gi don te /
translated: Here, one‚Äôs own aim is the aim of one‚Äôs own benefit or welfare.

original: de yang spangs pa dang sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis @146b so ;
analyzed: de yang spangs pa dang sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis @146b so ;
translated: It is twofold, having the character of abandonment and of realization.

original: / de la spangs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: / de la spangs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Abandonment is threefold:

original: nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / sdug bsngal spang ba dang / shin tu spang ba'o //üîΩde la nyon mongs pa spang ba ni 'jig rten gyi lam sa gong ma la zhi bar lta zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / sdug bsngal spang ba dang / shin tu spang ba'o // de la nyon mongs pa spang ba ni 'jig rten gyi lam sa gong ma la zhi bar lta zhing /
translated: It is the abandonment of the afflictions, the abandonment of suffering, and the complete abandonment.üîΩAmong them, the abandonment of the afflictions is the complete elimination of the afflictions up to the base of nothingness by the mundane path, which views the higher stage as peace and the lower stage as faulty.

original: sa 'og ma la skyon du lta bas cung zad med pa'i skye mched man chad kyis nyon mongs pa thad cig rtse bcil ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyang ma lus par bton pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma la skyon du lta bas cung zad med pa'i skye mched man chad kyis nyon mongs pa thad cig rtse bcil ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyang ma lus par bton pa'o //
translated: And it is the complete removal of the latent propensities of the afflictions such as attachment by the supramundane path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: de la sdug bsngal spangs pa ni ngan song gsum du skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / khams gsum du skye ba'i sdug bsngal ma lus par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal spangs pa ni ngan song gsum du skye ba'i sdug bsngal dang / khams gsum du skye ba'i sdug bsngal ma lus par spangs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the abandonment of suffering is the complete abandonment of the suffering of birth in the three lower miserable realms and the suffering of birth in the three realms.

original: shin tu spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spangs pa de dag lan cig spangs nas phyis ci nas kyang de'i sems kyi rgyud la mi skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal spangs pa de dag lan cig spangs nas phyis ci nas kyang de'i sems kyi rgyud la mi skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: Very abandonment is the abandonment of the afflictions and suffering, having abandoned them once, one acts so that they will not arise again in one's mindstream.

original: de la sgrub pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are also two kinds of practice:

original: 'jig rten gyi bde ba sgrub pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bde ba sgrub pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba sgrub pa'o //
translated: practice for mundane happiness and practice for supramundane happiness.

original: 'jig rten gyi bde ba sgrub pa ni ji srid du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba ma thob kyi bar du lha dang mi'i bde 'gror skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bde ba sgrub pa ni ji srid du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba ma thob kyi bar du lha dang mi'i bde 'gror skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: Practice for mundane happiness is that which causes one to be born in happy rebirths among gods and humans until one attains supramundane happiness.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Supramundane happiness is also of two kinds:

original: bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa'o //
translated: with remainder and without remainder.

original: de la bla na yod pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la brten nas phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma yang ma lus pa spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de la bla na yod pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la brten nas phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma yang ma lus pa spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob bo //
translated: The inferior is the attainment of nirvana, which is the abandonment of the remaining aggregates and also the complete abandonment of the remaining aggregates, based on the vehicles of the disciples and the solitary sages.

original: bla na med pa ni theg pa chen po la brten nas bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rten du gyur pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'o //üîΩsems can gzhan yongs su smin par byas pa 'am /
analyzed: bla na med pa ni theg pa chen po la brten nas bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rten du gyur pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'o // sems can gzhan yongs su smin par byas pa 'am /
translated: The superior is the attainment of nonabiding nirvana, which is the basis for the perfection of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô aims, based on the universal vehicle.

original: gzhan la phan par byas pa'i don ni gzhan gyi don te /
analyzed: gzhan la phan par byas pa'i don ni gzhan gyi don te /
translated: The aim of others is the aim of benefiting others,

original: de yang spang ba dang sgrub pa la bkod pa gong ma bzhin du rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang spang ba dang sgrub pa la bkod pa gong ma bzhin du rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: which is the establishment of others in the abandonment and the realization, as described above.

original: byang chub nyid don dam pas na byang chub kyi don to //
analyzed: byang chub nyid don dam pas na byang chub kyi don to //
translated: Enlightenment is the ultimate, and thus it is the aim of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sgras 'dir byang chub rnam pa gsum la bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sgras 'dir byang chub rnam pa gsum la bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúenlightenment‚Äù should be understood here as referring to the three kinds of enlightenment.

original: de dag ni 'phags pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i @147a * //
analyzed: de dag ni 'phags pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro // yang na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i @147a * //
translated: Because they are the fruits of the noble ones.

original: phyir 'phags pa'i lam sgom par byed pa ni byang chub kyi don ces bya'o //üîΩma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan dang byang chub kyi don rnam pa gsum char la yang dngos por 'dzin pa med cing /
analyzed: phyir 'phags pa'i lam sgom par byed pa ni byang chub kyi don ces bya'o // ma chags pas yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan dang byang chub kyi don rnam pa gsum char la yang dngos por 'dzin pa med cing /
translated: Or else, the cultivation of the noble path is for the sake of enlightenment, in order to perfect the qualities of the Buddha, such as the powers, the fearlessnesses, and the unique qualities.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis mthar phyin par byed pa de ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis mthar phyin par byed pa de ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The perfection of the practice is due to non-attachment. The meaning of this is that one brings it to completion by means of the purity of the three spheres, without grasping at things in any of the three aspects of enlightenment, i.e. oneself, another, or enlightenment.üîΩThis is the meaning of the above statement.
